Project.Name: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)
Project.Title: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)

Task.Name: SAP Activate for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape)
Task.Notes: This Roadmap is intended to guide the implementation team through the SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation. It is comprised of Phases, Deliverables, and Tasks in accordance with the SAP Activate methodology. In addition, accelerators are linked to the relevant deliverables and tasks making them easy to consume when they are needed. The Deliverables and Tasks are listed in sequential order based on the activity starting time. However, parallelization might be necessary to expedite the implementation. This roadmap covers the implementation of the core SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution. Projects that include SAP or third-party integrations may alter the procedures. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) See the Content tab for the structure breakdown of this implementation roadmap.View the Getting Started with SAP Roadmap Viewer presentation for roadmap assistance.Review the latest release notes.Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Projects in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system landscape Onboarding Presentation.Discover how customers leveraged SAP Activate to achieve successful implementations by reading their stories here.Check out our SAP Activate Minute videos through our playlist.Have questions about SAP Activate? Visit the SAP Activate Community page to find answers or post questions.Release Date: November 17, 2025.

Task.Name: Discover
Task.Notes: The purpose of the Discover phase is to understand the functionality of SAP S/4HANA Cloud and how the solution can bring benefits to the business. Discover Phase Activities: User enablement via the trial system Solution scoping via the Digital Discovery Assessment tool Value discovery By the end of this phase, the implementation scope, overall project timelines and target solution model are set and the implementation project is ready to begin.

Task.Name: Introduction to SAP Business Suite
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to help you familiarize yourself with the SAP Business Suite. It integrates SAP cloud ERP applications, SAP Business AI, and SAP Business Data Cloud to deliver exceptional business value, all powered by the SAP Business Technology Platform. Focused on built-in innovation, AI agents and context-rich data are embedded into SAP's core cloud ERP and line-of-business applications. This unified approach to enterprise management helps organizations scale and succeed more easily than ever before. Cloud Journey: Customers can move to the cloud securely and smoothly, leveraging powerful cloud-based business management software with embedded intelligence, real-time insights, and advanced technologies that enhance compliance and build business resilience. Whether starting a new cloud journey or modernizing an existing ERP system, customers can follow tailored transition paths that align with their business goals and technology needs. Experiencing SAP Solutions: To experience SAP solutions firsthand, customers can leverage various options such as live and on-demand demos, free trials with time-limited access, guided test drives, proof of concept initiatives, and community engagement. These opportunities allow customers to explore key features and functionalities, test configurations, and gather insights to make informed decisions about adopting SAP solutions, all while minimizing risks and maximizing potential benefits.

Task.Name: Understand your SAP Cloud Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand and learn about the cloud journey to SAP Business Suite. For customers embarking on a new cloud journey or seeking to modernize their existing ERP system, there are tailored transition paths available: RISE with SAP: customers can modernize their SAP ERP and unlock business value by leveraging the full potential of SAP Business Suite. RISE with SAP is a comprehensive transformation journey to help SAP ERP customers transition to SAP Business Suite, to stay ahead of competitors, and continuously innovate. GROW with SAP: customers can ease their path to Cloud ERP adoption with predictability and speed. SAP offers a set of proven services, tools, and methodologies designed to help customers rapidly implement SAP Business Suite with a streamlined, scalable approach. Procedure for GROW with SAP: Review GROW with SAP to learn more about adoption acceleration services, community, and learning for SAP Cloud ERP. Understand the fundamentals of the GROW with SAP. Review Onboarding Resource Center and explore a variety of resources, access key guidelines and join tailored webcast sessions to gain insights into your specific solution. Procedure for RISE with SAP: Review the RISE with SAP Overview accelerator to learn more about RISE with SAP. Understand the fundamentals of the RISE with SAP Methodology and the onboarding experience, clean core success plan, and quality gates by reviewing the following Webinar RISE with SAP Webinar Rise into the Future: Transform with confidence using RISE with SAP Methodology. Start your RISE with SAP journey with the Cloud ERP Private package by reviewing RISE with SAP - Get Started Procedure Note(s): The accelerator provides detailed insights into various aspects of the RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP The webinar offers a comprehensive understanding of the methodology and onboarding process.

Task.Name: Review the SAP Business Suite Offering
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand and learn about the SAP Business Suite offering. The SAP Business Suite offering includes a range of SAP cloud ERP applications, SAP Business AI, and SAP Business Data Cloud, seamlessly integrated to deliver exceptional business value. This powerful suite is supported by SAP Business Technology Platform. Procedure: Review the SAP Business Suite accelerator to learn more about the solutions offered with SAP. The page provides more information on the: Solutions Operations Methodology How to Buy Additional Resources Understand the fundamentals of the SAP Business Suite solutions for teams. Find the right Cloud ERP applications for your business.

Task.Name: Try SAP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to explore the latest versions of the business software you rely on, with the goal of improving efficiency, reducing risk, and supporting sustainable operations. You can evaluate various try-out options, such as demo videos, product tours, basic trials, and advanced trials, to identify the best fit for your needs. Procedure: Visit the Try SAP website. Explore Demo Videos - Browse a comprehensive library of product demonstrations covering various lines of business, company sizes, industries, and more. Take a Product Tour - Engage in a guided, step-by-step tour to see how SAP solutions can drive business efficiency and profitability. Access Basic Trials - Interact with SAP software in a hands-on, guided environment that showcases key workflows and features using sample data and limited administrative access. Access Advanced Trials - Utilize a test environment for a limited time, with broader access to features and capabilities, allowing you to experiment with your own data.

Task.Name: SAP Concur Entitlement
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to understand and request the SAP Concur entitlement with your Account Executive prior to finalizing the SAP Business Suite/GROW contract. It is essential that both the SAP Business Suite and GROW Premium form, along with the SAP Concur entitlement order form, are signed at the same time to guarantee that customers receive all associated benefits. After the SAP Concur entitlement is claimed and the contract is signed, customers can proceed to activate their entitlement by reaching out to the SAP Concur Account Executive.

Task.Name: Discuss SAP Concur entitlement with customers
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to discuss SAP Concur entitlement with the customer before contract sign. When engaging with the customer on the Finance Premium deal, discuss the SAP Concur entitlement with the customer. Both the GROW Premium order form and the SAP Concur entitlement order form must be signed at the same time to ensure customers receive all entitlement benefits. It is your responsibility to manage this process; failing to sign the SAP Concur entitlement alongside the SAP Order Form results in forfeiture of entitlements, with no chance for reversal. Procedure for Direct Deals: Submit an email to DirectConcurEntitlements@sap.com with the following information: Subject: Include Customer Name Body: Customer: Opportunity: Main Quote: Contract Start Date: Contract End Date: Type: Direct Sold by SAP Status: Procedure for Partner-Led Deals: Submit an email to PartnerConcurEntitlements@sap.com with the following information: Subject: Include Partner Name / Customer Name Body: Customer: Partner: Opportunity: Main Quote: Contract Start Date: Contract End Date: Type: Status: Close Date: Procedure Note(s): Refer to additional documentation in the SAP Digital Library for more information.

Task.Name: Request SAP Concur
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to secure the SAP Concur solution that your organization is entitled to under the SAP contract you intend to sign. If you're interested in claiming your SAP Concur entitlement, please contact the Account Executive to ensure that the SAP Concur entitlement contract is included when the SAP contract is finalized and sent for signing. Procedure: Share your interest of claiming your Concur Entitlement with the Account Executive When SAP Contract is provided, review and sign the SAP Concur entitlement at the same time. Follow the steps in Getting Started with SAP Concur - Next Steps once the contract has been signed, to get started with SAP Concur. Procedure Note(s): The SAP Concur entitlement contract must be signed simultaneously with the SAP Contract.

Task.Name: Discovery Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to document and capture project scope, through the SAP Digital Discovery, to generate a scoping report. The report will be used as a project scoping reference during the phases of the Implementation. The Digital Discovery is a detailed assessment process that is used in the Discover phase to aid the project scoping process and to help position the customer for a successful implementation. The Digital Discovery Assessment App is used during the Digital Discovery to: Provide clear visibility and insight into the current available capabilities of your SAP solution(s). Centralize documentation and validation of business scope and integration requirements of SAP and non-SAP solutions within the customer’s landscape Document additional requirements identified in the customer’s landscape Generate a detailed report, that is used to validate functional and integration scopes, outstanding questions captured during the detailed Digital Discovery Assessment workshop. Process Overview: Customer will receive an invitation email to join his/her assessment on the Digital Discovery Assessment tool. A detailed scoping assessment is created for the customer in the Digital Discovery Assessment app which can be edited online before, during, and after the Digital Discovery Assessment workshop. The Account Team provides an enablement session of the Digital Discovery Assessment app. All key stakeholders are invited into the customer’s scoping assessment and can open the Digital Discovery Assessment app via the link provided in the invitation email, as soon as they have an approved user to access the tool. Customer with or without help of SAP and/or partners captures the systems in their landscape, and selects scope items for each functional area in the app. The customer can ask a question to SAP or take notes per business process in the app as well. Check the Accel ID = S4H_320. Customer with or without help of SAP and/or partners adds any additional integration requirements and selects relevant scope items. Generate a report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app that can be handed over to the Implementation team to use as the basis for the project's scoping.

Task.Name: Executing a Digital Discovery Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for all key stakeholders to gain access to the Digital Discovery Assessment tool and to capture the customer’s scope. The Account Team and all key stakeholders will use the Digital Discovery Assessment app to capture and continuously discuss core Cloud ERP best practices in a centralized, web-based, collaborative approach. Various members of the account team will work with the customer to define relevant business capabilities; identify integrations and extensibility needed in the customer’s landscape; leverage Q&A sections; capture notes; and document any additional requirements specific to the customer’s move to the SAP Business Suite. Prerequisites: Confirmation from an Account Executive that all key stakeholders have been invited to join the Digital Discovery Assessment App Key stakeholders have been enabled on how to use the Digital Discovery Assessment App Provided to the Account Executive (AE), the results from Process Signavio Insights if the customer is already an SAP customer with the required license which has gone through the assessment. These tools provide a mapping between processes used by the company per company code based on their historical data which can be mapped to Core ERP SAP Best Practices For Retail processes, review Accel ID = S4H_2032. The outcome can be used as an input for this task. Apps Used: Digital Discovery Assessment Procedure: Use the Digital Discovery Registration to self-register for access for the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Document all customer requirements by using the best practices scope items available in the Digital Discovery Assessment app Select the scope item ID and review the scope item description in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator, which contains the SAP best Practices, to gain further understanding of the scope item. Check the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items.xlsx Document additional functional, integration, and enhancement requirements, for the Digital Discovery Assessment app. Validate localizations and languages documented and chosen. Review the end-to-end business processes, solutions, line of business scope, countries and languages in scope, and additional functional, integration and enhancement requirements. Make sure the end-to-end solution is consistent Note(s): Links to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator scope items are embedded in the Digital Discovery Assessment app. However, SAP Signavio Process Navigator can be used to review scope item’s descriptions and business benefits. For customers considering SAP S/4HANA Cloud for retail, fashion, and vertical business, request the Accelerated Retail Assessment service from SAP to accelerate the evaluation of industry-specific solutions processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Localization, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Generate Digital Discovery Report
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to generate a report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app after the customer scoping is finalized. This report serves as the foundation for determining the project scope during the various phases of implementation. The report provides detailed insights into the percentage of scope items selected for each functional business area. It also includes an individual selection of best practice scope items chosen, integration and additional requirements captured, and questions raised by the customer regarding the selected scope and additional requirements. The report further contains the corresponding answers from the Account Team. Apps Used: Digital Discovery Assessment Procedure: Generate the Digital Discovery report from the Digital Discovery Assessment app . Hand the report over to the Implementation team to use as the basis for the project's scope. Note(s): To upload the list of selected scopes in the Manage Scope app in SAP Cloud ALM with your project, request an export in Excel format. To import the list of selected scopes in the Define Scope app in SAP Central Business Configuration, request an export in JSON format.

Task.Name: Execute the Cloud Mindset
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is evaluating the organization's readiness for the cloud subscription business model. The results of this assessment help raise awareness among business stakeholders about key organizational change management (OCM) topics and activities. Procedure: Review the Customer Organizational Readiness for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Whitepaper to gain foundational insights. Watch the Cloud Mindset Video to understand the mindset shift required for cloud adoption. Read the Cloud Mindset Now Blog for additional perspective. Distribute and complete the Cloud Mindset Assessment_External.pptx and Cloud Mindset Assessment.xlsx accelerators. Review the assessment results to determine risk levels and recommended actions. Procedure Note(s): Engage with SAP or the implementation partner prior to starting a project to assess OCM initiatives.

Task.Name: Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request and receive access to the cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud landscape, the SAP Cloud ALM and the SAP Central Business Configuration tenants. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions.

Task.Name: Order Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to order the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud landscape. The system provides access to an environment with the following capabilities: A Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system with a tenant for customizing and configuration and a tenant for developer extensibility (ABAP environment). Access to an SAP Central Business Configuration tenant to activate and manage business configuration for the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenants. Access to an SAP Cloud ALM tenant to manage the entire landscape. The ordering process is offered by the SAP Non-Commercial Licensing. Refer to the SAP Partner Portal - How to Guides & FAQs accelerator. Once the order is complete, partners have access to the entitlement of the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud and can start requesting the different tenants included in the landscape. Procedure: Access the SAP Partner Edge Demo Landscape and Click on the "Login" button. If you already have a profile, you don't need to create a new one. A new page will appear asking you to create a profile. Select the necessary options and complete your profile. Follow the instructions in the following onboarding video Accel ID = S4H_1037. Refer to this presentation S/4HANA Cloud Test, Demo and Development - Presentation to follow the process. Review the additional instructions in the Accel ID = S4H_1039.

Task.Name: Verify Authorizations in SAP for Me
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify authorizations to access certain dashboards in SAP for Me. SAP for Me is instrumental in triggering the provisioning of different tenants and systems (Systems & Provisioning dashboard) and for monitoring their status in subsequent tasks. Additionally, it enables the creation of SAP Cases, such as support tickets or service requests (Services & Support dashboard), directly from the platform. If any of these authorizations are missing, users should identify which authorizations are needed and work with their company’s SAP administrator to obtain them. Prerequisites: SAP Support user (S-user) is available. SAP Universal ID was created. Procedure: Review Accel ID = IBP_010. This document guides customers from the cloud contract signature to the first access to SAP for Me. Access SAP for Me and ensure you have access to the following dashboards: Validate access to the Systems & Provisioning Dashboard. Verify that you can see the ‘Edit Cloud Data’ and ‘Trigger system provisioning’ cards. The cards let you request new systems or cloud tenants. Validate access to the Services & Support Dashboard. Verify you can report or create a new incident/case. Validate access to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator or navigate to the Accel ID = S4H_176. If you still have trouble with accessing the dashboards, create a support ticket by following the steps in Note 1296527 - How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support) - SAP for Me or use one of the support paths to request assistance from Accel ID = S4H_2367. Manage your S-User authorizations. An administrator (or, for SAP partners, a Partner Security Manager) can generate S-user IDs and assign permissions that are required to fulfill certain tasks in SAP for Me. This is done on the SAP for Me Users & Contacts dashboard. Procedure Note(s): An SAP S-user ID is required to access the SAP For Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to gain access. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP For Me, customers can send an email to SAPforMe@sap.com. Customers can contact a local SAP Customer Interaction Center via phone, email, or chat for all additional questions or feedback. SAP for Me is used in subsequent tasks to trigger the provisioning of different tenants and systems and check their status. SAP Cases (support tickets or service requests) can be created directly from SAP for Me. SAP Signavio Process Navigator required to review the SAP Best Practices content related to the scope items is accessible via SAP for Me.

Task.Name: Request Cloud Test, Demo, and Development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system access via the bundled provisioning in SAP for Me. The Initial Admin user makes the request in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the access instructions. Partners will have the option to request multiple tenants within a single request: SAP Cloud ALM, Central Business Configuration tenants and Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud system are included in the bundled provisioning. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. The bundled provisioning request is associated with the Partner Demo Customizing tenant, and the provisioning of the Partner Demo Development is automatically triggered after this. Prerequisite: The Initial Admin user has been identified and has the right authorizations in SAP for Me Procedure: Request the Bundled Provisioning in SAP for Me via Accel ID = S4H_889. Locate the 'Partner Customizing tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click 'Start Provisioning. Select the appropriate dependent products if applicable, review and follow the instructions in the pop-up windows for next steps. Once the appropriate selections have been made and all details reviewed for each tenant, select ‘Submit’. The request will trigger the bundled system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'Initial Admin user' when the system/tenants are available. Note: The bundled provisioning request is associated with the Partner Demo Customizing tenant, and the provisioning of the Partner Demo Development is automatically triggered after this. Procedure Note(s): Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support and cloud editions. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing Help - SAP Cloud ALM or the Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM task. Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system provisioning, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration, via Accel ID = S4H_1051. For additional scenario information related to the required SAP Cloud Identity Services Administration, see the Accel ID = ACT_021. You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Partner dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Access Partner Demonstration Landscape
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the Request Cloud test, demo, and development for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the SAP Cloud ALM tenant, and the SAP Central Business Configuration tenant. The System Administrator (or the partner contact) will receive various emails once the provisioning has been made via SAP for Me. Each email will provide a set of instructions and information on how to access the various tenants. Prerequisite: Order Partner Demonstration Landscape Request SAP Cloud ALM Tenant SAP Central Business Configuration provisioned. Procedure: Review the 3619697 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 in a 3-system landscape: Release Restriction Note accelerator. Follow the instructions in the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator, in the section below, to access the systems. Procedure Note(s): Partners can develop ABAP Cloud extensions in a Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape and provide them to customers SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) that is not connected to their current landscape. Refer to task Develop Cloud Extensions. If partners plan to use their namespace, ensure that they have created and installed the namespace as mentioned in Accel ID = S4H_1865.

Task.Name: Develop Cloud Extensions (Partner)
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the partners to develop ABAP cloud extensions intended for consumption by the Customer. Multi-off Delivery are extensions built in the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape and deployed on to customers SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system target landscape that isn't connected to the 1-system landscape. Using Multi-Off delivery, partners can develop ABAP Cloud extensions and use the Git-Enabled Change and Transport System (gCTS) to deploy them to the customers S/4HANA Cloud landscape. Using Scalable Delivery, partners can develop ABAP Cloud extensions in the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, three-system landscape and provide them to customers as add-on products. Customers can install and consume these add-ons in their own SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system target landscape. Prerequisite: Multi-off Delivery Received and accessed the Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud 1-system landscape Read all the prerequisites under ‘General Information’ section of accelerator SAP Help - Developing ABAP Extensions Using Multi-Off Delivery Scalable Delivery Received and accessed Cloud test, demo, and development for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, three-system landscape Read the prerequisites under the ‘General Information’ section of accelerator SAP Help - Developing ABAP Extensions Using Scalable Delivery Procedure: Multi-off Delivery Develop ABAP Cloud extensions by reading and following the step-by-step guide in the SAP Help - Developing ABAP Extensions Using Multi-Off Delivery. Below is a summary of the activities: Setup for Multi-Off Delivery Develop Cloud extensions Test the Cloud extensions Deliver the Cloud extension Patch and update the Cloud extensions. Troubleshooting Scalable Delivery Develop ABAP Cloud extensions by reading and following the step-by-step guide in the SAP Help - Developing ABAP Extensions Using Scalable Delivery . Below is a summary of the activities: Setup for Scalable Delivery Extension Development Testing the Extension Delivering the Extension Patching and Updating the Extension Procedure Note(s): If partners plan to use their namespace, ensure that they have created and installed the namespace as mentioned in Accel ID = S4H_1865.

Task.Name: Application Value and Scoping
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to gain a clear understanding of the selected SAP solution(s) and assess the value they will deliver to the customer's business. After establishing the overall innovation strategy and high-level road map, customers should evaluate the impact of the solution on their current business processes. This assessment forms the basis for defining customer-specific application scoping, including the choice of implementation scenario, identification of mandatory and optional solution capabilities, and initial planning for adoption. The defined scope will serve as key input for the Fit-to-Standard workshops during the Explore phase. Collaboration with key business stakeholders throughout this process is essential to ensure the scope and expected value align with both strategic goals and operational needs.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration, Operations and Support
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Joule

Task.Name: Discover the Value of GROW with SAP for Your Company
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task it to learn about GROW with SAP and discover the value it can bring to your company. Procedure: Explore the GROW with SAP accelerator to understand the capabilities of the SAP Business Suite products including its features, business benefits, and how intelligent technologies and automation can help transform our business processes. Consult with your SAP Sales Representative or SAP Partner to get more details on the feature scope description and entitlements for Base or Premium your package(s) subscription.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility

Task.Name: Perform a Digital Value Discovery Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform a value discovery workshop using an online game like tool that is powerful, interactive and hands-on, to uncover value of SAP solutions in a fun and engaging way. Prerequisites: Your SAP team has created the online, virtual workshop for your company and send you invitation. Procedure: Review the email and accept the workshop invitation to participate in the workshop Each participant can record pain points, strategic priorities for the company from the line of business that she/he represents. Reference the SAP Persona Value Discovery function for samples. Explore vision, strategy, industry trends and analysis for respective industry. Data collected from participants will be transferred to SAP Value Lifecycle Manager tools for Move the Needle, Benchmarking Report, etc. Build own case in modular approach to discover SAP solution capabilities based on Benchmarked Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Primary Value Drivers. Review SAP solution capability information to confirm relevancy. Create customer specific Innovation Map for the relevant solution capabilities with rough timeline (i.e. short, medium vs. long term), highlighting your current and future roadmap with clear owners assigned to each capability item. Transfer data to SAP Value Lifecycle Manager to create a business case. Generate a Point of View document that summarizes all the findings from the workshop. Procedure Note(s): Usage of SAP Value Lifecycle Manager tool is required when building own case in Module 1 of the modular approach. SAP Account Executive will be engaged towards the end of the of workshop. Customer can also submit questions to SAP Value Advisory and Solution Advisory during the workshop.

Task.Name: Perform Benchmarking Assessment for Value Baselining
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform a business process baseline, with the Line of Business heads, prior to the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This analysis will help to determine the scope for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation and prioritize the implementation of the scope. The results from this baseline will be used later in the Run phase to compare and to track the actual improvement in process maturity and key performance indicators. The SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment includes key business performance metrics and best practices for all process areas covered by SAP S/4HANA, such as: Procurement, Sales, Service, R&D Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Asset Management, Finance, Human Resources, and Information Technology. Upon participation, you will receive a personalized scorecard in real-time showcasing the Key Performance Indicator (KPI) analysis and process maturity gap on best practices in comparison to industry peers. Procedure: Review the SAP Performance Benchmarking Assessment - Video Introduction accelerator to become self-enabled on the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. Self-enable on the output of the Benchmarking exercise by reviewing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment - Sample.pdf . Self-enable on how to fill an assessment by reviewing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment - Tutorial . Register for the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment Registration . Fill out the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment - Overview.pdf for further step-by-step information on how to fill out the assessment. Download the results and store them in a central location that can be referred to after the implementation. Procedure Notes: For any questions about the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment or SAP’s Performance Benchmarking Program, please contact valuemanagement@sap.com.

Task.Name: Create a Strategic Road Map and Value Case
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to derive a strategic roadmap for continuous improvement of the Cloud solution(s) considering the findings from previous tasks. The value case is based on identified business benefits leveraging the Cloud solution(s). All documents should be uploaded and stored in a central location so information can be shared across the project team. The road map should also consider having new organizational model (i.e. Help Desk, Key User, Customer Center of Expertise) to manage all SAP-related topics in order to achieve company’s goals and objectives. Prerequisites: There is a documented implementation roadmap available. The definition of the road map is based on key findings from previous tasks, identified architecture impact, and consideration of parallel initiatives and projects. Procedure: Agree on business transformation initiatives, and map the value contribution to the segmented areas. Compose a consolidated strategic roadmap for the implementation of the Cloud solution(s). Agree on requirements and conditions for the business case calculation. Define Key Performance Indicators (KPIs), and link them to the identified value drivers. Determine the value driver. Determine the cost driver. Review Customer CoE Strategy Governance and Organization.pdf to understand the overall strategy and governance and the importance of having a Customer Center of Expertise organization. Procedure Note(s): Review the Accel ID = S4H_2565, a four-step approach to aligning business value from vision to post-deployment of Digital Adoption across the enterprise - focused on strategic priorities and maximizing the quantitative and qualitative return on investment. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support

Task.Name: Define the Implementation Strategy
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to define an implementation strategy for functional enhancements, based on the “to-be state” of the business architecture. The definition of the implementation strategy should cover aspects like: Should I re-shape the existing landscape when introducing the new functionality? Consider two-tier? What are dependencies, and what is the ideal sequence in the context of the overall release plan? What is the strategy for custom development of SAP Fiori UI’s and other custom objects? Are there any updates required in the security strategy? What is the Strategy to consume SAP Business AI capabilities including Joule - SAP’s copilot available across SAP applications, Embedded AI capabilities across SAP Applications and AI infused Application Development, Process Automation and Data Management with SAP BTP Those questions can be addressed jointly with SAP, by using a structured SAP Best Practices approach: Define the right set of decision criteria, and rank the options per criteria. The strategy in general should be driven by business needs. The more business critical a system is, the more serious to take the IT constraints. There is a document available which documents and explains the customer specific implementation strategy. Prerequisites: There is a draft version of the “to-be” state of the business architecture available already. Procedure: Define the implementation strategy. Document the results. Upload all documents to a central location so information can be shared across the project team. Procedure Notes: Learn how SAP Cloud ALM can help support the implementation journey by reviewing the content in the SAP Cloud ALM – Support Portal Home accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Joule

Task.Name: Select the Right Cloud Partner
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to find the right SAP Partner for the SAP cloud implementation. The key to a successful implementation is a partner’s understanding and embracing of SAP Activate for S/4HANA Cloud and a deep solution knowledge in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, proven through a fully certified, dedicated delivery team. Procedure: Review the Partner Selection Guide for your solution in the accelerator list to get more insight on the process of selecting the right partner for a Cloud-centric implementation. Find the right partner via Accel ID = S4H_1005. The search tool provides customers with an easy-to-use interface that searches through SAP's directory of thousands of SAP partners, to help them find the best match for their needs.

Task.Name: Determine Functional Fit of SAP S/4HANA Cloud (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)(Partner)
Task.Notes: The objective of this task is to evaluate how well SAP S/4HANA Cloud aligns with the functional requirements of the current end-to-end procedures implemented using SAP Business ByDesign. Procedure: Review the attached accelerator Best fit of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for SMB to compare the coverage of existing end-to-end scenarios on SAP Business ByDesign with that of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Solution. The scenario coverage map provides the percentage of coverage on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition broken down by end-to-end business scenarios Additional license requirements have been called out where end-to-end coverage can be achieved through other solutions. Extensions and Addons have not been considered for the coverage analysis.

Task.Name: Organizational Change Management Overview
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish a solid foundation for supporting an upcoming SAP cloud implementation through well-suited change management activities. Developing comprehensive expertise in handling the people aspects of a cloud implementation prior to the project start enables a realistic evaluation of both the organizational change management’s added value and the corresponding effort involved. A shared understanding of these aspects within the project team allows informed decision-making regarding the early-stage configuration of change management. This, in turn, facilitates a prompt initiation of change management activities, aligning with the fast pace of technological advancements in the cloud project.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Solution Adoption

Task.Name: Understand the Fundamentals of Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a shared perspective on the upcoming cloud implementation as a holistic business transformation, emphasizing the systematic handling of people-related challenges. This involves gaining fundamental insights into user adoption, understanding the usual progression of user adoption during an implementation project, and recognizing the importance of user adoption post go-live. This knowledge is crucial for understanding the concept of organizational change management and its benefits for the cloud project. Additionally, it enables a clear distinction between organizational change management and project management, clarifying the specific contributions each discipline makes to the overall success of the cloud implementation. Procedure: Familiarize yourself with the people side of cloud projects by consulting the explanations and videos available in the Why is the People Side of Cloud Projects Important accelerator. Explore the concept of user adoption by referring to the explanations and videos provided in the Why Does User Adoption Matter in Cloud Projects accelerator. Understand the role of organizational change management by reviewing the explanations and videos presented in the What is the Role of Organizational Change Management in SAP Cloud Projects accelerator.

Task.Name: Comprehend the Approach to Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to acquire an overview of the fundamental principles of organizational change management and the various dimensions of change management that need attention when supporting the people aspects of a cloud implementation. This facilitates a broader perspective on organizational management that extends beyond simply applying tools and assists in managing expectations towards change management. Furthermore, gaining more detailed information about the specific deliverables encompassed within these dimensions offers initial insights into the specific activities required to support the SAP cloud implementation project. Procedure: Understand the principles of organizational change management by referring to the section “Organizational Change Management as an Attitude” in the What is SAP's Understanding of Organizational Change Management accelerator. Review the How is SAP's Organizational Change Management Framework Structured accelerator in order to: Gain insight into the organizational change management approach through the “Introduction of SAP's Organizational Change Management Framework." Enhance the understanding of the six dimensions of the approach.

Task.Name: Provide Information on Organizational Change Management to Project Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to raise awareness about the importance of people aspects in the cloud project and to ensure that relevant project stakeholders have a foundational understanding of organizational change management. These stakeholders include decision makers, leaders of affected business units, as well as project managers and team members. Particularly in larger implementation projects with diverse project roles and multiple roll-out phases, it is recommended to identify specific target groups and determine the particular change management knowledge each group needs. Given that the project team set-up may not be finalized at this stage, integrating information on change management into the project onboarding material is a viable option. Procedure: Choose the organizational change management content to be shared with relevant stakeholders, consulting the Discover Organizational Change Management for SAP Cloud Projects accelerator. Determine the delivery approach (e.g., info session, emails with links, onboarding material) and document decisions using the Knowledge Transfer Tracker accelerator. Distribute content and provide status updates, referencing the Knowledge Transfer Tracker accelerator. Procedure Note(s): WalkMe is a digital adoption platform that helps organizations enhance user onboarding and enablement throughout their transformation journey with SAP solutions. It offers interactive guides, walkthroughs, and valuable insights into user behavior with targeted applications. Explore how WalkMe works by joining the WalkMe Interactive Demo and experiencing its features in action. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe.

Task.Name: Prepare
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to provide the initial planning and preparation for the project. In this phase, the project is started, plans are finalized, project team is assigned, and work is under way to start the project optimally. Prepare Phase Activities: Define project goals, a high-level scope, and a project plan Identify and quantify business value objectives Secure executive sponsorship Establish project standards, organization and governance Define and secure approval for the implementation/upgrade strategy Define roles and responsibilities for the project team Validate the project objectives Establish project management, tracking, and reporting mechanisms for value delivery Begin self-enablement Receive and access the Cloud Starter System Kick off the project

Task.Name: Getting Started with your SAP Implementation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to initiate your project journey using the SAP Activate Methodology and to familiarize yourself with the overall process. It provides an overview of the SAP Activate approach, detailing its phases, workstreams, and deliverables. It also highlights the value of interactive learning modules to understand the process involved in deploying various SAP solutions. Additionally, it offers access to essential onboarding resources, including webinars and documentation, to ensure a seamless beginning.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Join Embedded Launch Activities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for participation in the Embedded Launch Activities (EmLA) within SAP customer onboarding. EmLA is an onboarding service included with your GROW with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition subscription. It offers a structured onboarding experience centered on best practices and guided enablement to ensure a smooth implementation, supporting your team's success in deploying and adopting SAP solutions. Phases include the following: Attend the Welcome and Introduction workshop, where the main objective is to ensure the customer has received expected communications from SAP and can access the systems. In the case you have not been contacted by an SAP Onboarding Advisor, please reach out to your account manager. This workshop offers insights and guidance on the onboarding journey and plan, system provisioning, entitlements for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, and SAP support, including an overview of Quality Checks. Schedule your participation (either live or by watching the recording) for the 1:m onboarding sessions according your project schedule. Become familiar with the Guided Enablement offered in the Onboarding Resources Center. Procedure: Review the GROW with SAP - Onboarding Resource Center and Blog - GROW with SAP S/4HANA Onboarding - New to SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerators for additional information on the onboarding process. Explore the SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Onboarding Resource Center accelerator to gain additional information and receive further guidance on the SAP Business Technology Platform.

Task.Name: Review Overview Documentation for SAP Cloud ERP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution and SAP Activate Methodology. This task involves reviewing various accelerators to gain an understanding of the implementation journey, project practices, and provisioning processes. Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system Landscape Onboarding Presentation for an overview about SAP Activate and the implementation journey. Learn how an SAP implementation project works and how to get started by using the Accel ID = PM_218. Review the Accel ID = S4H_1051. This accelerator contains the provisioning process for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter tenants, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration tenants. Detailed steps of the provisioning process can also be found in the Technical Architecture and Infrastructure workstream. Review Multi-Country Rollout in SAP S4HANA Cloud.pptx accelerator to gain insight into SAP Activate project practices applicable to both single and multi-country deployments. Review Extensibility Guide for GROW with SAP to learn about the extensibility options. Review the release restrictions, including supported internet browser applications. See the SAP Note 3603001 - SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2508: Release Restriction Note for more details. Review the Service Level Agreement for Cloud Services accelerator for downtime and maintenance windows. Review the SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap for an overview of the upgrade process. Review, bookmark, and refer to the SAP Notes for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - FAQs collection for any questions or clarifications where you cannot find the answer in this implementation roadmap. Verify the Initial Admin User with the SAP account team. The Initial Admin User is the person who will receive communications from SAP, including system credentials and upgrade information. Procedure Note(s): If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, create an Incident/Service Request with the subject ‘Request update to the Initial Admin User' and description ‘Please change the Initial Admin User to <NAME>, <EMAIL ADDRESS>' and component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Only one person is assigned as an Initial Admin User. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the main contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as a Communication Contact. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. Refer to the Initial Access to SAP for Me task for guidance on establishing access to SAP Signavio Process Navigator and submitting support tickets.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Define Guardrails for the Implementation Project (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define strategic and program-specific goals for the customer’s cloud implementation project. Procedure: Gathering of challenges and elaboration of internal and external requirements from a business and IT perspective. Derivation of lighthouses and fields of action along the dimensions of Products / Portfolio Processes Technology and IT Organization Prioritization and scheduling of fields of action and goals using a structured method. Formulate the guardrails and design principles for customer’s cloud implementation project. Use the attached accelerator Guardrails for ByDesign Transition Project to help define the guardrails for your implementation project.

Task.Name: Supporting Tools for Implementation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish access for all team members to the tools required to support and execute the implementation. These tools may include SAP for Me, product-specific community platforms, and the SAP Learning Hub.

Task.Name: Verify Initial Admin/Technical Administrator
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify and confirm the Initial Admin user, also known as the Technical Administrator, as specified in the contract. This individual is responsible for receiving communications from SAP, including system credentials and upgrade information. Listed on the contract or sales order as the Technical Administrator, this person will serve as a super administrator or cloud administrator. For new SAP customers without any S-users, a new S-User is created and assigned to this administrator. This administrator will receive all necessary authorizations to perform SAP-related tasks on the SAP for Me portal. The responsibilities of administrators include creating additional S-user IDs, maintaining access authorizations for all users, and receiving system provisioning communication emails 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users . Prerequisite: SAP Universal ID created Procedure: Verify the Initial Admin User/Technical Administrator listed in the sales order. This user is designated to receive communications from SAP, including system credentials, and is responsible for requesting the systems. If the name is correct, proceed with the next tasks. If the name is incorrect, locate the User Onboarding Token included in the sales order and share it with the person who is fulfilling the Initial Admin role correctly. This token should be used if the technical administrator's name in the contract is incorrect. Redeem the Onboarding Token by following the User Onboarding Token site. If you are facing challenges with the token, contact the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC). For SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, please reach out to your designated SAP contact (such as your Account Executive, Customer Success Manager, or Customer Engagement Executive) to create a Sales IT direct ticket to change the IT contact person. For all other solutions, please follow the 3053848 - Directory of SAP Cloud Products and Component Areas (Who to Contact) . If you are still facing issues, contact the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC). Verify access to the SAP Universal ID Account Manager. If the customer has not yet received the S-User email, contact SAP support using the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC) If the SAP Universal ID entered is incorrect, check your company email to retrieve an existing SAP Universal ID or register an account by following the steps provided on the SAP Universal ID page. If the SAP Universal ID is correct and you want to change or reset the SAP Universal ID password, refer to the SAP Universal ID password change and reset instructions. If you still face challenges, contact the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC). Manage Cloud notification subscriptions for other users. SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications is used to add, customize, and manage subscription to Cloud Availability notifications. SAP Cloud customers can remain informed and receive timely updates regarding their SAP Cloud Services. Set up Cloud notification subscriptions for other users by following the steps in the SAP for Me Help 2896942 - How Super and Cloud Administrators manage Cloud Notification subscriptions for other users. Ensure the right authorizations are assigned. If authorizations are missing, reach out to your company's SAP Super Admin user. If unavailable, contact SAP support using the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC) . Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access. Create an SAP Universal ID. This is required to use the token. Follow the steps provided on the SAP Universal ID page. Only one token is provided per Sales Order. If the onboarding token has already been used and you need to update the Initial Admin contact, please contact the SAP Customer Interaction Center (CIC). SAP recommends creating at least two additional super administrators who can support or substitute as needed. Customers can contact their Account Executive if they have not yet received their S-User email.

Task.Name: Verify Authorizations in SAP for Me
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify authorizations to access certain dashboards in SAP for Me. SAP for Me is instrumental in triggering the provisioning of different tenants and systems (Systems & Provisioning dashboard) and for monitoring their status in subsequent tasks. Additionally, it enables the creation of SAP Cases, such as support tickets or service requests (Services & Support dashboard), directly from the platform. If any of these authorizations are missing, users should identify which authorizations are needed and work with their company’s SAP administrator to obtain them. Prerequisites: SAP Support user (S-user) is available. SAP Universal ID was created. Procedure: Review Accel ID = IBP_010. This document guides customers from the cloud contract signature to the first access to SAP for Me. Access SAP for Me and ensure you have access to the following dashboards: Validate access to the Systems & Provisioning Dashboard. Verify that you can see the ‘Edit Cloud Data’ and ‘Trigger system provisioning’ cards. The cards let you request new systems or cloud tenants. Validate access to the Services & Support Dashboard. Verify you can report or create a new incident/case. Validate access to the SAP Signavio Process Navigator or navigate to the Accel ID = S4H_176. If you still have trouble with accessing the dashboards, create a support ticket by following the steps in Note 1296527 - How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support) - SAP for Me or use one of the support paths to request assistance from Accel ID = S4H_2367. Manage your S-User authorizations. An administrator (or, for SAP partners, a Partner Security Manager) can generate S-user IDs and assign permissions that are required to fulfill certain tasks in SAP for Me. This is done on the SAP for Me Users & Contacts dashboard. Procedure Note(s): An SAP S-user ID is required to access the SAP For Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to gain access. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP For Me, customers can send an email to SAPforMe@sap.com. Customers can contact a local SAP Customer Interaction Center via phone, email, or chat for all additional questions or feedback. SAP for Me is used in subsequent tasks to trigger the provisioning of different tenants and systems and check their status. SAP Cases (support tickets or service requests) can be created directly from SAP for Me. SAP Signavio Process Navigator required to review the SAP Best Practices content related to the scope items is accessible via SAP for Me.

Task.Name: Grant Access to Partner for Creating and Managing Cases in SAP for Me
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to grant access to partner S-user ID(s) so that they can create and manage SAP cases on behalf of the customer using the Service Partner Management Application in SAP for Me. The application plays an import role in enhancing the quality of support services provided by partners, optimizing troubleshooting processes, and facilitating collaboration between SAP and partners. Prerequisite: SAP Support user (S-user) is available Customer S-user ID who is providing authorizations must be listed as Cloud Administrator Customer S-user ID (Cloud Admin) who is providing authorizations must have the same customer number as the installation(s) in question Procedure: Follow the steps in the Accel ID = S4H_2143. Procedure Note(s): SAP advises customers and partners to leverage the Service Partner User Management application in situations where partners interact with SAP support upon customer request and on their behalf. Some of the benefits of using the Service Partner Management Application for SAP customers and Partners include, but not limited to: Accelerated troubleshooting by partners on behalf of customer Closer collaboration between SAP and partners Higher transparency Increased efficiency in managing partner authorizations Increased efficiency in case handling across customers For more details refer to the following complementary content: SAP Note 2518600 - How to grant support authorization to a service partner S-user using the Service Empowering SAP Partners - Service Partner User Management Application Getting Started with Support from SAP Learning Journey An SAP S-user ID is required to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards necessitate additional authorization, which can be obtained by contacting the S-User Admin or Super Admin. For additional questions or feedback about access to SAP for Me, customers can send an email via SAPforMe@sap.com

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Learning Hub
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project team can access the SAP Learning Hub. SAP Learning Hub The SAP Learning Hub - Editions is the central location that provides access to various learning offerings and the SAP Learning Rooms. With the SAP Learning Hub there are different editions available, which will be based on the support subscription. By default, all cloud customers are entitled to use the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support. This edition provides users with access to all SAP Enterprise Support learning content powered by SAP Enterprise Support Academy. Contact SAP_ES_Academy@sap.com for related feedback and questions. Procedure: Go to the Accel ID = S4H_192. Click ‘Learn More and Sign Up’ and follow the guided steps. Select ‘Program Entitlement’ to verify your eligibility and get additional details. Click ‘Sign-Up’ and register using your S-User ID and password. A welcome email will be sent shortly after registration. Confirm the pop-up message (this applies only for first time access to the Accel ID = S4H_207). Note: It may take up to two hours for your S-User to be assigned after receiving the welcome email. Log in using the link provided in the registration email. Use the ‘Quick Access’ section to search for your desired topic: For content related to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, use the search tag “S4HC” (with quotation marks), or access the Accel ID = S4H_2561. For content related to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition, use the search tag “SAP S/4HANA” (with quotation marks), or access the Accel ID = S4H.1214. For content related to SAP Business Data Cloud, use the search tag “BDC”. For content related to SAP SuccessFactors, use the search tag “SuccessFactors”. Procedure Note(s): For S/4 HANA implementation scenarios, in addition to utilizing the SAP Enterprise Support Academy content available in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, you can enroll and join the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Implementation Learning Room to access a selection of support offerings, including live fundamental sessions. If you have any questions or feedback regarding this aspect, please contact e-learning@sap.com.

Task.Name: Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Activate Community
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all project team members access the SAP Activate Community. This community allows for collaboration with other customers, partners and experts on SAP Activate Methodology and provides valuable information throughout your implementation. By engaging with the SAP Activate Community, team members can stay updated on the latest content, ask questions, and share insights, which will be beneficial for the project's success. Procedure: Use the SAP Activate Community accelerator to access the SAP Activate Community. Select the “Follow" button to receive updates and notifications on new content. Submit questions to the community on SAP Activate throughout the implementation project by selecting the “Create a Post” hyperlink.

Task.Name: Request Initial System Access
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request initial access to the required system or tenant to enable setup and user access, ensuring readiness for project implementation

Task.Name: Verify and Locate Provisioning Email from SAP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the Initial Admin locates and reviews the provisioning email from SAP once the request has been submitted via SAP For Me. The System and Provisioning email from SAP includes access information for the SAP Cloud ALM, SAP Central Business Configuration, SAP BTP, and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter Systems, simplifying the onboarding process by bundling system links and login credentials in one communication. In the consolidated email, the initial admin will find links to each SAP Activate respective task, providing clear guidance on accessing the systems and performing the initial setup. Prerequisite: Complete task Request Initial System Access of SAP Cloud ERP Procedure: Check the email and junk/spam folder for a provisioning email from SAP. This email contains essential setup information for the initial system requested. If additional help is needed, the SAP Support Channels can assist, and if faced with technical issues, an incident can be created via SAP for Me using component XX-S4C-OPR-INC and Note 1296527 - How to create a support case (contact SAP Product Support) - SAP for Me can be referenced while creating the support ticket. Verify access to each system by carefully examining the email for any system links, login credentials, and setup instructions required to complete the system provisioning. Flag the email for future reference. The recipient of the email should flag the email as "important" or store it in an accessible folder for quick reference during the system setup process. Confirm receipt with the project implementation team. The initial admin contact should confirm with the project or necessary stakeholders that they have received and reviewed the provisioning email. This confirmation will verify that they have the necessary details to proceed with the setup. Manage Cloud notification subscriptions for other users. SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications is used to add, customize and manage subscription to Cloud Availability notifications. SAP Cloud customers can remain informed and receive timely updates regarding their SAP Cloud Services. Setup Cloud notification subscription for other users by follow the steps in the SAP for Me Accel ID = S4H_2138. Procedure Note(s): If there are issues related to system access, create an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. SAP's recommendation is to create at least two additional super administrators who can support or substitute if needed.

Task.Name: Request Initial System Access of SAP Cloud ERP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request initial system/tenant access in SAP for Me. The Initial Admin user makes the request in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the access instructions. Customers have the option to request multiple tenants within a single request. SAP Cloud ALM tenant, SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System are included in the initial provisioning. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. There are two tenants in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development and both will be provisioned with the initial systems. Prerequisite: The Initial Admin user has been identified and has the right authorizations in SAP for Me Procedure: Request the systems in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning . Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter Customizing tenant' entry in the ‘Systems to be Provisioned’ section of the ’Provisioning tab' and click 'Start Provisioning. Select the appropriate dependent products if applicable, then review and follow the instructions in the pop-up windows for the next steps. Once the appropriate selections have been made and all details reviewed for each tenant, select ‘Submit’. The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'Initial Admin user' when the system/tenants are available. Note: The Starter Development tenant will be provisioned along with the Starter Customizing tenant. Procedure Note(s): Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support and cloud editions. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing Help - SAP Cloud ALM or the Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM task. Learn more about SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system provisioning, including SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Central Business Configuration, via Accel ID = S4H_1051. For additional scenario information related to the required SAP Cloud Identity Services Administration, see the Accel ID = ACT_021. You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to access the SAP Cloud ALM tenant to perform the initial setup of project team environment, including selection of SAP Activate template, user setup, definition of milestones, etc. The tasks below will help guide you through this process. SAP Cloud ALM has the same great SAP Activate content as the Roadmap Viewer but offers extended features allowing both project managers and implementation experts to better manage their work. Some examples of the features are: Assigning tasks to teams and users Adding project specific tasks Tracking completion status as part of the project management capabilities.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access SAP Cloud ALM and complete the necessary setup before using the solution. If the SAP Cloud ALM tenant is already established and fully configured, ensure that all required integrations are properly set up. In SAP Cloud ALM, the content of SAP Activate is integrated and provides enhanced project and task management functionality. Once this task is completed, it should be the primary source for following SAP Activate. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. Prerequisite: Received email with access information to SAP Cloud ALM tenant. Procedure: Read the overviews and follow the procedures for each of the three steps listed under Help - Required Setup for SAP Cloud ALM to complete the required setup of SAP Cloud ALM. If you need help, refer to our Help - Troubleshooting and FAQ for SAP Cloud ALM or Accel ID = S4H_1992. Create a project for your implementation using the Projects and Setup app within SAP Cloud ALM. To automatically derive the tasks from the SAP Activate methodology, select the relevant, product-related roadmap ( depending on the transition path, either new implementation, system conversion, or selective data transition) or several combinable roadmaps. This ensures that your team is using the right roadmap for the implementation of your cloud product. For guidance, see the in-app help and/or topic ‘Projects and Setup -Creating a Project ’ in Accel ID = S4H_1803. Procedure Note(s): Additional integration and configuration options help customers take advantage of the full set of capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM, such as the integration of SAP LeanIX, SAP Signavio, and Tricentis. For more information, review the Integration and Configuration Options after the section for Help - Required Setup for SAP Cloud ALM.

Task.Name: Initial System Access
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the new Starter System and create the initial users. The Starter System contains configuration and data so the customer can execute business processes during the Explore phase. There are two tenants in the Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development. The Starter Customizing tenant is used to review the pre-delivered standard business processes during the fit-to-standard workshops while the Starter Development tenant is used for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects.

Task.Name: Access SAP Central Business Configuration Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and the Administration Console of the Identity Authentication Service and perform the initial system setup. Prerequisite: Received email with access information to SAP Central Business Configuration tenant and Identity Authentication Service provisioning tenant. Procedure: Locate the Identity Authentication Service email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’ and follow the instructions to access and set up the Administration Console of the Identity Authentication Service. Locate the SAP Central Business Configuration provisioning emails sent to the ‘Initial Admin User' and access the tenant using the link provided in the email. Access the SAP Central Business Configuration and follow the instructions provided in the provisioning email to do the initial setup of the SAP Central Business Configuration users. Initial setup tasks must be performed to enable additional users to work in SAP Central Business Configuration. Follow the step-by-step guide in the Help - Set Up SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator. Below is the summary of the required steps: Creating Business Users and Providing Access Rights Running Jobs for User Provisioning Enabling Business Users to Access the SAP Central Business Configuration System Procedure Note(s): The SAP Central Business Configuration tenant uses the same identity authentication tenant as the SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenant, and therefore, no additional notification is sent. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (IT Contact) is incorrect, Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘'Request update to the Contact Person IT’, Description ‘'Please change the IT Contact to <NAME>, <EMAIL ADDRESS>' and component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

Task.Name: Set Up Starter Customizing and Development Tenants in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up an SAP Central Business Configuration Evaluation Workspace for the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customizing tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration and activate content in your Starter Customizing tenant. There are two tenants in the Starter System: Starter Customizing and Starter Development. This process is followed twice: once for the Starter Customizing tenant and once for the Starter Development tenant. Prerequisite: Received provisioning email with access information for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System Procedure for the Starter Customizing Tenant: Login in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create an Evaluation Workspace for the Starter Customizing tenant. See the section 'Selecting Your Workspace (Initial Logon)' in the Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator for detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete SAP Central Business Configuration activities for setting up the Starter Customizing tenant. See the section 'Evaluation Workspace' in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for additional information on completing the activities. Below is a summary of the activities: Define scope Specify the deployment target Define primary finance settings: Fiscal year variant: SAP Help - Fiscal Year Variant Group currency: SAP Help - Setting Your Group Currency Ledger selection: SAP Help - Ledger Selection Set up organizational structure Deploy scope and organizational structure Procedure for the Starter Development Tenant: Login in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create an Evaluation Workspace for the Starter Development tenant. See the section 'Selecting Your Workspace (Initial Logon)' in the Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator for the detailed steps for completing the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities for setting up the Starter Development Tenant. See the section 'Evaluation Workspace' in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for additional information on completing the activities. Below is a summary of the activities: Define scope Specify the deployment target Define primary finance settings: Fiscal year variant: SAP Help - Fiscal Year Variant Group currency: SAP Help - Setting Your Group Currency Ledger selection: SAP Help - Ledger Selection Set up organizational structure Deploy scope and organizational structure Procedure Note(s): Only the Starter System gets connected to the Evaluation workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration. The main purpose of the Starter System customizing tenant is to run through pre-delivered standard business processes during the fit-to-standard workshops. The recommended use of the Starter Development tenant is mainly for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects. On first use, it is recommended to select only one country/region and use the default settings provided by SAP to get the Starter System activated. If you have included demo data in your system, you can only choose K4 - Cal. Year, 4 Special Periods as fiscal year variant and USD as group currency. JSON file of your scope selection from Digital Discovery Assessment can be uploaded in Define Scope app. Reference the Importing Scope section under Scoping in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator. Review the ledger selection documentation in SAP Help - Ledger Scenarios: Choosing the Right Combination for Your Business Needs and assignment in Accel ID = S4H_2446. Additionally, refer to SAP Note - Assigning Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference. Define primary finance settings: fiscal year variant, group currency, and ledger selection.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Central Business Configuration Integration to SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up integration between SAP Central Business Configuration and SAP Cloud ALM systems. The integration will help customers easily navigate to the SAP Central Business Configuration tasks list from SAP Cloud ALM tasks. Note that SAP Cloud ALM is not available in all countries/regions. Procedure: Follow the step-by-step guidance in the Help - Setup and Administration for SAP Cloud ALM accelerator. The steps include the procedure for the technical setup and the integration during project creation. Navigate to the SAP Central Business Configuration via the respective tasks in SAP Cloud ALM.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System and create the initial users of the implementation project team. Additional users can be added at any time in the future. This process is followed twice: once for the Starter Customizing tenant and once for the Starter Development tenant. The Starter System includes configuration for the enablement of the project team on the standard processes and is used in the fit-to-standard workshops. Corresponding test scripts and process flows are available in the Implementation Portal and the SAP Signavio Process Navigator.
