The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. Prerequisite: Starter Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration has been set up. Starter Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration has been set up. Procedure for the Starter Customizing Tenant: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’. Access the Starter Customizing System URL provided in the provisioning email. Create and activate users in the Starter System by following the instructions in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System in a 3-System Landscape accelerator. Procedure for the Starter Development Tenant: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’. Access the Development System URL provided in the provisioning email. Create and activate users in the Starter System by following the instructions in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System in a 3-System Landscape accelerator. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. No new notification will be sent if the SAP Business Technology Platform IAS account is already active. In this case, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system was connected to the existing test IAS tenant. Please get in touch with your IAS Administrator to gain access. If additional SAP Cloud systems (SAP SuccessFactors, Concur, etc.) are to be integrated and have the same subscription start date, additional provisioning emails will be received for those systems. For login issues, create a case (incident) with the component XX-S4C-OPR-INC. See task Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Support Portal for more information on using support. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. This will apply to future communications. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Additional people can be assigned as Communication Contacts to receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications accelerator. For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions accelerator. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ For additional information on creating an admin business user, initially, see the topic “SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Initial System Access” in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator. Person-ID External used in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central needs to be the same as the Employee ID in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The username used in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central needs to be the same as that in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the new cloud SAP Business Technology Platform entitlements and start the onboarding process. SAP Business Technology Platform is an integration, extension, and application development platform. Once the commercial agreement is signed, SAP will send two (2) separate emails with all necessary information to access the SAP Business Technology Platform. Reach out to your SAP representative for questions regarding provisioning details, available credits, usage information, and pricing.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, Joule, SAP Build

Task.Name: Access to SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Business Technology Platform system. The ‘IT Contact’ maintained in the contract will receive an email with the URL, SAP ID User and Login instructions for the SAP Business Technology Platform. Procedure: Locate the SAP Business Technology Platform provisioning emails sent to the ‘IT Contact’. Follow the instructions provided in the provisioning email to perform the the initial onboarding activities. Refer SAP Business Technology Platform Onboarding Resource Center for details on getting the initial access. Review SAP Help - SAP BTP Account Model and determine the sub-account model that best fits your organizational needs. Follow the guidelines from SAP Help - SAP BTP Account Administration for managing the Global Account. For additional guidance review the mission Accel ID = S4H_1014. Use the following procedure to get support for any issues faced Access SAP for Me and go to the Services & Support dashboard (Use Accel ID = S4H_2066) Use the Get Support application to reach available SAP support channels. Optionally, search for solutions in: SAP Notes & KBAs SAP Community SAP Support Portal Product Documentation Guided Answers For non-technical assistance, contact the Customer Interaction Center (CIC). Procedure Note(s): If customers have an existing account for SAP Business Technology Platform, the "IT Contact" would have received emails about the provisioning of SAP BTP Entitlements. All new entitlements should have been provisioned to the existing global account and customers can distribute the entitlements as needed. Only the 'IT Contact' user will have initial access to the Global Account and have authorization to distribute entitlements.

Task.Name: Create Users in the SAP Business Technology Platform Cockpit
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create users in the SAP Business Technology Platform Cockpit. SAP recommends customers to create at least one additional Global Account Administrator who can support or substitute the initial Global Account Administrator if necessary. SAP cannot assign additional user IDs on the company's behalf. Prerequisites: You must be a Global Account Administrator to add members. If no administrator is available, use the SAP for Me workaround as listed in SAP Note 2669325 - How to add a user as a SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account Administ Procedure: Follow the instructions in the Help - SAP Business Technology Platform: Add Members to Your Global Account accelerator, to add additional users in the SAP Business Technology Platform account. Assign predefined or custom role collections to users who need to manage or view the global account in SAP BTP cockpit. Examples of predefined role collections include the following: (Refer Help - Role Collections and Roles in Global Accounts, Directories, and Subaccounts for more information) Global Account Administrator Global Account Viewer Review the ‘Working with Users’ section in the accelerator SAP Help - SAP BTP Account Administration to get an overview of user creation and user provisioning related activities.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to access your SAP BTP global account, verify entitlements and quotas for the SAP BTP apps and to setup your subaccount structure in accordance with your intended usage. Prerequisite: A finalized list of SAP BTP Apps to be setup based on the scope items that were selected in 'Executing a Digital Discovery Assessment' Task. Procedure: Review the account structure recommendations for SAP BTP Apps within accelerator Recommendations for the SAP Business Suite Customer Tenant Landscape for guidance on how to map the subaccount structure of selected SAP BTP Apps with the tenants of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. For SAP BTP Apps that are not specifically mentioned within this guidance, please refer to their app-specific documentation. Login and access the SAP BTP global account using the login credentials and URL provided in the Access Information for SAP Business Technology Platform email that was sent to the 'IT Contact' maintained in your SAP BTP contract. Verify that the entitlements for the SAP BTP Apps to be implemented have been added to your global account using a global administrator user. Create the subaccount structure as required. The global administrator can then distribute the entitlements to the subaccounts as required. Go to the Products with Integration Capabilities section within the accelerator Help - S/4HANA Cloud Integration and locate the corresponding SAP BTP apps and review the Setup Instructions within the Administration Section. Identify the SAP BTP Services that are required as prerequisites for the setup and ensure that they are subscribed to within the corresponding subaccounts. Procedure Note(s): Refer section ‘Systems & Tenants in a 3-System Landscape’ within the accelerator Help - The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Universe for additional guidance on how to setup your subaccounts and choose the corresponding regions based on the data center availability of the SAP BTP Apps required.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Activate SAP Build
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to activate the SAP Build entitlements that are included as a part of the RISE with SAP or GROW with SAP Packages. Prerequisite: SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account has been setup as mentioned in task Set Up SAP Business Technology Platform Global Account Procedure: Ensure that the required entitlements assigned to the SAP BTP global account. Use the following accelerators to activate the corresponding SAP Build components SAP Help - Getting Started with SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition SAP Help - Activate Your SAP Build Process Automation Package SAP Help - Activate Your SAP Build Apps Package

Task.Name: Initial Setup for Joule
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review and perform the initial set of activities needed to setup and Integrate Joule Prerequisite: Ensure that the prerequisites and constraints mentioned in the SAP Help - Joule Onboarding Guide have been reviewed. Procedure: Review and perform the steps for the initial Joule Setup as documented in the SAP Help - Joule Onboarding Guide The following steps have to be performed as a part of the setup procedure SAP BTP Platform setup including Global Account, sub accounts and entitlement setup Configure Trust to the SAP Cloud Identity Services - Identity Authentication tenant Configure User Attributes for Joule from the Identity Directory Run the Joule Booster These additional assets provide additional end-end guidance on the the initial setup procedure Mission - Activate Joule with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Mission - Establish a Unified Joule Instance Blog - Joule: End-to-End Setup Guide - Unified Approach Familiarize yourself with the list of Joule Capabilities available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition using SAP Help - Joule Capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Review Help - SAP Business AI Estimator for guidelines on how to evaluate AI units requirements using the SAP Business AI Estimator tool. Procedure Note(s): To access Joule within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, an additional entitlement and authorization may be required. Please consult your account executive for more information.

Task.Name: Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Service within SAP BTP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service that provides you a guided workflow to integrate SAP cloud solutions Prerequisite: Customer has SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP) Cloud Foundry subaccount in one of the data centers supported by Cloud Integration Automation Service or an SAP Cloud Integration account. Customer system instances of licensed SAP products that are in scope of the Cloud Integration Automation Service Procedure: Review the accelerator Help - Cloud Integration Automation Service and check the section "Supported Scenarios for Cloud Integration Automation Service" to determine if Cloud Integration Automation Service is relevant for your project depending on the planned Integration Scenarios. Subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service If you have requested SAP Cloud ALM tenant and have received access, the Cloud Integration Automation Service will automatically be subscribed to within the BTP subaccount where SAP Cloud ALM is provisioned. In this scenario, verify that the Cloud Integration Automation Service tenant has been provisioned. No further action is required. If you have an existing SAP Cloud ALM tenant through another cloud subscription or if you want to provision a separate Cloud Integration Automation Service instance in a supported data center of your choice, subscribe to the Cloud Integration Automation Service within your SAP BTP subaccount as described in the "Subscription to Cloud Integration Automation Service" section of the Cloud Integration Automation Service User Guide accelerator. Procedure Note(s): Customers who are yet to request their SAP Cloud ALM tenant are recommended to the use the Cloud Integration Automation Service that will be automatically subscribed within the SAP BTP subaccount used for SAP Cloud ALM provisioning.

Task.Name: Set Up SAP Start and SAP Mobile Start
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up SAP Start including SAP Mobile Start to create a central entry point for Business Users. Prerequisite: Customer has setup the SAP BTP Global Account Customer has entitlements to SAP Task Center and SAP Cloud Management Service The customer has registered their SAP S/4HANA Cloud System to their SAP BTP Global account. Refer to Help - Register an SAP S/4HANA Cloud System in a Global Account in SAP BTP for additional details. Procedure: Execute the steps to set up SAP Start as described in Accel ID = S4H_2061. This will lead to a subscription of SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition (plan: foundation) Open the SAP Start site via the URL provided in the SAP Build Work Zone tenant. Refer Help - Launch SAP Start for additional details. Install SAP Mobile Start on end user mobile device and connect it to the SAP Start instance as is described in Accel ID = S4H_2063. Integrate additional SAP solutions to the SAP Start instance by following steps detailed in Accel ID = S4H_2064. Content will also be available within SAP Mobile Start afterwards.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Cloud Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request and access the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant. The tasks below will help guide through this process.

Task.Name: Request SAP Analytics Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request an SAP Analytics Cloud tenant via SAP for Me. SAP Analytics Cloud is a single solution for business intelligence and enterprise planning, augmented with the power of artificial intelligence, machine learning technology, and predictive analytics. Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud Analytics if they have subscribed to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public edition premium package. An SAP account Executive (AE) can be contacted for additional information on the different packages available. Prerequisite: Initial Access to SAP for Me Procedure: Request the SAP Cloud Analytics tenant in Accel ID = S4H_889. Locate the SAP Cloud Analytics in the 'Provisioning' section under 'Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning'. Follow the prompt to select the respective SAP Cloud Analytics tenant. Click on the 'Submit' button. The request will trigger the tenant provisioning, and an email will be sent when the tenant is available. Procedure Note(s): You need an SAP S-user ID to access SAP for Me Customer dashboards. Some content and cards require additional authorization. Contact your S-User Admin or Super Admin to get access.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP Analytics Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task to access the SAP Analytics Cloud tenant. The Initial Admin User will receive a provisioning email with instruction needed to access and setup the tenant. Prerequisite: Request SAP Analytics Cloud via SAP for Me SAP Analytics Cloud URL and initial logon credentials were received. Procedure: Follow the procedure provided in the provisioning email.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for a Content Development and Digital Adoption Tool
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide customers with access to content development and digital adoption tools, such as SAP Enable Now and WalkMe. This access helps with self-paced learning on SAP system(s) and the SAP Activate methodology. By engaging with these tools early, users can explore processes, practice system navigation, and gain contextual understanding of project activities. Given the accelerated timeline of SAP cloud projects, it is crucial to focus on learning and adoption tools. Initiating self-enablement before the project kickoff maximizes learning time and enhances efficiency in subsequent deliverables.

Task.Name: Activate SAP - Managed WalkMe Content for End Users
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand how the SAP Managed WalkMe content is integrated across various SAP solutions and learn how to enable it. SAP provides pre‑built WalkMe content for certain products (e.g., Ariba, SuccessFactors, Concur, S/4HANA Cloud). Activating WalkMe makes this content available to your users. This task guides the administrators through activating SAP-managed WalkMe content so that end users benefit from the built-in, step-by-step guidance within SAP solutions. Activating WalkMe enables contextual help, accelerates user adoption and training, and provides analytics on how users interact with the software. Procedure: Review WalkMe Interactive Demo to understand what WalkMe is and its value across SAP solutions. Identify Your SAP Solution: Determine which SAP solution(s) you are implementing: Ariba, SuccessFactors, Concur, or SAP S/4HANA Cloud, etc. and follow the solution-specific guidance: SAP S/4HANA Cloud: the WalkMe-based alternative user experience for in-app help will not automatically be available in your system but requires that you activate the Toggle the SAP-enabled WalkMe integration (APS_UI_WME_INTEGRATION) feature in the Activate Features configuration activity. Follow instructions via Set Up Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Activate Features SAP Ariba: review WalkMe in SAP Ariba to understand SAP WalkMe integration with SAP Ariba and its release schedule. Enable WalkMe for SAP Ariba Guided Buying, if applicable, by following the Implementation Details in Accel ID = S4H_2610. Enable WalkMe for SAP Ariba Guided Sourcing, if applicable, by following the Implementation Details in Accel ID = S4H_2609. SAP SuccessFactors: enable WalkMe content by following Accel ID = SFSF_230. SAP Concur: follow the Walkme Enhancements to Concur User Assistance to activate and display the available WalkMe walkthroughs. For customers with WalkMe or WalkMe Premium for SAP Concur solutions enabled, the User Assistance Settings page will be renamed to WalkMe Settings. SAP Sales Cloud: follow SAP Cloud for Customer - Configure WalkMe In-App Help to activate and display the available WalkMe walkthroughs. Procedure Notes: SAP - Managed WalkMe content is optional and can be enabled or disabled at any time. If you need to build custom WalkMe content, you need a license for WalkMe Premium. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe.

Task.Name: Initial System Access to SAP Enable Now
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers with the SAP Enable Now Content Development Tool. The purpose of this task is to access, install and prepare SAP Enable Now to ensure the tool is properly installed, configured, and prepared in advance, so that all relevant resources can be enabled and ready to use it as needed. Procedure: Install and deploy the learning content development tool. Refer to Accel ID = S4H_777, for details steps about the installation. Configure identity management or single sign on. Run client deployment and cloud security. Configure the system roles, workflows, and metadata required in order to use the embedded enablement content. Enable the end-users on how to use the tool effectively. Refer to Help - SAP Enable Now for additional information. Procedure Note(s): SAP Enable Now, enablement content creation edition is available for net new customers alongside WalkMe Premium or WalkMe Digital Adoption Platform. For customer using other content development tools, the specific steps outlined may not apply. However, if a content development tool is available, ensure that it is properly installed, configured, and ready to support enablement activities.

Task.Name: Initial System Access to WalkMe
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers with WalkMe Premium Digital Adoption Platform. The purpose of this task is to access, install and prepare WalkMe to ensure the tool is properly installed, configured, and prepared in advance, so that all relevant resources can be enabled and ready to use it as needed. Prerequisite: Received welcome email to activate WalkMe account Procedure: Locate the WalkMe provisioning emails sent to the ‘Initial Admin User'. Follow the steps in the email to activate the initial account. Review the provisioned WalkMe Systems. Create additional users and add them to the appropriate systems. Refer to the WalkMe Help Center for additional guidance on how to get started, Set Up WalkMe and get additional information. Integrate WalkMe Premium with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition by following the instruction in Accel ID = S4H_2893. Procedure Note(s): For customer using other Digital Adoption Platforms, the specific steps outlined may not apply. However, if a Digital Adoption tool is available, ensure that it is properly installed, configured, and ready to support adoption activities. For customers with WalkMe or WalkMe Premium for SAP Concur solutions enabled, the User Assistance Settings page will be renamed to WalkMe Settings. Access the Walkme Enhancements to Concur User Assistance for further information on setup and configuration.

Task.Name: Customer Team Self-Enablement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for the customer to learn different elements of the SAP system and SAP Activate methodology using self-paced enablement materials. SAP cloud projects are intended to be completed in a shorter time period which requires more focus on learning tools. It is important that self-enablement begins prior to the project kickoff in order to maximize the time for learning and create efficiencies in later deliverables.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Solution Adoption, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Joule, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Request Transformation Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the continuous quality check (CQC) for transformation assessment service. This service assesses the project team's awareness of critical topics related to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and offers personalized recommendations on key topics. The goal of the CQC for transformation assessment is to offer high-level guidance aligned with SAP best practices, supporting your project team's progresses through the SAP Activate phases. Upon completing the service, you will receive a customized knowledge assessment report, which includes an executive summary of key findings, an action plan, and detailed recommendations. The insights and recommendations provided in the report can help create the enablement plan for both the project team and business owners. The service is delivered in two sessions/phases, each resulting in a unique report: Prepare Phase - to be requested at the start of the project. Realize Phase - to be requested upon entering the Realize phase. Topics covered in the CQC for transformation assessment include project timelines, SAP Activate, Central Business Configuration, SAP Cloud ALM, functional aspects and pre-set parameters, data migration, identity and access management, extensibility, integration, analytics, release upgrades, and enablement/community resources. Procedure: Review both the Blog - Save time for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition project team. and SAP Support Portal info sheet to become familiar with the assessment service offering. Request the service via two options: Option 1: Directly request the service via Accel ID = S4H_2805. Option 2: Sign up via the Accel ID = S4H_1035. Within the value map, select the tab “Continuous Quality Check” and click the “Request CQC for Transformation Assessment” button. If you have any questions about the service, post them on the value map platform. Procedure Notes: The CQC for transformation assessment is embedded in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contract. There are no extra fees required for this service. A service questionnaire will need to be filled and sent back to SAP to receive the final report with SAP findings and recommendations.

Task.Name: Create Self-Enablement Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand the importance of self-enablement in ensuring a successful cloud implementation and learn how to create a customer-specific enablement plan. Procedure: Schedule a half-day workshop with your implementation partner and your dedicated team, if included in your SAP subscription. Review the Customer Self-Enablement Workshop.pptx and use the Customer Self-Enablement Plan.xlsx template during the workshop. Nominate a customer lead to oversee the progress of the enablement plan. Define your project and future RUN phase tasks in collaboration with your implementation partner. Identify relevant learning items for each task with your implementation partner and Customer Success Manager (CSM), ensuring optimal use of available support offerings, such as Enterprise Support, Preferred Success, and learning platforms. Define future organizational roles and align tasks and learning items to the appropriate team members. Execute and continuously monitor the progress of your self-enablement learning plan. Procedure Note(s): Please review all tasks listed be under the Customer Team Self-Enablement deliverable for additional self-enablement activities.

Task.Name: Review Getting Started Tutorials in S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to use the in-app help to learn about the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Log in to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud System. Choose the 'Help' button in the shell bar ('?' button in the upper right corner) to open the in-app help. Select the 'Learning' tile to open the 'Recommended Learning' list. From the 'Recommended Learning' list, select the 'Working with the Launchpad' package and view the ‘Working with the Launchpad’ tutorials. Note that there are three options associated with the tutorials: Interactive Demo, Try it yourself, and Print (PDF). From the 'Recommended Learning' list, select the ‘Working with Apps’ package and view the tutorials. Procedure Note(s): Tutorials can also be accessed externally via the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator. SAP developed the tutorials using the SAP tool called Accel ID = S4H_521. If the customer has the license for SAP Enable Now, additional content can be developed by the customer.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Two-Tier ERP with SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy enables customers to maximize their existing investment in their ERP system while allowing the necessary flexibility and agility needed to run their business. Procedure: Review the Two-Tier ERP with SAP S/4HANA.pdf to learn about the key business scenarios and the beginning of the transformation journey. Review the Accel ID = S4H_1622. The community page is a valuable resource in becoming familiar and staying up to date with the Two-Tier ERP Deployment strategy. Review the relevant scope items available for Two-Tier on Accel ID = S4H_176. Select the latest version of the solution scenario and apply filter “Additional Information > Two Tier ERP”. Review Accel ID = S4H_1618.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the training material and become familiar with SAP Cloud Application Lifecycle Management (ALM). SAP Cloud ALM is an essential how-to solution for managing all aspects of any SAP cloud solution. It assists customers through the initial implementation, to going live, to monitoring integrations, to running and continuously optimizing your instance. Customers are entitled to use SAP Cloud ALM if they subscribe to an SAP Cloud Service that includes SAP Enterprise Support, and cloud editions. Procedure: Learn about SAP Cloud ALM by reviewing the SAP Cloud ALM - Support Portal Home and SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation pages. Test Drive SAP Cloud ALM using the Accel ID = S4H_828. Upskill yourself by accessing the Accel ID = S4H_1042. Be sure to review the demos in section ‘End to End Implementation Process in SAP Cloud ALM’. Learn how to use SAP Cloud ALM to efficiently manage your cloud - centric landscape by accessing the SAP Cloud ALM for Operations accelerator. Align with your implementation team on interest in using SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Note(s): For further questions or feedback, please send an email to cloudalm@sap.com. See the in-app help within the SAP Cloud ALM tool for additional documentation, best practices, and videos on the apps and processes.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Localization for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable our customer to get familiar with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition country/region-specific functions. SAP provides country/region-specific functions to meet business and legal requirements. These business processes include, but are not limited to, creating and exchanging financial documents, as well as registering the company in the supported networks, public directories, and environments. Customers will review the available country/region-specific functions and learn about the tools and frameworks that enable further extension of these functions beyond what is supported by SAP. This will ensure that the customer's business processes comply with local requirements and regulations. Procedure: Review Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions for a list of countries/regions where SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition comes with respective local versions to support specific requirements. Utilize Help - Localization as a Self-Service to learn about tools and frameworks that enable the company to further extend functions beyond what is supported by SAP. Procedure Note(s): When implementing the solution in a country where there are no pre-configured best practice processes, the Configuration Localization Tool is one of the Localization as Self-Service tools that is in the early adoption phase. It allows customers to copy Germany as the source country within SAP Central Business Configuration and leverage configuration activities and extensibility capabilities to further adapt the solution for country-specific requirements. Contact your Account Executive for participation in the Early Adopter program to use SAP Central Business Configuration's Configuration Localization Tool.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Parallel Line
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about how the parallel line allows you to make larger business configuration changes more flexibly without disrupting your implementation. This functionality enables the testing of configuration changes in separate project tenants, keeping them distinct from your main line during the configuration and testing phases. Procedure: Learn about the project line by exploring Accel ID = S4H_2249. Review Help - Parallel Line in SAP Central Business Configuration for an explanation on the features and processes for SAP Central Business Configuration Project Experience. Review Help - Parallel Line in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for information about specific features and recommendations related to the parallel line in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. See SAP Note 3612845 - Release Note for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, Parallel Line with 2508 for restrictions. Review FAQ 3SL Parallel Line.pdf for answers to frequently asked questions.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Configuration Localization Tool
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about the Configuration Localization Tool which enables you to activate countries/regions in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system which does not have a local version available in SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. In this scenario, you create a customer local version in your workspace by selecting a source and a target country/region. Subsequently, when you deploy the content to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition system, the new country/region will be activated based on the configuration and setup available in the source country/region. Procedure: Review the following assets to learn about the Configuration Localization Tool Configuration Localization Tool - Demo Video Help - Customer Local Versions Learning Journey - Exploring Localization as a Self-Service with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Localization as self-service [CLT] Interactive Tutorial SAP Learning - Leveraging SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Central Business Configuration Help - Configuration Localization Tool Review SAP Note 3107866 - SAP Central Business Configuration : Configuration Localization Tool restrictions for details on restrictions and limitations of the SAP Central Business Configuration: Configuration Localization Tool. Review Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions to thoroughly assess the individual functions tailored to each country or region, ensuring they align with business and legal requirements. Utilize Help - Localization as a Self-Service to learn the process of enabling countries/regions in which you operate in. Request any specific requirements for localized features, using SAP Customer Influence Portal and filtering for active campaigns on the Localization topic.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Transport Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide you with an overview of the 3-system landscape in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, and the process of transporting customizations, key user configurations, and developer extensions between systems. Procedure: Review the 3-system landscape overview using the Accel ID = S4H_1028, Accel ID = S4H_2471, and Help - Transports in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 3-system landscape accelerators. Review the 3-System Landscape - Transport Management Fundamentals e-learning accelerator. In order to acquire authorization details, refer to the task Ensure Project Team Members Access to the SAP Learning Hub. Use the tag ‘Transport Management’ to access the list of tasks related to Transport Management. Review all tasks' descriptions, steps, and notes including accelerators. Review the Manage Transports task to learn how to manage transports. Customers using the parallel line feature should review Help - Transport Management (Parallel Line) for guidance on handling transports when working and testing in the parallel line. Procedure Note(s): In SAP Cloud ALM, Features can be used to bundle dependent transports of different transport types e.g, Customizing and Key User Extensibility. Exported transports can be assigned to Features, and the Feature Traceability app provides a quick overview of the deployment status per Feature. Prerequisite is the creation of Communication Arrangement SAP Cloud ALM - Change and Deployment Management Integration (SAP_COM_0690).

Task.Name: Access the SAP Enterprise Support Cloud ERP (Public) Value Map
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to access the SAP Enterprise Support value map for SAP Cloud ERP (Public), also referred to as SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, available in the SAP Community. This resource helps users identify and leverage key SAP Support services, tools, and offerings at the appropriate time for the successful implementation and operation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. If you have any inquiries or feedback related to this, please reach out to SAPESValueMaps@sap.com. To kickstart your journey with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, you should complete the respective Getting Started with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition accelerator available in the Accel ID = S4H_207, accessible through the SAP Enterprise Support value map in the getting started knowledge base. Prerequisite: Users need to be registered in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support. If any users are not yet registered, please refer to the task ‘Ensure Project Team Members Gain Access to the SAP Learning Hub.' To access SAP Enterprise Support Cloud ERP (Public) value map Procedure: Navigate to the Customer Only Group SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps in the SAP Community with an S-user ID or a Universal ID. Select the Value Map Groups option. Choose the 'SAP Cloud ERP (Public')' value map from the available options. Click the ‘Join Group’ button on the SAP Cloud ERP (Public) value map. To access additional SAP Enterprise Support resources Procedure: Access the SAP Enterprise Support Academy Landing Page to learn about the program benefits and explore available learning resources. View the SAP Enterprise Support recommendation page for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Deployment with SAP Enterprise Support Academy to understand how the SAP Enterprise Support Academy supports your implementation. Read the Blog - SAP Enterprise Support Learning Assets for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition to learn more about the available learning materials.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Experience Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the documentation available and become familiar with Experience Management (XM) transformation to learn how to safeguard the success of the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, using Experience Management. This is achieved by capturing the project team’s experiences throughout the course of the implementation, to ensure teams are functioning well and the features and functions being implemented will meet the needs of end-users. Procedure: Understand the value of Experience Management (XM) Review the Introduction to Experience Management.pptx to understand the core benefits of Experience Management (XM). Consider how you would apply XM within your organizational structure, including incorporating it into your Organizational Change Management and Continuous Improvement activities. Key areas of consideration will be governance, stakeholders and technology. Review how Experience Management transformation applies to your Implementation. Review the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx to understand how XM can be applied to your implementation. Use the listed accelerators to support the development of your XM strategy for this particular implementation; with special reference to stakeholder mapping, reporting structures, and what technology will be required to support the program. Utilize the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx and XM Transformation Survey Questions_public Cloud.xlsx throughout your implementation to support your XM program. Procedure Note(s): Ensure the core Project Team (customer and partner PMO staff) understand the principles of Experience Management (XM) programs, including how they enable innovation and agility in Enterprises, using continuous feedback mechanisms that deliver data-driven, actionable insights. These principles are especially useful in large enterprises with diverse business processes, heterogeneous IT landscapes, disparate teams or reporting lines, a high number of individual stakeholders, and/or multiple languages. Ensure the project team is aware of what will be required to implement an Experience Management (XM) transformation program in an implementation; ensuring implementation issues can be rapidly identified and mitigated prior to any escalations.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on WalkMe
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to equip the customer's digital adoption platform builder with knowledge about WalkMe, provide training on WalkMe content creation and best practices, and enable them to build WalkMe content both during and after the onboarding process. WalkMe capabilities: Data & analytics: Gain insights into real usage and identify friction points across all organizational software, analyzing workflows and tasks to determine optimization needs, and track success. Digital adoption content creation: Access tools and templates to streamline critical workflows by building automations and delivering personalized, in-app guidance with the flow of work. User experience: Create user-friendly, people-first experiences with in-app guidance, a conversational interface for initiating tasks and answering questions, and timely notifications to help users navigate workflows seamlessly, even amid constant change. Procedure: Review the WalkMe Overview to gain an understanding of how this digital adoption platform works and the value it delivers to your business. Review the SAP Learning content Starting your Digital Adoption Journey: WalkMe Fundamentals to kick off your learning experience with WalkMe. Identify WalkMe’s value and uses, and learn how to incorporate some of WalkMe’s more technical features by taking the Accel ID = S4H_2546. Procedure Note(s): Explore how WalkMe works by joining the WalkMe Interactive Demo and experiencing its features in action. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe. For customers with WalkMe or WalkMe Premium for SAP Concur solutions enabled, the User Assistance Settings page will be renamed to WalkMe Settings. Access the Walkme Enhancements to Concur User Assistance for further information on setup and configuration.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about SAP Central Business Configuration. Procedure: Learn about SAP Central Business Configuration using the Learning Journey: SAP S/4HANA Cloud – SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator in the SAP Learning Hub. The learning journey accelerator contains openSAP courses focused on SAP Central Business Configuration and periodically updated What’s New – SAP Central Business Configuration eLearning courses to help you stay up-to-date on release innovations. All openSAP courses are free of charge. Review the Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator for SAP Central Business Configuration. Use the Tutorial Library for SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator to, step-by-step, learn how to navigate and use different features and apps of the tool. You can also access the tutorials within SAP Central Business Configuration from the in-app help. Review the SAP Video - Upgrade Your Business - Transition to SAP Central Business Configuration to understand the key capabilities and functionality of the SAP Central Business Configuration.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on the Fit-to-Standard Process
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about the Fit-to-Standard process so effective discussion around solution configuration can take place during the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Every customer needs to go through a series of Fit-to-Standard workshops to create a backlog to adjust the out of the box settings to optimize the solution based on customer specific requirements. The backlog of requirements will be further refined during the planning and design workshops, to plan for work during the Realize phase. Self-enabling on these topics will help the project team members understand what needs to be documented before, during, and after the fit-to-standard workshops. Procedure: Review the How to Approach Fit-to-Standard Analysis.pptx to learn the Fit-to-Standard process overall and to learn what to expect during each phase. Review the How to Approach Remote Fit-to-Standard Workshops.pptx if the Fit-to-Standard workshops are to be conducted in a remote setting. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard: How Does It Support the Big Picture? to learn how the Fit-to-Standard supports the overall implementation project. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard: Inputs and Outputs to deep dive into details of the process. Review the Blog - Fit-to-Standard: Mural Template to learn how to facilitate the workshop with online tools in a remote setting. Procedure Note(s): See product specific accelerator when available.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Customer Team Enablement

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about data migration including the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit. The SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit is a migration solution built into SAP S/4HANA and SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Migration cockpit involves two approaches: Migrate Data with Staging Tables and Migrate Data Directly from SAP System. Apps Used: Migrate Your Data Procedure: View the videos available Accel ID = S4H_2675. Review the overview presentation Accel ID = S4H_2034. Please be aware that there are 2 migration approaches included in the Migrate your Data app: Migrate Data using Staging Tables and Migrate Data Directly from SAP system. Direct transfer functionality is compatible with systems running ECC 6.0 (SAP NetWeaver 7.0) or later versions. Review the following Solution Process accelerators: Accel ID = BPSI_2Q2. If you plan to use staging tables with remote database connection, check the set-up instructions. Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from SAP (BH3) The communication arrangement setup is necessary for using the Direct Transfer approach and is include in the set-up instructions. Review the content in the Help - Data Migration accelerator. This includes sections on Getting Started, Learning, Application Help, Migration Objects, Project Organization. Select the topics in the graphic. Review Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape and Hotfix Collection Deployment Restrictions.pdf to know when there is no access to the system due to an upgrade or system maintenance. Include these periods in your migration project planning. Review the SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit - Data Migration Testing in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.pptx to gain insights on testing. Access the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit to gain hands-on experience. Procedure Note(s): Open SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit Community and view the related community information. Find additional expert insight via the community Accel ID = S4H_725. Find Knowledge Based Articles (KBA) using Accel ID = S4H_726.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Test Management and Tools
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable the team on the chosen test management and tools for the project. Risk-based test planning helps to analyze the impact of SAP software changes on critical business processes and provides adequate test plan proposals. SAP customers who have already a defined test solution from partners or third parties, have the choice of using it in combination with test management apps in SAP Cloud ALM (Cloud Application Lifecycle Management) and the Test Automation Tool. Procedure: Review the Test Strategy for Cloud-Centric Customer and the Test Management Overview via the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation accelerator which covers testing challenges in Cloud ALM (if using SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation). Follow the path: Capabilities > Test: Planning, Manual Testing, Test Automation > Test Management Overview. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Tutorials accelerator for enablement on the Test Automation Tool. Follow the path: Implementation and Configuration > SAP S/4HANA Cloud - Test Automation Tool. Review the SAP Cloud ALM Tutorials accelerator for enablement on SAP Cloud ALM. Follow the path: Implementation > Management Competence. Review the Test Management Guide.pptx accelerator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud test management and best practices. Review selected third party testing automation tool documentation, if applicable. Procedure Note(s): To access the documents from the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation Support Portal, see the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation accelerator and choose Capabilities and expand the: Planning, Manual Testing, Test Automation Section. For additional information and blogs on the Test Automation Tool, refer to the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test Automation Tool Tag in the SAP Community accelerator.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Business Technology Platform
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) and its capabilities. SAP BTP is the foundation for the Intelligent Suite, our industry cloud, as well as extensions developed by our customers or partners. SAP BTP environments provide comprehensive application development services and capabilities that let customers develop new cloud applications, extend existing solutions, and integrate applications in the cloud. With SAP Extension Suite, customers can extend solutions in a fast and agile way without disrupting key business processes and via the SAP Integration Suite, customers can integrate various applications while securely connecting people, processes data ,and devices. Procedure: Review the accelerator SAP Business Technology Platform-Basic Concept to learn about SAP BTP Platform related concepts like Services, Regions, Environment, Global Account, Commercial Model and Account Models. Review the SAP BTP Service Catalog, SAP BTP Missions and Reference Architectures cataloged in SAP Discovery Center accelerator. Review the following Extensibility assets included within the accelerator SAP BTP Guidance Framework Extension Architecture Guide SAP Application Extension Methodology SAP BTP Developer’s Guide Review the integration paper in the accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1541. In this paper, SAP provides customer proof points with key processes and gives an outlook of the innovation and integration scenarios that are yet to come. Also review the accelerator Integration Architecture Guide for Cloud and Hybrid Landscapes for guidance on the design of Integration Architecture. Review the following accelerators to familiarize yourself with the capabilities of SAP Business Technology Platform Integration Suite Cloud Integration using Integration Suite. Refer to accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1277. Consume and deploy predefined integration content provided by SAP. Refer to accelerators Accel ID = S4H_995. Transport Integration Content between Integration Suite tenants. Refer to accelerator Accel ID = S4H_996. Manage APIs and run integration scenarios within your private landscape using Accel ID = S4H_2287. Review the following section to enable yourself on the Cloud Integration Automation Service. This setup option is provided for selected scope items. It will provide a guided workflow to integrate SAP cloud solutions. Supported integration scenarios are published in the ‘Plan for Cloud Integration Scenario’ tile on the Accel ID = S4H.0620. Verify with the project manager that scope items with Cloud Integration Automation Service option are in the project scope. Make yourself familiar with this service by reading the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_983. Also see related accelerator Accel ID = S4H_524. Make yourself familiar with release information, maintenance, and interoperability of the service in Accel ID = S4H_525. Review the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_870. Customers can build reports, dashboards, and visuals into their business application to make confident decisions. Review SAP BTP Guided Answers for an interactive documentation designed to help troubleshoot issues, navigate processes and guide through tasks Procedure Notes: RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP customers receive a specified amount of CPEA credits that can consumed using services on SAP Business Technology Platform. Customers can contact their SAP representative for questions regarding the credits, usage, and pricing. This Cloud Integration Automation Service has to be subscribed to and instantiated in your BTP Global Account. Refer to task 'Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Service in BTP' for further details. Reflect your BTP Architecture and extensions based on the Reference Architecture Content in LeanIX. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement of LeanIX products.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Joule
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the project team learns about how Joule can help with content discovery within the SAP Ecosystem, and giving a transparent role-based access to the relevant processes from everywhere while providing a unified user experience across SAP’s solution portfolio. Joule can streamline your experience by helping you Navigate quickly to functionality for the next task Get specific answers on using SAP applications Complete tasks using natural language requests Procedure: Review the following Learning Journeys and blog to understand the implementation scope for Joule Blog - SAP Business AI : Overview for all Learning Journey - Provisioning and Implementing Joule Learning Journey - Exploring the SAP Business AI Portfolio Review SAP Help - Joule to learn how to implement and customize Joule to meet specific business needs Review Help - SAP Business AI Estimator for guidelines on how to evaluate AI units requirements using the SAP Business AI Estimator tool. Stay updated with the developments in Joule through ongoing learning and SAP Community - Joule engagement.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP Build
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to become familiar with the SAP Build family of products. The SAP Build ecosystem comprises several services designed to empower fostering innovation. Through a comprehensive suite of solutions, including both low-code and pro-code offerings, the platform caters to a spectrum of developers, from citizen developers to professional developers and business experts. This flexible approach empowers project participants of all skill levels to contribute effectively to innovation. By combining intuitive low-code tools with advanced pro-code capabilities, the platform promotes accessibility and collaboration, enabling diverse users to work together seamlessly. This fosters a dynamic environment where creative problem-solving and solution development thrive. SAP Build consists of the following services: SAP Build Apps - a visual development solution that creates enterprise apps with a low-code approach. SAP Build Code - AI-powered cloud development environment tailored for SAP Application Programming Model (CAP), SAP Fiori, and SAPUI5 developers. SAP Build Process Automation – a visual development solution that automates processes and tasks. SAP Build Work Zone – a tool to create personalized business sites. Procedure: Review the help documentation available for SAP Build using the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_2654. Review the Learning Journeys; Developing Apps with SAP Build Apps using Drag-and-Drop Simplicity Creating Applications and Extensions using SAP Build Code Creating Processes and Automations with SAP Build Process Automation Implementing and Administering SAP Build Work Zone Evaluate and become familiar with the Experiencing End-To-End SAP Build Learning Journey.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Embedded Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about embedded analytics in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. It enables a customer to get started with SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics and integrate with best-in-class analytical platform and solutions from SAP. Procedure: Review the learning content in the Blogs - SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics Tag in the SAP Community accelerator. Review the Help - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Analytics accelerator. Review scope items available for SAP Best Practices for Analytics with SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator. Review the Help - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Analytics accelerator to learn the following: The foundations of embedded analytics Integrations with embedded Analytics and the solutions available Insights and updates from Community experts Review and learn all available Learning Journeys for the embedded analytics topic via the Help - SAP Learning Journeys accelerator. Follow the path: click the Help - SAP Learning Journeys accelerator > search with the terms “embedded analytics.” Self-enable and review the courses in the OpenSAP - SAP S/4HANA Embedded Analytics accelerator. Self-enable using the SAP Enterprise Support content by referring to the SAP community blogs SAP Blog: 5 Steps 2 Analytics in SAP S/4HANA and SAP Blog: Expert Guided Implementation - SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics accelerators.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about the various Extensibility scenarios that are supported in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Procedure: Review the Extend SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions to become familiar with the guidelines for choosing extensibility options within SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the ABAP Cloud - Technical Use Cases and Recommended Technologies to understand the recommended technologies for various extensibility use cases. Review the SAP Extensibility Explorer to determine sample scenarios and extensibility patterns. Review the SAP Learning Course - Introduction to ABAP in Cloud listed in the accelerator section below. Refer to the SAP Community - ABAP Extensibility topic for additional discussions and enablement content on Extensibility topics within SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the accelerator Solution Standardization Board (SSB) [public cloud] for information about governance that SAP introduced for SAP S/4HANA Cloud customers to help them stay as close to the SAP standards as possible. Procedure Note(s): Extensibility for key users is deactivated by default within the customizing tenant of the Starter System. Extensibility can be activated with Fiori application "Extensibility Settings". Refer to SAP Note - 2283716 - Key User Application is not configured for additional information. Refer to Blog - SAP S/4HANA Extensibility: All You Need to Know for more details about extensibility options and use cases. Use the SAP Help links Help - Key User Extensibility and Help - Developer Extensibility to access help materials for extensibility.

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP BTP Apps
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to self-enable on SAP delivered BTP business solution apps and services. Prerequisite: A finalized list of SAP BTP Apps to be setup based on the scope items that were selected in Discover Assessment phase. Procedure: Go to the Products with Integration Capabilities section within the accelerator Help - S/4HANA Cloud Integration and locate the corresponding SAP BTP apps and review the product related feature and scope descriptions. The SAP BTP apps below are examples of streamlined implementations enabled by Boosters and Cloud Integration Automation Service workflows. Help - SAP Market Rates Management, Bring Your Own Rates data option Help - SAP Project and Resource Management Help - SAP Subscription Billing Help - SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management Help - SAP Ariba Buying Help - SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition Help - SAP Integrated Product Development Help - SAP Extended Price Management by Vistex Help - SAP Sustainability Footprint Management Help - SAP Sustainability Data Exchange Help - SAP Responsible Design and Production Help - SAP Green Ledger For partner delivered integrated applications, reach out to the corresponding partner for Help and User documentation. Procedure Note(s): We recommend setting up this integration scenario using the Cloud Integration Automation Service. Cloud Integration Automation Service provides a guided workflow that features: Customer-specific system information (for example, target URLs) Reusable configuration settings between tasks Automated execution capabilities Please refer task Self-Enable on Cloud Integration Automation Service for additional details. For SAP BTP Apps without Boosters and Cloud Integration Automation Service workflows, use the manual Setup and Integration procedure mentioned in the Help Documentation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Self-Enable on SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about Identity and Access Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Identity and Access Management (IAM) is the security control that allows the right individuals to access the appropriate resources during the authorized time for the authorized reasons. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the IAM launchpad enable customers to view, monitor and control business users, business roles, business catalogs and access restrictions. Procedure: Review the learning content in the Accelerating IAM Activities with SAP Activate - S/4HANA Technology accelerator with SAP Activate to learn on how to use the SAP Activate Methodology to identify the relevant IAM tasks in your implementation project. Review the Blog - SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Identity and Access Management – SAP Enterprise Support Academy recorded learning accelerator to learn the following: The foundations of IAM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The IAM tools available in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The implementation methodology of IAM in SAP S/4HANA Cloud The authorization concept, project planning and project phases of IAM Procedure Note(s): Use Help - Identity and Access Management and Help - Set Up Authorizations for Business Users in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference

Task.Name: Self-Enable on Security and Data Protection
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to learn about aspects of security and Data Protection and Privacy in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Security measures safeguard confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Building on this, Data Protection measures enable data processing in accordance with general data protection acts and industry-specific legislation. Procedure: Review SAP Help - Protect Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for a detailed overview of security configurations and the corresponding recommendations. The following sections are especially significant Secure Communication Identity and Access Management Data Protection Privacy by Design and Default

Task.Name: Strategic Adoption Planning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to define a high-level plan for digital transformation with the SAP Business Suite. The SAP Business Suite represents SAP's cloud solutions, including SAP Cloud ERP, SAP Concur, SAP Supply Chain Management solutions, SAP Business AI, and more. Learn more about the SAP Business Suite here. This high-level strategy plan outlines an organization's vision for leveraging innovation to drive business growth and maintain competitive advantage. It identifies key objectives, innovation pillars, and enabling technologies while setting the direction for fostering an innovation culture, engaging stakeholders, and allocating resources effectively. This deliverable also encompasses defining the governance model that will guide strategic adoption, as well as establishing mechanisms - such as the Adoption Backlog - that empower customers to prioritize and manage future adoption initiatives.

Task.Name: Define Strategic Governance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish strategic governance for long-term value realization beyond the implementation project by appointment a designated Adoption Lead on the customer side. This role is accountable for sustained adoption, release and innovation planning, and outcome tracking across lines of business. The Adoption Lead participates in the project RACI, but operates beyond the project timeline. Procedure: Review the Accel ID = S4H_2312, which outlines the overall concept and approach for long-term adoption of SAP cloud solutions. Appoint an Adoption Lead with a clear post go-live mandate, defined time allocation, executive sponsorship, and measurable success KPIs. Ensure the Adoption Lead accesses and reviews upcoming tasks in the Adoption Journey road map. Procedure Note(s): If a Customer Center of Expertise (Customer CoE) exists, position the governance within the CoE and assign the Adoption Lead function there (e.g., “Adoption & Value Realization Lead”), leveraging CoE capabilities to support continuous improvement and innovation.

Task.Name: Project Initiation and Governance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to formally recognize the existence of a new project and to initiate the necessary work. During this phase, the project sponsor and project manager collaborate to align stakeholders, including customers, partners, and SAP management, around the project's scope. They also provide updated planning information and secure a commitment to proceed. As part of the initiation activities, the project manager conducts a handover from the pre-project phase. This governance framework ensures alignment between the implementation project teams, the company's strategic direction, and the fulfillment of operational requirements.

Task.Name: Create Project Charter and Scope Statement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a project charter and scope statement. If you skip this task, the project will not be formally approved by the customer sponsor, and the project manager will not be authorized to apply organizational resources to project activities. Additionally, the scope of the project will not be understood. Procedure: Develop the project charter by reviewing documents from the pre-project negotiation process and through interactive meetings with the customer to understand the project’s goals, business case, external assumptions, and constraints. Utilize the Project Charter Template as a reference template. Produce a reviewed and approved scope statement that is documented and communicated to the project team. Utilize the Scope Statement Template as a reference template. Assess whether the customer has existing: Organizational policies and procedures, standard product and project life cycles, and quality policies. Standardization guidelines and work instructions. Guidelines and criteria for tailoring the organization’s set of standard processes to satisfy the specific needs of the project. Organizational communication requirements, data retention policies, and security requirements. Procedures for issue and defect management, including controls, identification and resolution, and action item tracking. Change control procedures, including the steps by which the company modifies, approves, and validates official company standards, policies, plans, and procedures as well as project documents. Risk control procedures including: probability definition and impact, risk categories, and probability and impact matrix.

Task.Name: Establish Project Governance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a structured project governance framework to ensure clear decision-making. It defines roles, responsibilities, accountability, and organizational setup for the project team, stakeholders, executives, and system integrators. Project governance ensures timely and appropriate decisions through a logical framework. Procedure: Review the Agile Project Team Roles and Responsibilities accelerator to gain insight into the various roles and responsibilities within the project team. Set up governance levels based on committee tasks: Level 1 & 2 (Executive Sponsors & Steering Committee): Focus on business priorities, decision-making criteria, ownership of changes, and funding. Level 3 (Project Management Office): Oversees on-time, on-budget delivery, process strategy, business standardization, IT dependencies, and communication. Level 4 (Project Team): Handles daily tasks, issue resolution, and reports to the Project Management Office (PMO) and Project Manager. Please find below a graphical example:

Task.Name: Establish Solution Standardization Board
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide guidance on the setup and execution of governance activities with the Solution Standardization Board (SSB). The role of the SSB is to act as a body overseeing compliance with the cloud mindset. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, the key objective of the SSB is to oversee and manage the number of extensions to allow for sufficient testing during upgrades and to manage the associated cost and effort. Procedure: Review the Solution Standardization Board (SSB) [public cloud] template. Determine participants, structure of the board, and meeting cadence. Schedule SSB meetings as required. Define the process for reviewing, approving, and documenting decisions about extensions and integrations. Procedure Note(s): The SSB governance is set up in the customer organization and reports to the project sponsor and steering committee. After the initial go-live, it will transition to report to the CIO or COO during the Run phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management

Task.Name: Establish the Center of Expertise
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up a Customer Center of Expertise (Customer COE). The Customer COE is a core team of experts that will drive the realization of tangible business value via the SAP solution(s). They are drivers for continuous success and are crucial to maximizing the return on investment. This team will have or develop strong SAP skills and knowledge, and by collaborating with their business's key teams, be in the best position to identify the solution functionalities that will best meet the business priorities. Procedure: Review the Customer COE guidance in the Accel ID = S4H_911. This includes the resources “Customer COE Intro”, “Customer COE One Pager” and “Customer COE Accreditation Guide” listed under the heading “Customer COE Must Haves” Create the Customer Center of Expertise as per the guidance in the “Customer COE Accreditation Guide”. Submit the questionnaire in the Accreditation guidance to gain your Customer COE Accreditation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Define Project Communications and Reporting
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define and agree on the project communications and reporting strategies. The project manager is responsible for identifying who needs to receive specific information, the timing, and the method of communication. This includes the intent of each message and the overall communication strategy for the project. Procedure: Identify who needs to see what information, when, and how, in addition to the intent of each message. Define the project’s communication strategy. Distribute information to the steering committee, senior management, the project team, subject matter experts, clients, contractors, and other internal or external personnel. Define the communication strategy, including which key project deliverables are communicated. (e.g., objectives, scope, project schedules, work plans, project status reports, cost information). Define the frequency and format of the regular status reports that the project manager and project teams provide to the key stakeholders. Use the Project status report template for SAP Activate throughout the process to provide a status of the overall project to interested parties. Create a communication plan using the Communication Plan Overview Template as a starting point. This plan should define: Stakeholder communication requirements Communication approval process Define the Risk Management process by completing the Sample Risk Register and Accel ID = PM.98. Procedure Note(s): When relevant, refer to the product-specific accelerators in the accelerator section.

Task.Name: Project Plans, Schedule and Budget
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan activities during the early stages of the project, including the development of project plans, preparation of the project Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), definition of the project schedule, and budget development. The project management plan development is critical for ensuring the project is managed according to a structured approach that covers all aspects of project management necessary for the size and complexity of the project. The project management plan is a comprehensive document, or collection of documents, including plans for managing the schedule, budget, issues, risks, and project changes. These management plans cover all PMI PMBOK knowledge areas as appropriate. Once the project scope is refined and the WBS is developed, the project manager and planning team define and sequence the required tasks. With dependencies identified, the project manager adds resources, estimated effort (hours), and estimated duration to create an initial draft of the project schedule. As requirements are identified, the project schedule and budget are refined.

Task.Name: Create Project Schedule and Budget
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a project schedule and budget. The project schedule defines the work to be performed, the resources and associated time commitments required, and the individual phases of the project. The work breakdown structure (WBS) serves as the foundation for the project schedule and deliverables to be produced as part of the project. Procedure: Create a project schedule by referring to the Accel ID = PM.19. Include deliverables and tasks for the current phase Estimate effort and duration Identify task dependencies Schedule start and finish dates for each task based on dependencies Define task constraints Assign resources to each task Outline a high-level schedule for subsequent phases Account for transport freeze periods related to software updates Set the first approved schedule as the project baseline. Elaborate the schedule during subsequent planning activities using a “rolling wave” planning approach. Create a project budget that outlines all costs associated with the project. Set the budget baseline and manage the budget according to the cost management plan. Maintain the project budget throughout the entire project. Procedure Note(s): For additional guidance in preparing a project schedule, refer to the accelerators in the accelerator section, including the solution-specific ones if applicable.

Task.Name: Assign Resources and Refine Project Tasks in SAP Cloud ALM
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to expand the task template and assign teams or individuals to tasks in SAP Cloud ALM. The task template assigned during the project creation provides the essential elements for implementing SAP solutions and offers flexibility for expansion to meet the project needs for additional supporting deliverables and tasks. Resource assignment is critical in managing work and ensuring proper reporting in the SAP Cloud ALM Dashboard. Procedure: Determine the use of Teams, Roles, Responsibilities, and Individuals in the Task list. Setup Teams and Roles. See the ‘Best Practices’ section and topic, ‘Roles, Teams, and User Assignment’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for additional information. Review the project tasks and add new deliverables and tasks as necessary. See topic Project and Task Management > Project Tasks in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator. Assign users to project tasks. Procedure Note(s): Reporting should be considered in the formulation of Teams, Roles, and Tasks. See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator for more information. When relevant, refer to the product-specific accelerators in the accelerator section.

Task.Name: Align Project Schedules
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to align the product schedules for the products in an integrated scenario. This involves reviewing and synchronizing the schedules of individual projects to ensure coherence across different system landscapes and key milestones. Procedure: Review and align individual project schedules accordingly. Key milestones to be considered are: Different system landscapes provisioning (including integrated applications) System landscape configuration start date System landscape configuration completion date Testing in the Test System and migration to Production System (including integrated applications) System operations related to software updates schedule. Ensure the overall master schedule is updating accordingly. Procedure Note(s) For additional guidance in aligning project schedules, review the Accel ID = PM.19.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps, Upgrade

Task.Name: Project Standards, Infrastructure, and Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide a consistent means of executing and governing project work efficiently and effectively. The key objective of Project Standards is to identify, define, approve, and communicate standards related to project execution. Where applicable, current customer processes and procedures related to project standards should be considered when defining the most suitable standards for the project. Establishing project support tools is a requirement to facilitate this process.

Task.Name: Define Project Standards
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify, define, approve, and communicate standards related to project execution. Project standards provide a consistent means of executing and governing project work in an efficient and effective manner. Project standards are elaborated throughout the Prepare phase. Some may be fine-tuned in a later stage of the project. Procedure: Establish, at minimum, the project standards for the following areas: Requirements Management Business Process Modeling Solution Configuration and Documentation Custom Code / Development Authorizations / Security Test Planning and Execution Change and Release Management Post-implementation Support and Operations. Define, approve, and communicate foundational project standards to the project team using Accel ID = PM.40, which provides a regular review for project team members. Include project communication standards in project onboarding for project team members. Manage changes in accordance with the integrated change control procedure.

Task.Name: Set Up Project Team Logistics and Infrastructure
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a project team environment and ensure that team members have the necessary access levels. For on-site or hybrid project delivery, also account for physical access to the customer facility and project room. The project manager, in collaboration with the technical team, will address the setup of various areas to ensure a smooth project initiation.
