Procedure: Set up the following areas: Project Experience: Determine hardware requirements (e.g., servers, laptops). Verify the need for additional software licenses and their purchase status. Assess the need for additional consulting services. Ensure software installation for project team members. Designate an area for project equipment. Identify if project equipment is located at different geographical sites. IT Infrastructure and Access: Confirm availability of Wi-Fi or LAN access for the project team. Test Wi-Fi or LAN access. Determine if white listing is required. Communicate soft token/hard token requirements. Grant IT access for: Email Internet and/or Intranet access Team collaboration tools like SharePoint, Jira, Slack MS Office with Teams Customer Policies: Identify any specific project policies (e.g., communication, confidentiality, backup). Communicate the project policy to the team. Telephone / Voicemail: Establish a central repository with each team member's contact details. Project Team Member Equipment: Ensure availability of required equipment (computers, laptops, mobile devices) for all project team members. Provide office supplies to project members (on-site/hybrid). Purchase necessary software licenses if needed. Physical Project Environment (on-site or hybrid only): Arrange the required workspace at all project sites. Plan sufficient conference rooms for the project team. Plan multimedia equipment for all conference rooms (e.g., video conferencing, projectors). Grant physical access to all project team members at different geographical sites. Assign a working area to the project members. Physical Security (on-site or hybrid only): Grant necessary access at different project sites. Communicate all site policies (e.g., security, safety, emergency exits). Use the Project Guideline Template accelerator to provide new project members with essential information needed to understand the project and its associated administrative and technical regulations for setup.

Task.Name: Verify Project Team Certification and Experience for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project team members have at least the minimum level of knowledge and experience required to successfully implement an SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. It is imperative that every implementation team member holds the SAP S/4HANA Cloud certifications relevant to their areas of work. Additionally, the service lead/project manager and Finance lead have hands-on experience on a successful SAP S/4HANA Cloud implementation project. Procedure: Request the team members for their personal SAP Acclaim link. The link will be in the following format: https://www.youracclaim.com/user/<unique name>. Load the individual’s Acclaim link. If the page is not found, confirm the link with the individual. Check the individual’s Acclaim certification page to determine if they hold the certifications required for their role on the project. The service lead, project manager, solution architect, and technical architects should have a current "SAP Certified Application Associate - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding". The functional consultants should have an “SAP Certified Application Associate –S4HC [name] Implementation” where “name” is the Line of Business each consultant will be working with. If the necessary certifications are not held, ensure a plan is in place for the person to obtain the certification before project kickoff. Repeat this check prior to the project kickoff. Ask the team members if they have hands-on experience implementing an SAP S/4HANA Cloud system that has successfully gone live and is in productive use. If the individual does not have hands-on experience, consider filling that role with a person who does have experience. If that is not possible, initiate a mentoring/oversight relationship with an individual who has experience in that role. Procedure Note(s): It is strongly recommended that teams new to SAP S/4HANA Cloud utilize SAP Value Assurance Service Packages for SAP S/4HANA for their first implementation. Please contact your Partner Business Manager for more information. Access the latest training customized to your needs with Accel ID = S4H_585.

Task.Name: Create a Document Repository for the Implementation Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine and create a document repository for the project implementation team. A quality document repository allows teams to collaborate and share documents in real time for status updates, event meetings, milestone creation, and internal/external communications. This accelerates learning, collaboration, and adoption. The project team should agree on which document repository system works best for their implementation project. Procedure: Determine a document repository for the project. Ensure a repository is created and all project team members have access. Procedure Note(s): For customer using Cloud ALM, use Documents app to create and store documents. Document links can also be referenced in Task app of project created in SAP Cloud ALM. SAP Signavio Process Manager helps customer re-imagine, document, model and simulate business processes. SAP Signavio Process Collaboration Hub facilitates collaboration and communication on a project. Business users can also use SAP Signavio Process Governance to govern the lifecycle of processes, risks, and controls. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement of SAP Signavio products.

Task.Name: Project Kick-Off and Onboarding
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to initiate the project and ensure that all necessary information is communicated to the project team, key stakeholders, and other involved parties. The kickoff meeting aims to provide a clear understanding of the project's goals, objectives, and schedule, which are essential for successful project execution.

Task.Name: Prepare Project Team Onboarding
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare the onboarding package for external consultants and new project team members from SAP and partner companies joining the project. The onboarding package contains essential information that each new team member needs to understand, including the purpose of the project, goals, operating procedures, and other key information. Procedure: Ensure the onboarding package contains all the necessary information to properly onboard the team members. The onboarding package typically contains the following information: Project objectives, scope, and goals including SAP solutions being implemented Project schedule including milestones Project governance including key project stakeholders Organizational chart for the project showing both internal and external resources Outline of regular project meetings Travel policies, dress code, project location, and other project guidelines as needed Procedure Note(s): Refer to both the Project Guideline Template and Project Scheduling Guide to assist in preparing the onboarding package.

Task.Name: Conduct Kickoff Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to schedule, prepare, and conduct the project kickoff meeting. It is essential to ensure that all participants, including those attending remotely, can fully engage in the meeting. Proper preparation and the use of appropriate templates will facilitate a successful kickoff meeting. Procedure: Finalize the attendance list for the kickoff meeting. Ensure it includes the project team, key stakeholders, project sponsor, and company executives. Schedule the kickoff meeting. For remote participants, ensure good audio and video infrastructure to enable full participation. Use the designated Project Kick-off Template to prepare kickoff meeting materials specific to your project. Conduct the Project Team Kickoff Meeting. Discuss project objectives, organizational structure, roles and responsibilities, project governance, schedule, scope, communication standards, change request process, and decision-making process. Ensure mutual understanding of the Project Plan and communicate methods for managing and controlling the project.

Task.Name: Change Concept
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to create the foundation for the organizational change management support of the SAP implementation project. By discussing and aligning on relevant aspects of the change management set-up, it promotes a shared understanding among key project stakeholders. This clarity regarding the scope and benefits of organizational change management helps to manage expectations and prevents unrealistic assumptions. The change concept should be developed at the beginning of the project and only modified when significant parameters of the organizational change management delivery are adjusted, such as resource replacements or scope changes.

Task.Name: Define Organizational Change Management Roles
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the responsibilities related to providing organizational change management support for the SAP project. Depending on the project’s specific characteristics, such as scope, complexity, number of affected users, and anticipated change impacts, one or more roles for organizational change management need to be established. Common roles in larger implementation projects include the change management lead, change management expert, and communication expert. It is important to clearly distinguish and document the respective areas of responsibility and duties in a transparent manner. Procedure: Assess the anticipated level of effort needed for organizational change management in the SAP implementation project. Describe roles and responsibilities, referring to the section “Typical Project Roles for Organizational Change Management” in the How do you set up Organizational Change Management for your Cloud Project accelerator. Align and agree with the project leadership team on role descriptions, and incorporate the documented information into the Change Concept accelerator.

Task.Name: Staff Organizational Change Management Resources
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that organizational change management for the SAP project is carried out by qualified resources. In smaller implementation projects, a project team member may handle change management activities in addition to their primary project role. In larger and more complex programs, it may be necessary to assign multiple resources, either on a full-time or part-time basis. If internal resources are unavailable, engaging external consultants is recommended. This option becomes particularly valuable when there is a desire to develop internal change management expertise. Procedure: Identify potential organizational change management resources. Familiarize yourself with the video “Acting as a Change Manager in Cloud Projects,” accessible by scrolling down the Which Skills do you bring along to act as a Change Manager accelerator. Evaluate skills using the Individual Skill Assessment - Analysis accelerator. Interpret ratings with the Individual Skill Assessment - Results accelerator. Assign organizational change management resources and document their assignments, including their available time for project work, in the Change Concept accelerator.

Task.Name: Define Organizational Change Management Set-up
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish the integration of organizational change management within the project organization. This step is essential for determining the governance structure and reporting line. While often overlooked, it is equally important to discuss the delivery approach for organizational change management. This includes fundamental principles, success criteria, scope, and overall objectives. Reaching an agreement on these aspects within the core project team helps to create a shared understanding of organizational change management and sets the strategic direction of future activities. Procedure: Integrate organizational change management within the project organization, utilizing the video “Organizational Change Management in the Project Organization” accessible when scrolling down in the How do you set up Organizational Change Management for your Cloud Project accelerator, and define governance and communication structure. Develop and agree on the shared understanding of organizational change management for the SAP implementation project. Collaborate with the project leadership team to ensure alignment of the developed content, and incorporate the documentation into the Change Concept accelerator.

Task.Name: Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to provide a high-level overview of the organizational change management activities supporting the SAP implementation project. Typically, the change plan is organized into distinct sections, each addressing a specific area of action that will be managed by the change management team, such as change communication. The change plan is closely aligned with the overall project plan, ensuring synchronization. Change management activities are scheduled in accordance with the project milestones and reflect the specific requirements of the different project phases. Initially, the focus is typically on generating awareness and securing commitment for the project. As the project nears completion, the emphasis shifts towards adequately preparing users for the upcoming go-live. Whenever modifications are made to the project plan, the change plan must be adjusted accordingly.

Task.Name: Determine Action Areas for Organizational Change Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish a focused approach to organizational change management, maximizing its value for the SAP implementation project. This involves differentiating between essential activities (“must have”) and optional activities (“nice to have”). By discussing priorities and determining general action areas for organizational change management, the project team gains clarity. This process also aids in managing expectations and defining the scope of organizational change management. The identified action areas serve as the foundation for developing a more detailed change plan. Procedure: Identify people-related challenges of the SAP implementation project. Explore both the current strengths and weaknesses of the organization in addressing these challenges. Collaborate with the project leadership team to identify essential areas of action for organizational change management, and document them in the Change Plan accelerator.

Task.Name: Develop First Version of the Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to break down the identified action areas in organizational change management activities. This step can be challenging due to the lack of complete information available. Therefore, the initial version of the change plan typically includes high-level activities, particularly for later project phases. These activities will need to be refined and detailed as the project progresses. However, it is recommended to establish an initial version of the change plan during the early stages of the project, as it serves as the “single point of truth” for all organizational change management activities. Procedure: Define high-level organizational change management activities for all action areas. Schedule activities according to project plan and project milestones. Document results in the Change Plan accelerator.

Task.Name: Establish Updating Procedure for the Change Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the change plan is always well aligned with the project plan. Additionally, it involves integrating insights obtained throughout the project’s execution of organizational change management. This guarantees that the change plan consistently incorporates the most up-to-date information. This is important, as the change plan typically serves as a significant reference for reporting on the status of organizational change management. Procedure: Establish a regular updating cycle, such as biweekly or monthly, in accordance with project status reporting. Collect feedback on implemented activities, for instance, from business leaders, and assess the project timeline and milestones for any necessary changes. Incorporate updates in the Change Plan accelerator.

Task.Name: Business Driven Configuration Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to introduce the best practices and global templates that should be leveraged for the configuration. Also, provide the Workbook to capture the customer requirements and start discussing the customer's processes, based on the solution scope.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), SAP Build

Task.Name: Perform Initial Business Process Assessment for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to discuss the customer’s current business processes to gain a foundational understanding of the business that can be used in the planning and the execution of the fit-to-standard workshops for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The Business Driven Configuration Questionnaires can be leveraged by the configuration expert to help drive and document the business process discussion. Questions are written in business language, allow for customer responses, and provide a cross reference to self-service configuration activities. Procedure: Download the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire accelerators that are applicable to the solution scope. Refine each questionnaire by eliminating questions that are not part of the implementation scope. Initiate a discussion with the Business Process Expert on the business’ process based on the refined questionnaires. Incorporate the findings in the planning of the fit-to-standard workshops. Add the links to the completed documents to this task in SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Notes: The Business Driven Configuration questions are categorized by levels: Level 2 questions are geared to collect information prior to running the fit-to-standard workshops. The goal is to prevent stop/go execution of fit-to-standard workshops due to missing information. Level 3 questions provide more detailed information needed to make a business decision and define specific configuration values in the backlog during the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Note, level 1 questions are used during Discovery phase before signing contract. Use Digital Discovery Assessment tool when available. You must sign into the Roadmap Viewer to be able to view and download the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaires or other non-public accelerators. For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their business with the S/4HANA Cloud implementation, use the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - Two Tier accelerator to determine the applicable scope for the implementation. For customer who is going to use S/4HANA Public Cloud in a country where there is no country version available and participate the early adopter program to use the Configuration Localization Tool to jump start the configuration of the country set up, it is important to run a detailed investigation about the legal requirements of this newly to be implemented country. With this list of requirements, it needs to be evaluated if these can be configured with the available Configuration Activities from the source country or leveraging extensibility features.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Localization, Parallel Line, SAP Build

Task.Name: Solution Scope and Adoption Planning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to refine and agree on the solution scope based on the Digital Discovery Assessment (DDA) and other pre-sales discussions, and to establish a baseline of what will be delivered in the initial waves versus what will be deferred for future adoption. This includes defining the initial implementation scope of core business functionality, which will form the Adoption Wave 1 project scope; identifying additional waves of core scope for deployment, such as multi-country rollouts if applicable, which would be considered Adoption Wave 2, 3, and beyond; and outlining additional functionality to be adopted in later waves, including optimizations and other suite solution areas, which would be delivered after the core scope is complete.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Localization, Parallel Line

Task.Name: Determine Process Scope
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the initial solution scope including standard content, integration, and extension scenarios for fit to standard workshops. This should also include a list of countries where localization is required. Scope developed during the Discover phase and prior to the project start should be used as an input. Reference Discovery Assessment deliverable and tasks for details. Procedure: Review the results of the Digital Discovery Report from the Discover phase. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, upload business processes from the Digital Discovery Assessment via Manage Scopes app. Note: For business processes scoped or discussed for post-implementation adoption, these should be added to the Adoption Backlog that is created in the Create Initial Adoption Backlog task. Review the scope items including country availability, descriptions, process flows, and test scripts. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access the information using the Processes app. The same information is also available in SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection Confirm or revise what is in scope for the implementation project. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, update scope in Processes app. Reference the Process Scoping section of the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for more details. New solution processes can be created to account for scope not included in the solution process content for extension discussion during Fit-to-Standard workshops. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, draft the new process using Processes app. Solution Processes that are not included in the solution process content but are fulfilled by integrated applications should also be captured and discussed during Fit-to-Standard workshops. Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a two-tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, apply filter ‘Additional Information > Two-Tier ERP’ when reviewing solution processes in SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection. Download the ‘End to End Business Processes for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for 2-Tier ERP’ for an overview of supported standard business process scenarios in respective line of business and available deployment options and models. Please get in touch with SAP or Partner sales contact or email digitaldiscovery@sap.com to have a copy of discovery assessment if didn't export the report in Discovery phase. Apply the Filter Integration Relevant > Integration to BTP Apps within SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection to identify Solution Processes relevant to the Setup of SAP BTP Apps. For Retail processes, review Retail Relevant Solution Processes and Scope Selection.xlsx to determine the project scope of industry-specific solution processes. For customers rolling out solutions in multiple countries or regions, there may be additional business processes that may need to be considered that are unique to the respective country or region.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Localization, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Stakeholder Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to get a systematic overview of the stakeholder landscape for the SAP implementation project. Project stakeholders are individuals or groups who can either be impacted by the project or have the ability to influence its outcome. Conducting a stakeholder analysis early on in the project is crucial as it provides clarity on how various individuals and groups view the project and the level of investment they hold in the project. Being aware of the stakeholders’ attitudes towards the SAP project and the power to influence the project success are the prerequisites for setting up a systematic stakeholder management.

Task.Name: Identify Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to get a comprehensive list and description of all impacted user groups and key individual stakeholders (e.g., top management members, IT and business leaders, process owners, or important project team members). This includes capturing information like the number, business unit allocation and geographic location of the various stakeholders. Stakeholders who share similar characteristics or requirements should be categorized into groups. This may include diverse user groups like controllers, recruiters, or production schedulers. The stakeholder identification is not only an input for the stakeholder analysis, but also the basis for setting up stakeholder specific training and communication activities. Overall, identifying stakeholders helps to customize organizational change management activities to the respective needs. Procedure: Identify IT and business areas affected by the project. Collect relevant data for stakeholder identification (e.g. org charts, user lists of legacy systems to be replaced, HR lists). Cluster and describe stakeholder groups in the Accel ID = S4H_1832.

Task.Name: Assess Stakeholders
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to exchange and discuss the viewpoints and assumptions among designated project team members regarding the identified stakeholders of the SAP project, with the goal of establishing a common understanding. Using a matrix for positioning the various stakeholders allows to visualize existing assumptions regarding the stakeholders, to get a good mutual understanding of the stakeholders’ attitudes and engagement levels, and to anticipate the reactions towards the changes triggered by the implementation project. As a stakeholder assessment contains sensitive data, it is vital that the resulting documentation is handled with confidentiality. Procedure: Set up a workshop with the selected project representatives. Discuss the stakeholders’ level of influence and attitude towards the project and document the results in the Accel ID = S4H_1833. Map the stakeholders using the Accel ID = S4H_1833.

Task.Name: Derive Stakeholder Engagement Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify interventions to influence the stakeholder landscape to both reduce concerns and resistance, and to foster understanding and commitment for the implementation project. Based on the results of the stakeholder assessment, the responsible project team members agree on activities such as rallying supporters, addressing and persuading opponents, organizing informational events, and scheduling training sessions. Deriving and documenting stakeholder management activities is not a one-time endeavor, but the starting point into an ongoing stakeholder management process. Procedure: Discuss results of stakeholder assessment. Document concrete stakeholder engagement activities in the Accel ID = S4H_1834. Define review and update cadence.

Task.Name: Communication Analysis and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish the foundation for effective and proficient change communication throughout the SAP project. Delivering the appropriate messages about the implementation project through the appropriate channels to the appropriate individuals at the appropriate time is crucial. It generates awareness and commitment for the SAP project, reduces uncertainty and resistance, and enhances motivation and user adoption. Therefore, it is recommended to allocate sufficient time for a comprehensive as-is analysis and a structured planning and implementation of the change communication during the initial stages of the implementation project.

Task.Name: Analyze Communication Channels
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the best way to distribute information about the implementation project to the various stakeholder groups. To minimize the effort and expenses associated with change communication activities, it is recommended to utilize existing communication channels, such as collaboration platforms, intranet pages, newsletters, and meetings. Overall, it is important to ensure that the communication channels used by the implementation project are in line with the companies’ communication strategy and habits. Procedure: List and evaluate available communication channels using the Communication Channel Analysis accelerator. Select appropriate channels for different stakeholder groups. Define additional communication channels, if necessary.

Task.Name: Analyze Communication Needs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to tailor change communication to meet the specific needs of the various impacted stakeholder groups. Typically, project stakeholders vary significantly in their knowledge level about the SAP implementation project and their information requirements to handle the changes associated with their respective roles. Furthermore, an SAP implementation project is often accompanied by distinct expectations, objectives, and concerns that must also be addressed. To effectively capture all relevant information while limiting the analysis effort to an appropriate level, the communication needs analysis should be conducted at an appropriate level of detail and with stakeholder groups clustered in a suitable manner. Procedure: Identify contact persons for each stakeholder group. Conduct short interviews to collect required information. Align and document interview results in the Communication Needs Analysis accelerator.

Task.Name: Create Communication Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide a comprehensive outline of all intended communication actions concerning the SAP implementation project. The objective is to identify interrelationships and to synchronize different communication measures, regarding both the timing and messaging. Furthermore, taking a comprehensive approach to planning in advance ensures that the necessary resources for producing content and delivering communication activities are available. The communication activities should encompass a wide variety of approaches, for example: push channels (like e-mails), pull media (like videos), and both traditional and digital media. Moreover, it is important not only to provide information, but also to encourage and facilitate dialogue and engagement. Procedure: Review results from communication channel analysis and communication needs analysis. Derive and document concrete communication activities in the Accel ID = S4H_1837. Align the communication plan with project management.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Workshops Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to make yourself familiar with the Fit-to-Standard concept and prepare the Fit-to-Standard workshops.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Prepare for Fit-to-Standard Workshops
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. This involves reviewing project objectives, process scopes, solution design principles, and expected project value and benefits. Additionally, it includes preparing materials for the workshops and ensuring all participants have access to necessary tools and information. Prerequisites: Complete task Self-Enable on Fit-to-Standard Process. Procedure: Review project objectives, process scopes, solution design principles, and expected project value and benefits. Complete the RACI Matrix for Fit-to-Standard according to the defined roles, responsibilities, and provided guidelines. Order the list of workshops to align with the natural sequence of End-to-End processes. Group scope items accordingly, ensuring the first scope item in each series represents the starting point of the End-to-End process, while the last scope item marks the conclusion of the process flow. Prepare material for workshops. For remote or hybrid fit-to-standard workshops, leverage the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator to: Pre-fill with all the workshop enablement materials. Share with participants prior to the execution of workshops. Have participants fill out questions or topics in advance. Identify the required data objects for each scope item when preparing the Fit-to-Standard workshops and include them as part of the workshop materials. Additionally, consider which optional fields may need to be discussed. Ensure all participants of the workshop have access to SAP Signavio Process Navigator to understand standard business processes supported for the initial list of selected scope items from Discovery Assessment. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, get familiar with the Processes app to view process information. Leverage sample template accelerators (i.e. Accel ID = PM_216, Accel ID = PM.45, Accel ID = S4H_966, Accel ID = PM.211) to create a tracker to capture requirements and notes to create a backlog. For customers who use SAP Cloud ALM, get familiar with the Requirements and Notes app. Determine how to categorize requirements (i.e., using Tag field or Workstream field for configuration vs customer-specific development, etc.) to capture findings from the Fit-to-Standard workshop. Utilize the SAP Road Map Explorer and What’s New Viewer relevant to the specific solution to ensure the latest information is included when addressing potential customer-specific requirements. Access the Regulatory Change Manager tool to review current and upcoming regulatory changes and add topics to the fit-to-standard workshop in respective business process areas when needed. Schedule Fit-to-Standard workshops. Reference the sample schedules in the How to Approach Fit-to-Standard Analysis accelerator to structure workshops by line of business, and, in some cases, more detailed workshops by business areas and subareas when needed. Ensure invites are sent and other logistics (i.e., meeting rooms, materials, tool access, etc.) are planned accordingly. Procedure Note(s): Although the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator is specific for Mural, the template can be used as an example when creating a template in other collaboration tools. To create a new Mural from the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template accelerator, a Mural license is required. Reference SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal to learn about Fit-to-Standard Execution and Requirement Management using Process, Requirements and Notes apps. Digital Discovery Report with preselected in-scope business processes can be uploaded using the Manage Scope app in SAP Cloud ALM. See task Generate Digital Discovery Report in Discovery phase on generating report. Output of the report can also be used in the Define Scope app in SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference task Set Up Starter Customizing and Development Tenants in SAP Central Business Configuration for details. Check Help - Regulatory Change Manager to learn more about how to use the tool. If WalkMe is included in the project scope, ensure the relevant WalkMe team is invited to the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Their participation is crucial for understanding processes, user pain points, and priority tasks, enabling alignment of in-app guidance with UX Value Goals and supporting effective content planning from the start. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create Initial Integration and API List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the initial integration and API list. Procedure: Download the template and make yourself familiar with the required information. Collect and document all known integrations (i.e. B2B, Third Party, etc.) from all sources (i.e. Digital Discovery Assessment, Board Decision, etc.). Review and document all available API’s for the Scope items identified in the Digital Discovery Assessment using the accelerator Accel ID = S4H_2339. Provide this list to the participants of the fit-to-standard workshops and collect all current EDI integrations. Procedure Note(s): Store the list in a collaboration tool to avoid the creation of multiple lists with similar content. In case this is not possible, multiple lists need to be consolidated after the Fit-to-Standard workshops. The available APIs by SAP various products can be reviewed using the SAP Business Accelerator Hub Interfaces might offer multiple authentication methods. For security reasons, we recommend to always use the strongest authentication method supported by both communicating systems (in particular: use certificate-based authentication rather than password-based wherever possible). For security reasons, SAP recommends using different communication users for every communication arrangement (API) to achieve a least-privilege configuration. Review accelerator API Data Download - Technical Setup Document to maintain communication management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition environment. For any extract or download raw data from SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, review accelerator API Data Download Process which contain step-by-step process of downloading data. For SAP Integration with Concur solutions (SAP ICS) or any other customer-owned integration to connect your SAP Concur and SAP finance systems please see Accel ID = S4H_2192.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Create Initial Business Process Automation List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and distribute the template to be used to capture notes for various technology related to Artificial Intelligence (AI) during the fit-to-standard workshop. Procedure: Download the SAP Build Process Automation - Questionnaire from the Accelerator section and answer the questions. Review the Situation Handling for SAP S/4HANA Cloud accelerator to become enabled on the situation handling types available and to help foster discussion on the types needed during the fit-to-standard workshops To view the relevant scope items, use the following accelerators SAP Build Process Automation : SAP Business Accelerator Hub Machine Learning - Configuration Guide attached to SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Situation Handling - Help - Use Cases for Situation Handling For customer who uses Cloud ALM, Requirements and Notes app provides the ability to capture findings and Processes app has the ability to scope items for Artificial Intelligence enabled processes. Procedure Note(s): By selecting the appropriate Line of Business in SAP Build Process Automation - Questionnaire, user can identify the AI related scope items as per their Business processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Create Initial Analytics List for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and distribute the template to be used to capture notes for analytics (reports) during the fit-to-standard workshop(s). Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Embedded Analytics - One Pagers accelerators to become enabled on the solution's analytical capabilities and help foster discussions on the reports and Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) needed during the fit-to-standard workshop(s). Download the Analytics List Template accelerator and distribute it to participants of the fit-to-standard workshop. Procedure Note(s): For customers who are using Cloud ALM, the Requirements and Notes app provides the ability to capture findings and Processes app has the ability to scope items for analytics.

Task.Name: Create Initial Application - Workplace List
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the initial Application - Workplace List that will be distributed to the fit-to-standard participants and used to capture notes for Identity and Access Management during the fit-to-standard workshops. The Application - Workplace List determines the application of each Scope Item and collects all required applications for the scope of the overall project. Procedure: Collect the Digital Discovery Assessment report. Review the How to Create Application - Workplace List accelerator to become enabled on how to download and create the Application-Workplace list. Create the Application - Workplace List and transfer the results of the Digital Assessment report to the list, selecting the relevant Scope Items. Filter the relevant Scope Items and applications in the Application - Workplace list and provide this list to the participants in the fit-to standard Workshops. Procedure Note(s): It is recommended to store the list in a central collaboration tool, for example SAP Jam, to avoid the creation of multiple lists with similar content. The SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator can be used to find S/4HANA Cloud apps. It is also the base to identify the required Business Catalogs and Business Roles. Use the IAM Information System app to determine the existing Business Catalogs that allow access to specific apps. To find the Business Catalogs, set the Main Entity = Application > enter the app name in the Search field > select 'Go.' Please consider that some applications in SAP S/4HANA Cloud aren't assigned to a specific Scope Item. You can find them in the Application-Workplace list, when you deselect the Scope Items.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Review Data Protection Requirements and Functionality for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare for implementing features that are relevant for data protection. Data protection is associated with numerous legal requirements and privacy concerns. It is important that data protection requirements and related solution functionality are considered during the fit-to-standard workshops. In addition to compliance with general data protection and privacy acts, it is necessary to consider compliance with industry-specific legislation in different countries. Procedure: Understand data privacy and protection regulation for the respective countries that are in scope for the project. Identify legal and corporate policies must be adhere to. Know the stakeholders, their roles and responsibilities in the process of data transfer. Understand company data and have use cases of features required. Get an overview of data protection topic that SAP supports, such as Consent, Read Access Logging, Information Retrieval, etc in the Accel ID = S4H_519. Review standard functionalities that help customer facilitate the compliance process in Accel ID = SSSP_DPP. For example: Data Protection and Privacy (5LE) Information Lifecycle Management (1KA) and Data controller and Purpose (6N9) Access the S/4HANA Cloud Data Model Considerations for Data Protection.pdf accelerator to understand the approach, the need and how solution features can help with compliance of data protection regulations. Procedure Note: SAP provides specific features and functions to support compliance with regard to relevant legal requirements. By nature of legal requirements, the conclusion whether these features are covering customer specific demands as well as the conclusion whether additional measures have to be taken is solely with the customer.

Task.Name: Review Tax Processing Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review tax solution in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and add agenda item for deep dive during Fit-to-Standard workshop. For example: US Jurisdictions Code Tax Code External Tax Package Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) Pro Rata VAT Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) Procedure: Review Help - Tax Processing accelerator for general tax processing related information, i.e. tax related to sales and purchases, withholding tax, etc. Select the country from the Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions accelerator, go to Finance section to review country specific information on tax. Go to Functions Relevant for Several Countries /Regions section in Help - Country/Region-Specific Functions accelerator. Review tax related information under Finance. Search knowledge base to find latest release and restriction information listed on tax solutions. Make sure these restrictions are understood and add to Fit-to-Standard workshop for discussion if needed. For example: See SAP note 2440096 for internal US tax calculation restrictions. See SAP note 2907372 for Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) supported countries, application and processes. In addition to SAP delivered internal tax calculation, for certain countries, customer can switch to the external tax solution to work with an external tax partner. Search for certified tax solution listed in the SAP Certified Solutions Directory accelerator or use SAP Business Accelerator Hub to search for tax related Product and API that works with S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure Note(s): For countries where Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) is in scope, time-dependent taxes are active as soon as you activate that target country. Reference Activate New Scope or Country/Region task during system preparation for Fit-to-Standard workshop. It is important to know that tax solution is set up at the country level. It is not possible to run both the internal and external tax solutions for the same country. Check Blog - External Tax Calculation Overview for S/4HANA Cloud for more information.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard System Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to finalize the setup of the system for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Before the Explore phase can begin, it is important to ensure that a functional system is available to be used for demonstration and visualization purposes during Fit-to-Standard workshops. This is an essential part of the overall implementation strategy as this is the foundation to start with a pre-configured solution during the explore phase.

Task.Name: Create Configuration Transport
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a default customizing request in the Starter System Customizing Tenant to prevent any errors when preparing any of the configuration for the Fit-to-Standard workshops. Apps Used: Export Customizing Transports (Starter System Customizing Tenant) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Create a customizing request in the Export Customizing Transports app. See the SAP Help – 3-System Landscape and Transport Management accelerator for further details on how to create the customizing request. Procedure Note(s): Further details on how to create a customizing request can be found in the following section: 3-System Landscape and Transport Management > Tools and Apps > Export Customizing Transports > Working in the Expert Customizing Transports App. Note: in the Starter System Customizing Tenant, there will be no transportation target for which the configuration will be sent. The transport is local and for technical reason only. The default customizing transport should be created before configuration, as some of the configuration requires the default customizing transport to be created ahead of time.

Task.Name: Verify Configuration for Fit-to-Standard Workshop for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to make sure all required configuration settings are in Starter Customizing Tenant in order to support discussion on selected business processes during Fit-to-Standard workshop. Prerequisites: Starter Customizing Tenant is activated. Reference tasks in Initial System Access for SAP Central Business Configuration and Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System deliverables. Procedure: Check activated scope in evaluation project of SAP Central Business Configuration. Verify countries activated for the selected scope. Cross reference scope item available for the planned country using the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator. Review pre-delivered organization structure and enhance in SAP Central Business Configuration if needed. Reference Help - Project Experience - Organizational Structure Management to get familiar with organization units. Review the configuration activities in SAP Central Business Configuration for selected scope. Update pre-delivered setting and make required adjustments per Business Driven Configuration Assessment results. Reference Help - Project Experience on how to search or access hierarchically according to business areas and perform the activities. Reference task Activate New Scope or Country/Region to select additional scope or country/region if needed. Procedure Note(s): Customizing setting saved in Starter Customizing Tenant of Starter System cannot be transported. If you are changing SAP pre-delivered configuration, make sure to follow guidelines from SAP and discuss the impact of such changes during the workshop. Create service ticket with component XX-S4C-SRV-CON to request pre-approved expert configuration settings if desired. Include transport number and attach filled template(s), which can be found in tabs of Configuration Activity accelerator or using the individual solution process scope specific template. Reference industry specific information in accelerator(s) for scope item list, setup instruction, etc when applicable.

Task.Name: Verify Data and Settings for Fit-to-Standard Workshops for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine if additional data and settings need to be maintained in Starter Customizing Tenant for Fit-to-Standard workshops. SAP Best Practice comes with pre-delivered master data or demo/sample data. In task Set Up Starter System in SAP Central Business Configuration and in task Activate New Scope or Country/Region, demo data are created in Starter Customizing Tenant upon activation and deployment from SAP Central Business Configuration. These data are intended to be used with the Fit-to-standard analysis, making the exploring of pre-configured business processes much easier. Additional project specific data and settings can be created or maintained to help further facilitate the discussion around complex customer topics. In the Starter Customizing Tenant, extensibility for key users is deactivated by default. Prerequisites: Business processes to be demonstrated in the Fit-to-Standard workshops have been reviewed and determined. Procedure: Review Master Data accelerator or access Starter Customizing Tenant to determine if standard pre-delivered demo data is sufficient for all business processes to be demonstrated. Create additional sample data in the Starter Customizing Tenant to further enhance the business processes to be demonstrated. See the Create Your Own Master Data accelerator below for further details. For certain business processes, especially Non-Standard or License Scenarios, check additional master data section in the respective help portal to setup data or initialize functionality for the workshop. For example, see Treasury Management Data and Setting accelerator to find out respective information on master data and settings required when preparing Fit-to-Standard workshop for Treasury Management related optional scope items. Use Extensibility Setting app to activate Key User Extensibility objects when applicable. See the Output Management Set Up Instructions (1LQ) accelerator for more detailed information on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud set up process. Procedure Note(s): It is a best practice to create own data rather than modifying demo master data delivered by SAP in Starter Customizing Tenant. This will help prevent error for additional scope activation and content update and upgrade down the road. Not all data needs to be created ahead of time. Some master data creations are business processes that require dedicated session during Fit-2-Standard workshop to go through in details. Data needed for evaluating reports, or situation handling scenarios are best planned to be created during the Fit-to-Standard workshop as a result of walking through of related business process transactions in Starter Customizing Tenant. Changes of settings, like number ranges, could lead to incompatibilities during upgrade, scope extension and adding new countries. Reference SAP Note 3298955 - Demo Data for Starter System accelerator for more details. A small number of configuration items are not editable due to product master demo data updates. See Help - Configuration for Product Master Data for more information. Extensibility for key users can be activated. However, extension items that are created in Starter System cannot be transported into other systems. Reference Industry specific accelerator for setup instructions when applicable.

Task.Name: Activate New Scope or Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to activate a new solution scenario or a new country/region in the Starter Customizing Tenant in SAP S/4HANA Cloud using SAP Central Business Configuration. Procedure: Review scenarios in scoping activity and select new scenario or country/region in SAP Central Business Configuration. The request for activation of Non-Standard and License Scenarios is done by the Service Center via an Incident/Service Request, with the following information: Subject: ‘Activation of New Licensed Scenarios’ Description: ‘Please activate the scenarios listed below in the Starter Customizing Tenant.' List the scenario title(s) as they appear in SAP Central Business Configuration. Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Some optional process scenarios are now available for activation from SAP Central Business Configuration. Please refer to ‘Selectable in Scoping in SAP Central Business Configuration’ column of the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator to see what can be activated from SAP Central Business Configuration. Check links in ‘More Information on Optional Provisioning’ column in the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items accelerator for special provisioning instruction. For example, using component CO-PC-OBJ_EBR to request "IFRS 15 bundling functionality" if needed, in addition to the activation of optional Event Based Revenue Recognition process. Review sample organizational structure setup and add additional organization structure element when needed. Adjust system settings for selected scope or country/region. Procedure Notes: Reference Help – Project Experience accelerator on scoping, organization structure management and making configuration setting adjustment. When adding new scope or country/region, it is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Content from this scope must be deployed to Starter Customizing Tenant before adding the next set of countries/regions. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. Scope finalization may take some time. Wait for its completion before starting next activity. A scenario/ country cannot be deactivated or removed. Multiple scenarios can be selected in the same change project. Scenarios that require an additional subscription cannot be activated without a subscription contract. For legal entity operating in multiple countries/regions, consider activating Registration for Indirect Taxation Aboard (RITA) function for the plant aboard scenario instead of activating new country/region when applicable. Advance Valuation will be automatically activated by default when adding a new country/region version. Reference SAP Note 3139304 - Automatic Activation of Advanced Valuations for more details and steps to use Classic Valuations before making any postings. For customer using Cloud ALM and uploaded scopes with export from Digital Discover Assessment tool, reflect additional scope in Process app. Reference Process Scoping in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal accelerator. When implementing the solution in a country where there are no pre-configured best practice processes, customer can request participation in early adopter program to use Configuration Localization Tool to copy a source country and further adapt and extend. Activation of Germany in Starter System for evaluation and determine extension and integration backlog items for respective local requirements. Customer can also request a separate sandbox system as describe in task Evaluate the Need for Sandbox Tenant.

Task.Name: Multi-Country Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish a comprehensive multi-country approach for projects that will implement and go-live with multiple country localizations. The deliverable outlines the process of validating and considering various factors to determine the optimal approach for successful initial and future go-lives.

Task.Name: Develop the Multi-Country Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to effectively plan and implement a multiple country roll-out for SAP projects. This task becomes relevant when the project scope includes multiple localizations. A rollout can be executed using a phased approach, deploying several localizations in incremental waves, or through a ‘big-bang’ method, were a global template is used to deploy all countries simultaneously for productive roll-out. It is crucial to review the overall project roll-out during the preparation for the Fit-to-Standard workshop to ensure alignment of key stakeholders across different business areas with the project's priorities and timelines. This alignment aids in risk mitigation later in the project. Additionally, decisions made during the Fit-to-Standard workshop, such as Data Migration, Integration, and Extensibility, must align with the business objectives and the scope required for the countries involved. This task is relevant to implementations that include a scope of multiple localizations. Procedure: Analyze the countries required for rollout and determine the sequence and waves for the rollout. See Multi-Country Rollout in SAP S4HANA Cloud.pptx for more information. The analysis should include the following: Prioritization of countries to be deployed and go-live Availability and Scope (Scope items) Central Governance for configuration and operations Legal requirements Change management End user training System upgrade schedule Document the plan. The final plan will depend on whether you choose to deploy via phased or ‘big bang’ approach.

Task.Name: Data Migration Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to capture and communicate the approach and plan for the data migration to the new environment.

Task.Name: Develop the Data Migration Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to develop the data migration approach and plan. Procedure: Create the data migration approach and plan to cover the following: Key milestones for data delivery Scope of required data sets and their source systems Resource needs, including defined roles and responsibilities Estimated volumes for each data set Required tools (e.g., legacy data extraction, data cleansing, migration cockpit, etc.) Data migration testing activities Data validation procedures Data cleansing efforts Productive system load and post-load support Reporting and tracking mechanisms Procedure Note(s): Always cross reference the Partner’s Statement of Work to assure that the strategy is consistent with scope, roles and responsibilities outlined in the agreement. Ensure that the data migration plan includes integrated applications. Syniti can help with cleansing data after extraction. See Help - SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management by Syniti for more information. See accelerator list for samples.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Prepare Integration Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to list the key integrations to be reviewed during the fit-to-standard workshop.

Task.Name: Select Key Integrations for Fit-to-Standard
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of integrations to be reviewed and demonstrated for the fit-to-standard workshops. Integrations are typically not setup in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System as the system will eventually be decommissioned. Procedure In collaboration with Project Manager and System Architect prepare a list of key integrations that need to be demonstrated during the fit-to-standard workshops. Check the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for available Scope Items and download the respective setup guide. For customer driven integration follow the SAP Help documentation to develop a setup guide and a process model. Procedure Note(s): The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. Integration efforts spent on SAP S/4HANA Starter system will be lost eventually once the system is decommissioned.

Task.Name: Security Analysis and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this Deliverable is to consider security principles from the beginning of the implementation project. Design decisions made during the Prepare phase can affect the security posture of the final system.

Task.Name: Develop the Security Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to incorporate Security Recommendations into the Implementation Plan as defined in Accel ID = S4H_2581. Procedure: Please review and incorporate the topics mentioned in Security in SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition as a part of your implementation plan. The topics can be classified into the following categories Implementation Aspects Evaluate Integration Security Posture Evaluate and Plan Frontend Protection Design and Plan Authentication Recurring Topics Plan Certificate Management Plan Security Monitoring Design and Plan User Lifecycle Plan External Software Security and Patching

Task.Name: Analytics Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to capture and communicate the approach and plan for the analytics workstream.

Task.Name: Develop the Analytics Approach and Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the alignment of the customer analytics journey approach and planning. Procedure: Review the SAP Activate Analytics Strategy accelerator which includes the following: Key milestones Roles and responsibilities Tools and considerations (i.e. My Fiori Apps Reference Library, SAP Analytics Cloud, and other) Procedure Note(s): Proposing an advisory role from SAP will not only ensure the customer has the right vision and strategy regarding data and analytics but will also ensure the customer journey will continue on the right path with increased adoption of SAP solutions. Always cross reference the project statement of work to assure that the strategy is consistent with scope, roles and responsibilities outlined in the agreement.

Task.Name: Enablement Strategy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to analyze your current enablement activities and to provide detailed strategic direction based on this analysis. It will help the customer gain an understanding of the new learning enablement strategy and the enablement activities implemented to support the digital transformation process.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Review Enablement Strategy Research and Interviews
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand the current learning and enablement capabilities to support a successful rollout of new learning enablement plans; such as is there an existing training and education team, enablement tools and processes. Enablement activities are defined that are needed to support the digital transformation process and/or customer project. Procedure: Schedule and conduct interviews to assess training and adoption needs, evaluate the current status of learning enablement, and define the desired future condition. Find and conduct interviews with the Project Manager and Program Manager from the customer's organization involved in the SAP implementation project. Find and conduct interviews with the Education Manager, Organizational Change Manager, Head of Human Resources, and any other relevant key stakeholders within the customer's organization, as requested. Review both the Preparing an Enablement Strategy and Enablement Strategy Overview.pptx to understand the process of outlining an enablement strategy. Review the learning journey section on Understanding the Enablement Strategy Process to gain insight into the enablement strategy process and its objectives. It includes examples and templates for developing an effective enablement strategy.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Document Enablement Strategy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to document a learning enablement strategy plan to ensure the proposed enablement plan is a collaborative effort in lock step with all key stakeholders and line-of-business managers. Procedure: Assess current learning culture to leverage existing resources, learning and knowledge sharing channels and capabilities. Define the full enablement scope from the functional, organizational, geographical and technical perspective, with a focus on real-life business context. Build a best practice learning enablement methodology in conjunction with all key stakeholders. Aim for efficiency through a continuous learning enablement approach, determining the full scope of the learning enablement and knowledge management activities. Review the Documenting the Enablement Strategy accelerator and document the enablement strategy using the Enablement Strategy Template to share with key stakeholders, ensuring a clear understanding of the overall learning and enablement approach.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Learning Needs Analysis for Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to identify the project team’s learning needs and proposed learning paths, based on the roles of the project team and the objectives of the project. It also evaluates any knowledge gaps and suggests future learning paths.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Identify Learning Needs for Project Team
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to begin the learning needs analysis for project team process; to identify the processes in scope and analyze the training required for the project team. Procedure: Align with the key project stakeholders on the learning needs and digital learning opportunities. Review the scope of the project. Analyze different learning methods and content types in Accel ID = CALM_012, SAP Learning Hub and standard SAP courses. Review both Planning a Learning Needs Analysis and Learning Needs Analysis Project Team Overview to understand the methods for effectively analyzing and identifying learning requirements for project teams and business users. Review the learning journey section on Preparing for the Project Team Interviews to understand the end-to-end process and activities involved in analyzing the project team's learning needs. It includes examples and templates for conducting a learning needs analysis for the project team.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Create Learning Curriculum based on SAP Standard Learning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of content types and learning methods to enable the project team. Procedure: Provide a fully scoped analysis of learning requirements for the project team. Review the SAP Learning Hub content and standard SAP courses to develop the project team curriculum, based on solutions and business processes in scope for the project. The course catalog should be categorized into functional process and sub-process areas including the key tasks and process overviews, the audience (business role), learning duration, method of delivery, and any pre-requisites required.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Conduct Business Review
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to present the learning needs analysis findings to the project team key stakeholders. Procedure: Create the learning needs analysis for project team report. Present the learning needs analysis findings to the project SMEs and key stakeholders for review and final sign-off.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Prepare Phase Closure and Sign-Off
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to ensure that all required deliverables from the phase and the project are complete and accurate, and to close any outstanding issues. This involves a thorough review to confirm the completion of all key deliverables and actions, ensuring compliance with recommended practices and customer satisfaction. Additionally, the deliverable aims to identify lessons learned during the phase, which will be valuable for future phases and projects. Capturing customer feedback and potential customer references is also a critical component, providing insights for continuous improvement and validation of project success. By achieving these objectives, the deliverable facilitates a formal phase closure, allowing the project to proceed to the next phase with a clear understanding of accomplishments and areas for improvement.

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate for Prepare Phase
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase. Prior to moving into the next phase, each project manager must demonstrate compliance with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality. Procedure: Review the SAP Activate Quality Gate Concept to ensure an understanding of what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Use the designated Quality Gate template in the accelerator section to conduct the Quality Gate. Share the Quality Gate results with relevant stakeholders. Identify and implement any necessary follow-up actions based on the Quality Gate results. Procedure Note(s): New additional key deliverables need to be added in the quality gate checklist by the Project Manager to the different project types.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues. Once sign-off is obtained, the project can move forward to the next phase. Procedure: Identify and list all key deliverables from phase delivery. Confirm the status of completion and any outstanding actions. Utilize the designated Phase Sign-Off Template in the accelerator section to obtain approval by presenting the sign-off document to the nominated signatory. Obtain phase signoff and agreement for any possible outstanding actions utilizing the designated Phase Off Sign Off template in the accelerator section.

Task.Name: Explore
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to perform a fit-to-standard analysis to validate the solution functionality included in the project scope and to confirm that the business requirements can be satisfied. Identified delta configuration values are added to the backlog for use in the next phase. Explore Phase Activities: Project Management Execution, Monitoring and Controlling Customer Project Team Enablement Fit-to-Standard Analysis Configuration Definition Integration Prerequisites Confirmation Solution Extension Preparation Data Load Preparation Phase Closure In the Explore phase, solution experts lead a series of structured show-and-tell and solution design workshops. The goals of these workshops is to review the best practice functionalities of the SAP solution, identify delta requirements and determine the configuration of the SAP cloud solution.

Task.Name: Execution and Monitoring of Project
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to execute the approved project work and assess performances to identify deviations from the plan. The objective is to manage the project scope while monitoring the execution, identifying variances, tracking quality outcomes, managing progress, controlling changes, assessing risks, and communicating project status. The Project Management Plan, created during the Prepare phase, outlines the approach for managing, executing, monitoring, and controlling of project activities across the relevant knowledge areas. This methodology provides guidance for each activity, supported by monitoring and controlling strategies. The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the monitoring and control measures established during planning are applied with the appropriate level of oversight. In projects covered by the SAP Premium Engagement agreement, such as Active Embedded or MaxAttention, the SAP Technical Quality Manager (TQM) oversees specific activities. The roles of the SAP TQM and the Project Manager are separate and distinct throughout the project delivery process.

Task.Name: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide users with the essential knowledge and resources required to successfully navigate and contribute to projects and implementations involving SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with essential components, including the solution map, SAP tools and implementation, roles and authorization, and system testing using the 3rd Onboarding session - Project Guidance one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome and introduction phase to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the Accel ID = S4H_1703.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to guide the project manager and team in executing the project management plan and completing the work outlined in the project scope statement. The team will carry out key activities to achieve project objectives, manage resources efficiently, and maintain effective communication. Procedure: Execute project work: Perform tasks to achieve objectives, allocating effort and funds as needed. Staff, train, and manage the project team. Acquire and utilize necessary resources. Apply planned methods and standards. Develop, control, verify and validate deliverables. Oversee and manage the approved project scope. Identify, assess, and address project risks. Resolve issues and drive them to closure. Integrate approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment. Establish and maintain effective internal and external communication. Collect project data and report on progress and performance. Monitor and guide work results: Evaluate project performance against the project management plan to identify deviations. Implement corrective and preventive actions based on performance assessments. Track and manage risks proactively. Provide metrics to support progress tracking, performance reporting, and forecasting. Oversee the implementation of approved changes and take action when needed. Refer to the ‘Analytics’ topic in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Manage scope and requirements: Define what is and isn’t included based on the agreed scope and Project Charter. Manage scope and requirement changes per the Change Management Plan. Manage roles and team resources: Ensure effective staffing and team motivation. Plan and implement skill development activities to enhance performance. Adjust team composition as needed and manage roles for optimal resource utilization. Manage schedule: Maintain control over the project schedule to ensure timely delivery. Adjust timelines and budgets when scope or deliverables change. Establish and track new baseline estimates for cost, effort, and duration. Manage budget: Monitor the budget to ensure the project remains within approved limits. Track all project-related costs and take corrective action on variances. Control quality: Proactively manage quality to prevent issues in deliverables. Apply quality control and assurance practices. Ensure that all deliverables meet customer expectations and defined requirements. Procedure Note(s): Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities.

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project manager maintains up-to-date key project management documents. The project management plan serves as a comprehensive collection of project documents, including the project schedule, budget and cost information, monitoring and controlling plans, and other relevant information. It provides the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices throughout the project lifecycle. Procedure: Update the project schedule, project budget, management plans, scope document, and business case to reflect the detailed scope information defined during the project. For additional guidance on document management, refer to the solution specific accelerators in the accelerator section. Provide updates to the following documents: Project management plan. Project work breakdown structure (WBS). Project schedule. Project budget. Business case. Scope document. Backlog document (created during the Explore phase).

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage, quantify, and prioritize project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. This ensures that all issues are tracked and managed efficiently, providing visibility and transparency for the project management team. Procedure: Identify the internal and external risks most likely to impact the project. Document and monitor these risks using the Open Issues List Template.xls. Manage the issues documented in the Open Issues List Template.xls by following these steps: Raise and categorize an issue based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology.
