Log the issue in the Open Issues List Template.xls, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. Assign a priority, develop a mitigation plan, and identify the responsible person when creating the issue. Conduct regular follow-ups on issues in accordance with the standard issue management process defined in the project management plans. Escalate unresolved issues to the next level of governance, if applicable, to maintain project cadence and prevent delays to the go-live timeline. Review critical issues as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Procedure Note(s): Record and monitor all changes, referencing the available accelerators in the accelerator section – including solution-specific tools, if applicable.

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and communicate project status and progress reports. This includes producing various performance reports tailored to specific audiences and objectives, as defined in the project communication plan. The goal is to ensure clear communication of key activities, deliverable progress, and the project's status in relation to the schedule and budget. Procedure: Provide brief weekly status updates to the team lead via email or during team meetings. Team leads should also submit weekly team status reports to the project manager using the Accel ID = PM.40, which may be reviewed in meetings or submitted in a standard format. Create the weekly project status report based on input from teams and additional data like issue and risk lists. Prepare a monthly or quarterly executive status report for the steering group, reusing key insights from the weekly reports, but adding program value, benefits, and decisions needed from leadership. Regularly review and update the Communication Plan Overview Template as new information becomes available to guide the team's communication approach throughout the project.

Task.Name: Deliver Program Goal Alignment Survey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver a Program Goal Alignment survey to get feedback on the Core Team’s cloud mindset adoption, and to capture whether they have clarity on the transformation and definition of success. The survey also supports Organizational Change Management (OCM) efforts by providing insight into stakeholders’ views on team process, governance and empowerment. The feedback gained will shed light on the core team’s current engagement and sentiment before moving to the Explore phase. Prerequisites: The Readiness Assessment results from the Discover phase have been gathered and communicated The recommendations and findings from the Readiness Assessment are understood and, where applicable, corrective actions have been taken. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Program Goal Alignment’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Program Goal Alignment survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Program Goal Alignment’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Program Goal Alignment survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Communication Plan Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to enhance the information level of all stakeholders involved in the SAP implementation project, to foster understanding and commitment and facilitate a fast and sustainable user adoption. Achieving this objective includes tailoring communication efforts to suite the diverse requirements of the various target audiences, while ensuring a coherent message throughout. As a result, it is highly recommended to establish a change story that outlines the rationale and the benefits of the SAP implementation project. This narrative will serve as the foundation of all communication activities.

Task.Name: Prepare Communication Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure effective communication delivery. It is crucial to recognize the significance of a well-planned and comprehensive preparation of communication activities. Adequate time should be allotted as preparatory tasks can be quite time-consuming. For instance, creating communication assets such as presentations may require the involvement of corporate communication teams, while arranging information sessions like townhall meetings entails a multitude of operations duties (for example, reserving venues, briefing speakers, and conducting rehearsals). Procedure: Involve project team members and other experts (e.g. from communication or marketing departments) essential for upcoming communication activities, as documented in the existing Accel ID = S4H_1837. Create and revise communication material, and ensure that all operational requirements for delivery are fulfilled (e.g. arranging meetings, reserving venues). Align communication activities and obtain approval by project management or project sponsor.

Task.Name: Deliver Communication Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to keep all stakeholder groups informed about the SAP implementation project, and to provide opportunities for interaction and discussion. At the beginning of the project, the shared information may be relatively general, such as project significance, structure, and timeline. It is only in later project phases that it becomes feasible to provide more specific details on the project’s actual implications for different stakeholder groups (e.g. process modifications, new roles, and responsibilities). To assess the effectiveness of the conducted activities, it is strongly advised to incorporate feedback mechanisms. Procedure: Execute communication activities according to the existing Accel ID = S4H_1837. Collect feedback on communication activities from target groups. Document communication delivery, including lessons learned.

Task.Name: Update Communication Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to promote a successful and streamlined communication delivery, and to guarantee that the communication plan is completely synchronized with the overall project plan and milestones. Integrating insights from lessons learned gathered in previously executed activities into the communication plan enables targeting communication efforts to the requirements of the various stakeholder groups. Furthermore, it avoids investing project resources in communication efforts that have only little impact. Consistently updating the communication plan also helps in documenting and monitoring executed communication activities. Procedure: Review collected feedback on conducted communication activities. Verify if changes in overall project situation have occurred (e.g. timeline, scope, affected stakeholders). Finetune current activities and incorporate new activities into the existing Accel ID = S4H_1837, as necessary.

Task.Name: User Adoption Strategy
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to systematically identify and manage factors that influence user adoption in an SAP Cloud project. User adoption refers to the process users undergo when transitioning from a legacy system to a new system. Achieving high user adoption involves cultivating positive emotions towards the new SAP Cloud solution and processes (affective component), instilling a belief in the added value of the changes (cognitive component), and fostering a strong willingness to embrace the required new behavior (behavioral component). By measuring key adoption and experience metrics, issues and potential risks can be proactively identified at an early stage. This lays the groundwork for achieving rapid sustainable user adoption post go-live. Additionally, integrating insights from a detailed change impact analysis provides valuable information for defining appropriate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and helps prioritize mitigation measures in business areas expected to experience high change impacts.

Task.Name: Enable WalkMe Insights Analytics
Task.Notes: About WalkMe Insights The purpose of this task is to ensure customers understand how to effectively use the WalkMe Insights analytics feature both during and after the implementation of their solution. WalkMe Insights provides real-time data on end-user engagement, enabling teams to monitor usage trends, identify areas for optimization, and measure the impact of their WalkMe content and the underlying product experience. Procedure: Review and understand the core capabilities of WalkMe Insights, including Flow Analytics and Custom Dashboards. Refer to the content in About WalkMe Insights Select which use cases are needed to review usage metrics. For additional information, see the section Use Cases in About WalkMe Insights. Understand the level of data collected by reviewing Accel ID = S4H_2907. Recommend key performance indicators (KPIs) to track in the respective solution. Enable WalkMe Insight by following the Insights: Getting Started Guide Procedure Note(s): WalkMe Insights Analytics is only available with WalMe Premium. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe. Continue using WalkMe Analytics after go-live throughout the Run phase to ensure continuous adoption monitoring. Analytics insights should be integrated and fed into Organizational Change Management (OCM) activities.

Task.Name: Identify User Adoption Metrics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for evaluating user adoption of the SAP Cloud solution. It is important to cover KPIs that monitor influencing factors on user adoption both before and during the go-live phase, as well as KPIs to assess actual user adoption post go-live. The recommended approach involves compiling a list of potential KPIs for each category. Subsequently, the relevant KPIs for the SAP Cloud project should be determined by the project team. When selecting these KPIs, one important aspect is the effort involved in collecting the necessary data. Additionally, compliance with data security regulations is imperative. Furthermore, it is essential to inform and involve the works council in accordance with local codetermination requirements. Procedure: Collect potential user adoption and experience metrics using the List of User Adoption Metrics accelerator. Discuss the potential KPIs within the project team and throughout the business organization. Decide on the KPIs for the SAP Cloud project. Procedure Note(s): WalkMe is a digital adoption platform that helps organizations enhance user onboarding and enablement throughout their transformation journey with SAP solutions. It offers interactive guides, walkthroughs, and valuable insights into user behavior with targeted applications. Explore how WalkMe works by joining the WalkMe Interactive Demo and experiencing its features in action. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe.

Task.Name: Define and Conduct Process for Monitoring User Adoption
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine how, when, and how often the identified Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) will be collected. This involves deciding on the tools or survey platforms to be used for measuring the agreed-upon metrics. Furthermore, there is a need to determine which KPIs should be applied to specific business areas or user groups. Given that different KPIs typically involve input and activity from various experts or units, it is essential to clearly assign respective responsibilities. Additionally, upfront communication with the affected business units is crucial to secure management buy-in. Ideally, management actively supports the data collection process by providing necessary resources and promoting conducted surveys. Typically, the change manager oversees and monitors the orchestration of the data collection process. The data collection encompasses KPIs both before and during the go-live phase, while KPIs after go-live are captured through user adoption analysis. Procedure: Determine the segmentation of user groups to monitor user adoption metrics. Define the approach for data collection for each KPI, specifying the timeline and frequency using the User Adoption Process Checklist accelerator. Collect data for user adoption KPIs within the specified target groups, adhering to the established timeline.

Task.Name: Identify and Address Risks Regarding User Adoption
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to effectively prepare the organization for the implementation of the new SAP Cloud solution, targeting a high user adoption post go-live. A comprehensive view of the gathered user adoption metrics and an open dialogue within the project leadership team enable the identification of potential risks to user adoption, which can then be systematically addressed. Appropriate mitigation activities typically involve aspects such as organizing additional communication efforts, enhancing, or adapting training programs, ensuring visible top management support, or adjusting the organizational transition and cut-over plan, including user support and troubleshooting. Given that these activities fall under different areas of responsibility, including change management, training, project management, top management, or the management of impacted business units, a clear assignment of responsibility is crucial for each mitigation activity. Procedure: Document and discuss the collected user adoption metrics within the project team. Identify user adoption risks specific to each user group and business area. Obtain and document mitigation activities using the User Adoption Risk Mitigation Plan accelerator.

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Workshops
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to conduct fit-to-standard workshops and capture requirements. The standard processes allow for a more efficient approach to validating the fit of the customer requirements to the standard solution. The fit-to-standard workshops are organized around the functional areas of the solution and are used to explore the functionality, to show how the solution can meet the business requirements, and to help enable business process experts on the execution of processes. Delta requirements are identified; discussed; and then added to the backlog. The fit-to-standard workshops use an iterative approach to assure that integrated dependencies are addressed. During the workshops, configuration changes are determined and cataloged as outputs of the fit-to-standard process and are used as inputs for the Solution Configuration process in Realize. In each workshop, the following process takes place: Review standard processes using SAP Best Practices Demonstrate business processes and concepts Discuss how the processes fit with customer requirements Identify delta requirements (such as analytics, output management, integration, extensibility, etc.) Identify required configuration Enable customer on execution of processes

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Joule, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Chart of Accounts - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define how the customer’s Chart of Accounts can be reflected in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. During the workshop, the project team will review the pre-delivered Chart of Accounts and map the customer’s Chart of Accounts to the delivered one and make the appropriate adjustments needed to reflect the customer's business in the solution. Procedure: See Chart of Account Configuration - Overview.pptx accelerator on the overall process of adapting a pre-delivered standard Chart of Account to customer specific needs. View the Chart of Accounts in the Starter Customizing Tenant using the Manage Chart of Accounts app. Access SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection to download and review the Account Determination (global) and Account Determination (local) templates. Capture backlog of any changes to the standard delivered accounts and configurations. Procedure Note(s): To access the account determination templates, navigate to the ‘Accelerators’ section under General Documentation. See Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance: Overview accelerator for user roles related to Chart of Accounts. Navigate to the “Adapting the Standard Chart of Accounts to Your Needs” section for more information on renumbering G/L Accounts or defining an Account Group.

Task.Name: Organizational Structure - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define how the customer’s Organizational Structure will be reflected in the solution. During the workshop, the project team will review the pre-delivered Organizational Structure and map to the customer’s Organizational Structure. Additionally, they will make the appropriate adjustments to accommodate the customer’s organization needs. Procedure: Review the delivered Organizational Structure. Define the required adjustments needed for the Organizational Structure. Use the Organizational Data Overview.xlsx accelerator as a template to capture any changes to the standard delivered organizational structure needed to satisfy business requirements as backlog items. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, use the Requirement app to capture. Procedure Note(s): It is important to have a target organization structure documented as a result of the workshop. After activation and setup in Realize phase, organization structure can only be modified, but not deleted. Selecting an additional country/region will result in new mandatory org structure maintenance for selected scenarios that are in scope.

Task.Name: Finance - Conduct Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct workshop(s), demonstrate the solution and drive discussion with Businesses Process Experts using Starter Customizing Tenant, covering one or more following topic(s). Certain topic may require dedicated workshop to cover the topic entirely. Treasury Management Financial Operations Accounting and Financial Close Enterprise, Risk & Compliance Cost Management and Profitability Analysis Advanced Financial Operations Advanced Accounting and Financial Close Subscription Billing and Revenue Management Pre-requisite: Configuration Experts should use Finance - Conduct Workshop.pptx to create their own agenda for the workshop. For dedicated discussion on Treasury Management, reference the Treasury Overview.pptx for more details. Procedure: Business Process Experts should review all the necessary SAP Best Practices content (test scripts, process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. Access the SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection for the content and select the relevant country. It is also very important to note the activation details and prerequisites under the Additional Information section of the solution process when applicable. Review the implementation scope with participants in the Define Scope activity in SAP Central Business Configuration. Confirm Non-Standard or Optional scope items. Not all optional scope items can be activated in SAP Central Business Configuration. Some may require additional assistant from SAP. For example, for further information on event-based revenue recognition see the Event-Based Revenue Recognition - Customer Projects.pdf . Some may need to be requested via a service ticket during the initial system activation and be included in the very first transport. For example, Group Valuation (5W2), Additional Depreciation Areas of Fixed Assts (5HG & 5KF). These scope items can't be implemented later, they need to be activated during initial scoping. Some may have dependency on other scope items, which then need to be activated together. Confirm License Scenarios. For example, additional subscription is needed for Collection and Dispute Management (BFC). For deprecated scope item, discuss and determine the replacement. For example, scope item BEV is deprecated as of 1905, consider using scope item 1NT instead. Deep dive on critical financial topics, evaluate options and confirm the settings. These setting can't be changed after initial activation and posting of transactional data. For example: Group currency Use Help - Ledger Scenario to choose the right ledger combination. Use Asset Accounting: Transaction Types.xlsx app to view tax information for a country. Decide on Tax Processing solution details from task Review Tax Processing Solution. Review Supported Fiscal Year Variant accelerator to determine the default Fiscal Year Variant to be applied to all company code or use Fiscal Year Variant Implementation - Overview accelerator to assess the need to create customer specific value. Capture all backlog items including: Additional configuration activities or adjustment to pre-delivered setting. Integration setup that needs to be performed. For example, as described in How to Integrate SAP S/4HANA Cloud with Payment Service Providers.pptx . Master data needed for configuration settings. Additional data, setting or initializations required before system use. Output layout and conditions. Additional analytics and reporting not covered out of box. Functionality that needs to be enhanced by custom development. SAP Build and Machine Learning use cases to be implemented. For example, as described in Machine Learning - SAP Cash Application Intelligence (1MV) accelerator. Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a two-tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, apply filter ‘Additional Information >Two-Tier ERP’ to review solution processes for Two-Tier ERP in SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection and capture backlog items. For additional information on downloading financial statements to Excel, see accelerator Export Financial Statements to Microsoft Excel. See Forum - Finance accelerator for more information and discussions on topics in Finance. For example, use search terms like ‘ledger’, ‘currency’ for lessons learned on critical financial settings. For Asset Accounting, in addition to content in SAP Signavio Process Navigator, use Asset Accounting: Transaction Types.xlsx accelerator for an overview of transaction types used in asset accounting postings and delivered by standard content. For remote, or hybrid, fit-to-standard workshops utilize the pre-filled Mural templates, or another collaboration template, to capture all the questions and discussion points during the fit-to-standard workshop. See the Fit-to-Standard Workshops – Mural Template accelerator for more information. The backlog items captured from the discussion in the Mural templates will be migrated later into in a central Backlog. For Customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access business process content in the Processes app and use the Requirement app to capture all backlog items. Use ‘workstream’ field and ‘Tag’ field to further classify or categorize all requirements.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), SAP Build

Task.Name: Conduct Workshop by Business Process Area
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct workshops in respective business process areas and subareas to confirm implementation scope, identify delta requirements and create backlog. Followings are examples of business process areas in different line of businesses: Human Resources: Core HR and Time Recording, etc. Sales: Order and Contract Management, Subscription Billing and Revenue Management, etc. Source and Procurement: Operational Procurement, Sourcing and Contract Management, etc. Manufacturing: Production Operations, Production Processing, Quality Management, etc. R&D Engineering: Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management, Product Engineering, Product Lifecyle Management, etc. Supply Chain: Warehousing, Inventory, Shipping and Transportation, etc. Service: Service Master Data & Agreement Management, Service Operations & Processes, etc. Asset Management: Environment, Health and Safety, Maintenance Management, etc. Procedure: Business Process Experts should review all the necessary SAP Best Practices content (test scripts, process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. Access the SAP Signavio Process Explorer for the content and select the relevant country. It is also very important to note the activation details and prerequisites in the Additional Information section of the solution process when applicable. Configuration Experts should demonstrate the solution processes and drive discussion with Business Process Experts using the Starter Customizing Tenant. Reference task Execute Standard Business Processes for SAP best practices. Review the implementation scope with participants in SAP Central Business Configuration to confirm scope items. Not all optional scope items can be activated in SAP Central Business Configuration. Confirm non-standard, optional and/or licensed scenarios. Some may require additional assistant from SAP. Some may need to be requested via a service ticket during the initial activation and be included in the very first transport. Some may have dependency on other scope items, which then need to be activated together. For example, Mobile RF Devices in Warehousing (63V). Note down the list of applications that are in the scope for the project in the Application - Workplace list created in task Create Initial Application - Workplace List during Prepare phase. Create backlog including, for example: Additional configuration activities or adjustment to pre-delivered setting Standard Integration setup that needs to be performed Customer Driven Integration setup for integrated applications Master data needed for configuration settings Additional data, settings or initializations required before system use Output layout and conditions Additional dashboard and reporting not covered out of box Functionality that needs to be enhanced by custom development SAP Build and Machine Learning use cases to be implemented Joule Capabilities to be adopted and implemented Procedure Note(s): For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a two-tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy to run their global business, apply filter ‘Additional Information > Two-Tier ERP’ to review solution processes relevant for Two-Tier ERP in SAP Signavio Process Explorer and capture backlog items. See Forum accelerators for more information and discussions on topics in respective business process area. For remote or hybrid fit-to-standard workshops, utilize the pre-filled Mural templates, or another collaboration template, to capture all the questions and discussion points during the fit-to-standard workshop. See the Fit-to-Standard Workshops - Mural Template for more information. The backlog items captured from the discussion in the Mural templates will be manually transferred later into SAP Cloud ALM, or, alternatively in a central Backlog. For Customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access business process content in the Processes app and use the Requirement app to capture all backlog items. Use ‘Workstream’ field and ‘Tag’ field to further classify or categorize all requirements. SAP Signavio Process Explorer has valuable accelerators for customers to explore standard and/or industry specific, business capabilities /scope Itens and solution processes like SAP S/4HANA best practices. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement of SAP Signavio products. Leverage SAP Signavio and LeanIX integration to see which processes are affected by initiatives and to-be architecture documented in SAP LeanIX. If WalkMe is in scope, use it during the review of desired target state business process flows to identify and bridge gaps effectively, enhance usability and workflow performance. Demonstrate standard business processes with WalkMe to provide real-time guidance and contextual help, especially in areas where users struggle. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Joule, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Execute Standard Business Processes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for all business process experts to execute the standard processes covered during the Fit-to-Standard workshops. The SAP Best Practices content, test scripts, and process flows that were used by the Configuration Expert for the demonstration are used. Prerequisites: Created credentials for the demo system and have verified access. SAP Best Practices were activated, and other key processes, including demo data, have been prepared. Procedure: Navigate to the Accel ID = S4H_177. Use the scope ID to search for the desired standard business process that will be executed. Open the scope item page and select the relevant localization, and download the test script and process flow. Review the process flow to obtain a high-level overview of the process that will be executed. Use the test script and provided data to execute the standard process in the Fit-to-Standard System. Note(s): Not all scope items can be executed in the starter system. Examples are, but not limited to, integration and scope items requiring additional subscriptions. Not all scope items are available for all countries. Additional Processes might have been added to the Fit-to-Standard System. Use the prepared Business process models and test scripts to review. For the Customers using SAP Cloud ALM, go to the Processes app in SAP Cloud ALM to create a project scope. Add the relevant solution scenario and navigate to the solution value flow and solution process flow to execute the standard process.

Task.Name: Conduct Data Protection Workshop
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to conduct an initial workshop to confirm the implementation scope and configuration settings in the context of data protection and privacy. In addition to compliance with general data protection and privacy acts, it is necessary to consider compliance with industry-specific legislation in different countries. This involves understanding data protection and privacy requirements, reviewing SAP's design and concept for data protection, and discussing the scope and configuration possibilities with stakeholders. As the data protection and privacy requirements are covering a wide range of topics (from information security, to authorizations, audit documentations and beyond), the goal of this workshop is to identify the relevant project areas and tasks where data protection requirements are to be applied. The outcome of this workshop is an overall project planning with tasks for data protection experts and project stakeholders. Data protection topics are generally to be considered in the following project areas, amongst others: Application Design & Configuration (Data Privacy by Default & Design) Extensibility (Extensibility / Custom Code Security) Integration (Data Usage, Data Flow) Testing (Data Usage, Test Environment, Test Execution) Data Management (Data Migration) Analytics (Data Usage) Procedure: Clarify data protection requirements that need to be adhered to by data protection experts. Review the SAP Help Portal to gain an understanding of SAP's design and concept for data protection, as well as all necessary SAP Best Practices content ( Help - Data Protection , process flows, etc.) related to the scope items. This will help clarify the required data protection and privacy solutions and activities relevant for the project. Key solutions include: Defining data controllers and purposes for processing personal information Simplified Blocking and Deletion of personal data Information Retrieval Consent Administration Security Safeguards Regarding Data Protection Review the implementation scope to confirm the required solution configuration and implementation Identify stakeholders who should provide inputs for configuration and implementation of data protection solutions and functionalities Discuss the configuration and implementation scope of the required data protection solutions within dedicated workshops with the relevant stakeholders. The following are examples of the expected outcomes: Transparency over the processing of personal data within the relevant system landscape, historical data migration is to be taken into consideration Identification of applications, systems and business processes that will be processing personal data as well as the relevant data flows Identification of business processes maintaining personal master data relevant for the End of Purpose (EoP) applications Identify transactional data objects that require blocking and destruction, historical data migration is to be taken into consideration Structure for the definition and technical implementation of data controllers as well as the processing purposes Definition of retention and residence policies Definition of data privacy related security and technical measures Design information retrieval for applications in scope Create an overall project and communication. Procedure Note(s): SAP provides specific features and functions to support compliance with regard to relevant legal requirements. By nature of legal requirements, the conclusion whether these features are covering customer specific demands as well as the conclusion whether additional measures have to be taken is solely with the customer. For further assistance and support regarding the understanding of data protection and privacy related functionalities and solutions, as well as the implementation thereof, please reach out to your SAP Account Executive or Technical Quality Manager for the respective Consulting Services or reach out to SAP Consulting. Utilize Design and Configuration Documentation Template - Data Protection and Privacy.docx guide the discussion, document scope and configuration details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Fit-to-Standard Workshops Documentation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure that all outputs from the Fit-to-Standard workshops are captured, classified, and stored in the agreed system of record, preferably SAP Cloud ALM. Any missing functionality or outputs should be documented as requirements in SAP Cloud ALM. These requirements must be addressed during the Realize phase and incorporated into testing plans to confirm that business needs are met. For projects not using SAP Cloud ALM, the Adoption Backlog template can be used.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Joule, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Document and Maintain Business Process Flows
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure the To-Be business processes, or the Target State of business processes, are clearly documented per fit-to-standard workshops. A complete end-to-end business process flow is an important input for the following activities: Planning and design tasks of extension, integration, analytics, etc. Organization change management tasks End user training User acceptance testing Update and upgrades Prerequisites: Have access to software that can support the edit of BPMN files. Procedure: Download process flows from Accel ID = S4H_968, if not already done so, for all implementation scope items which require additional maintenance (i.e. additional points of integration and extensibility). Gather business process model update requirements from the fit-to-standard workshops and make adjustments to the process flows accordingly. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, add target business process flow document links in this task. Procedure Note(s): Examples of software used for maintaining the business process flows are SAP PowerDesigner, or SAP Signavio Process Manager. If using WalkMe, ensure that any WalkMe Walk-Thrus listed as requirements are fully documented and classified based on their importance and impact. This documentation will be crucial during the solution design in the Realize phase. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Document Localization Requirements
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to document localization requirements for country/region that are part of the project implementation scope. In addition to general functions, there are country/region-specific functions that may need to be implemented to meet local requirements, for example in legal, tax, compliance related processes areas. Procedure: For countries where there is a standard template, document what is in scope for the country specific functions to be activated and also highlight what needs to be adjusted from the pre-defined configuration. For early adoption program customer that uses Configuration Localization Tool, document all required configuration changes that deviate from the source template country. Leverage Localization Configuration Activities accelerator as a template for documentation. Document localization specific extensibility requirements required to extend the localized functions and configurations. Document any integration scenarios, for example any external tax calculation software packages.

Task.Name: Document Requirements
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to ensure all requirements captured during the Fit-to-Standard workshops are documented and confirmed. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, review information captured in the Requirements app from the workshop. Clarify, detail out requirements to high level solutioning with effort estimation that can be started for the Realize phase. Some requirements (i.e. extension, analytics, integration, Artificial Intelligence, Identity and Access Management, etc) will be further refined by technical experts in subsequent the Planning and Design tasks. Procedures: Use the Design and Configuration Documentation Template accelerator to create customer's own version to include target business processes with customer specific configuration values, integration points and extension requirements. Documentation can be by business process area like Supply Chain, Manufacturing, etc or by cross process area related topics like Data Protection and Privacy, etc. Document scope and settings for initial activation of system via SAP Central Business Configuration later in Realize phase. Use Availability and Dependency of Scope Item accelerator as a template to note down scope and its country relevancy. This should also include cross function, general setting scope items, ie. Embedded Analytics, Output Management, Integration scenarios, etc. Alternatively, for customer using Cloud ALM, use Process app to flag solution processes ‘In Scope’ with respective country. Confirm critical financial settings (i.e fiscal year variant, group currency). They are one-time setting that can't be changed after activation. Highlight those scope items that can only be included during initial scoping. Reference task Finance - Conduct Workshop for detail examples. Use Organizational Data Overview accelerator to capture the desired org structure. Make sure to include additional required org structures for optional scope items (i.e. Warehouse Management, etc.) Leverage Configuration Activity accelerator as a template to confirm detail changes. This should include adjustments to standard delivered analytics and reports. As indicated by ‘Delete Customer Records’ column in the Configuration Activity accelerator, deletion is not supported for all customer created configuration. If you are changing SAP pre-delivered configuration, make sure to understand the impact of such changes and plan on fully test the functionality after the change. Fill out the corresponding tab (i.e. 5D2 advanced intercompany sales, etc) in the Configuration Activity accelerator for Expert Configuration that can only be requested via service ticket during Realize phase. Create one document per each item and request during appropriate sprint. Use the Master Data (General) accelerator as a template to capture naming convention or details for master data like material, vendor, customer, and work center, etc. For finance related master data, capture updates or changes required from pre-delivered values. This is also an important input to data migration strategy. Document additional data and settings that needs to be entered in Development, Test and Production System respectively: Data used in transportable configuration settings One time activation settings Master data before transaction Use the accelerator Extensibility Functional Specifications Template to document the Extensibility requirements. Use the accelerator Integration Scenario and API List to document Integration requirements. For output management, make sure to specify communication channels, required layout changes from pre-delivered form templates and email templates. Review and add additional requirement in areas like SAP Build Process Automation, Machine Learning, Identity and Access Management, etc to complete the backlog for subsequent detail planning and design sessions. Review SAP Help - Joule Capabilities in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and document the set of Joule Capabilities that are to be implemented and adopted. Procedure Note(s): For customer using Cloud ALM, use Documents app to store requirement details natively in the app. Check out Solution Documentation section in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for overview of function and features and best practices. Go to Documents section in Help - SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation for details instructions on how to use the app. If using WalkMe, ensure that any WalkMe Walk-Thrus listed as requirements are fully documented and classified based on their importance and impact. This documentation will be crucial during the solution design in the Realize phase. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Extensibility, Integration
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Joule, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Confirm Backlog
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm that all requirements identified during the Fit-to-Standard workshops are systematically captured so they can be classified, sized, tracked, and prioritized for realization during the Realize phase. Procedure: Create requirements in SAP Cloud ALM linked to the relevant business process, documenting the steps, outputs, and other critical details. Use the Workstream field in the Requirements app to classify each requirement (e.g., Configuration, Extension, Integration). Review and confirm requirements with project stakeholders, ensuring that the Test Manager and Project Manager are informed so requirements are included in Realize phase test plans. Add requirements that need further investigation to the project backlog until delivery scope is confirmed. Apply a formal approval process for requirements involving additional licenses or custom development effort. Share any requirements deferred beyond the initial implementation with the Adoption Lead so they can be recorded in the Adoption Backlog. Procedure Note(s): For projects not using SAP CLoud ALM, use the Adoption Backlog Template available in the accelerators section.

Task.Name: Execute Solution Validation Survey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Solution Validation survey to ensure that the program’s subject matter experts agree on the fit-to-standard solution and, customizations designed during the Explore phase. This feedback validates whether the solution is meeting the customer’s future-state business process requirements; under the scope of the implementation while keeping agreed feature roadmaps in mind. This survey also combines the questions from the Project Performance survey, so that relevant respondents will not have to answer two different surveys in a tight time period. Prerequisites: The fit-to-standard workshops, configuration design and feature roadmap have been agreed and completed. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Solution Validation’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Solution Validation survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey question, by filtering on the ‘Solution Validation’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Solution Validation survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Integration Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to develop an aligned and optimized list of integrations to be implemented and tested during the Realize phase. The process involves the following steps: Handover of Business Requirements to Technical Expert. Check for SAP Best Practices Define details of the integration to fulfill business requirements. Optimize and align to develop final high-level list Sign off list with customer The ultimate decision regarding integration should be made after considering factors like technology, licenses, the availability of standard integration content, and the skill set of resources. This deliverable provides guidance on determining necessary technical details and exploring available options.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), SAP Build

Task.Name: Determine Scenario Options for Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the availability of SAP Best Practices to setup integration scenarios. Prerequisite: Integration scenario requirements and API list have been collected. Procedure: Review Integration Architecture Guide for Cloud and Hybrid Landscapes for guidance on choosing the right Integration Technology based on the scenario requirements. Use accelerators Help - Products with Integration Capabilities for SAP S/4HANA Cloud to review the list of products that SAP S/4HANA Cloud can Integrate with. Use Integration Guides Overview to identify Integration Guides corresponding to a particular Solution Scenario by using the ‘Source’ & ‘Target’ filters as necessary. For the Scope Items that have been identified as a part of Task Determine Process Scope for SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you can review which publicly available application programming interfaces (API) map to your scope item using the accelerator Help - Public Interfaces for Scope Items in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Refer SAP Help - Architecture Overview for Data Integration for details on common scenarios for data extraction from SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Review the availability of Cloud Integration Automation Service procedures for the setup and document the findings in accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Document all details of B2B Integrations to be setup using EDI as entered in the EDI Technical worksheet of accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Set all Integrations that are not covered with Best Practices as “Customer Driven”. Review the Integration requirements for integrated application deployed on SAP Business Technology Platform and document them in the accelerator Integration Scenario and API List Customers having a Hybrid two-tier ERP deployment scenario should follow the approach mentioned below Review the Master Data & Integration approach section of the accelerator Hybrid Deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and the Blog - Master Data and Integration approaches in Hybrid cloud deployment with S/4HANA Cloud to gain a better understanding of the available approaches for the different deployment scenarios. Check for availability of Hybrid Deployment specific Integration best practices using accelerator SAP Signavio Process Navigator for S/4HANA Cloud. Apply filter ‘Additional Information > Two-Tier ERP’ to review the Hybrid Deployment specific solution processes If best practices are unavailable the integration scenario will have to built as a customer driven integration adhering to the approach outlined above. Use the Edge Integration Cell option as mentioned in SAP Help - Edge Integration Cell for Customer Driven Integration scenarios that fit the following criteria Security or compliance use cases In many enterprises, sensitive data must be managed and controlled inside the enterprise's firewall. In addition, there could be strict architectural restrictions and you want to keep your data within your private landscape. Getting a migration path for SAP Process Integration customers SAP Process Integration is used by many customers for ground-to-ground integration scenarios. Edge Integration Cell allows these customers to benefit from the newest innovations that come with SAP Integration Suite, with the option to design and monitor integration content in the cloud, and deploy and run their scenarios exclusively in their private landscapes. Procedure Note(s): Detailed instructions and examples for documenting the scenario options are included within the template. For SAP Integration with Concur solutions (SAP ICS) or any other customer-owned integration to connect your SAP Concur and SAP finance systems please see SAP Note SAP Note 3483312 - SAP Concur Integration.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Determine Details for Customer-Driven Integrations for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to obtain all needed information for the customer-driven integration scenarios which are not covered under the out of box Integration scenarios listed within SAP Best Practices for S/4HANA Cloud Procedure: Use SAP Business Accelerator Hub to identify details of released APIs that can be leveraged in customer-driven Integrations. Review SAP S/4HANA Cloud - What's New Viewer to identify the newly added or updated APIs. APIs are now added on a regular basis as a part of the Continuous Delivery updates for S/4HANA Cloud. Customers having a Hybrid two-tier ERP deployment scenario should follow the approach mentioned below Review the Master Data & INtegration approach section of the accelerator Hybrid Deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and the Blog - Master Data and Integration approaches in Hybrid cloud deployment with S/4HANA Cloud to gain a better understanding of the available approaches for the different deployment scenarios. Implement the Integration scenario using the middleware and guidelines provided above. Procedure Note(s): Select Category as "API' and use the "Valid as Of" filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective continuous delivery service(s). An updated version is indicated by the release upgrade followed by a suffix such as .1, or.2. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2202.1 is the first update after major release 2202. Customer can request missing APIs to be developed in the Customer Innovation Portal using the procedure described in accelerator Discover and request SAP S_4HANA_APIs

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Design SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for Customer-Driven Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to design the SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for the customer driven Integrations. Prerequisites: APIs were determined and tested for customer-driven integrations. All Information was collected in the Integration and API list. Procedure: Design the SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows using the API information from the Integration and API list. A template to document the design is added in the accelerator section. Review the specification with the architect and the process expert.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Review and Customer Sign-off List of Integrations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the customer to sign off the list of integrations to be realized. After the list is aligned and reviewed by integration experts the customer should sign off the list. The list should contain all integrations that are proposed to be realized in the project with information on the to-be used interfaces. The customer should be made aware of any integration that are not using published APIs. Procedure: Customer signs off the list of integrations planned to realized in this project. Customer also signs off the list of business processes which need to be automated using SAP Build capabilities. This will be included as a part of integration.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Extension Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to plan, design and sign off business process extensions. The process includes the following steps: Handover the requirements from fit-to-standard Check for sample scenarios to use and available products Collection of details to estimate efforts and feasibility Customer sign off Detail design of extension The final decision of the extension is with the customer after taking into account workload, used technology, licenses and skill set of resources. This deliverable gives guidance on how to determine needed technical details, how to determine options.

Task.Name: Handover of Requirements for Extensions to Developer
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to handover the business requirements to the technical experts for extensions. During the fit-to-standard business scenarios were reviewed using process flows, test scripts and demonstrations in the system. Business requirements that might be resolved with extensions were recorded in the business process model as requirements. Capture configuration and follow up action items as Requirements and Notes in SAP Cloud ALM, or alternatively as a backlog item in the Accel ID = PM.211. These need to be handed over to experts for extensions to analyze technical feasibility and needed tools. Procedure: Review all the requirements from fit-to-standard that require the extension of the business process with the configuration expert. Clarify all open questions on the expected outcome of the process. Within the Requirements app, break down the Extensibility Requirements captured into 'User Stories'. Procedure Note(s): For additional details on using the Requirements app and the supported fields within it, please refer the Requirement Management section within the Accel ID = S4H_1042. If WalkMe is in scope, handover all relevant materials collected during the Pre-Build phase, when the team identified WalkMe use cases and establish goals within the use cases. The Build phase involves building your WalkMe solution using the WalkMe Editor. Refer to the Pre-Build and Build section in the Accel ID = S4H_2566. Check with your SAP Account Executive on license entitlement.

Task.Name: Check for Sample Scenario in SAP Extensibility Explorer
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is explore the list of prebuilt extension scenarios in the SAP Extensibility Explorer that are available to be downloaded and used. Procedure: Examine each example for details about their scope, architecture, and process flow. See the links to GitHub (takes you to the source code), setup instructions, and other related materials. Develop the skills needed to perform Activate activities and onboarding tasks. See accelerator Accel ID = S4H.1090. Use the scenario’s source code as a template for building similar extensions that fit your requirements.

Task.Name: Check for Available Products
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to check for available products before an extension is self developed. Procedure: Review the list of available API's using SAP Business Accelerator Hub that can be used to develop the extension. If there's a missing API, consider requesting it through the Customer Influence Portal using SAP Continuous Influence Review the list of available Partner Solutions using Partner Solutions to see if there is an existing Solution that meets your requirement Review available solutions in the SAP Store for SAP solutions that fit your requirements. If you do not find a partner solution or prepackaged content that meets your requirements, you can proceed with the designing and implementation of the Extension Requirement.

Task.Name: Collect Details for Extensions for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to collect technical details for extensions. Procedure: Refer the accelerator Extend SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on premise with ABAP based extensions and Extensibility Guide for GROW with SAP to view the guidelines available on choosing the right extensibility scenario based on customer requirements. Use accelerator Help - CDS Views to check for available CDS views. Use the accelerator SAP Note 3088062 - Identifying local APIs for S/4HANA Cloud to identify the released developer objects that can be used in Extensions. Use SAP Extensibility Explorer for tools and sample codes. You also find additional information sources in the Explorer. Use the accelerator SAP Business Accelerator Hub - Developer Extensibility Objects to identify released Developer Extensibility Objects added to API Business Hub Document all findings to estimate workload, technical feasibility, and skills needed to build the extension. Procedure Note(s): It is recommended to use the Starter Development tenant for exploring available APIs, CDS view and released developer objects. See Forum - Cross Area Topics accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas.

Task.Name: Detail Design on Key-User Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is the detail design of a key-user extensions. The Key user Extensibility is a powerful tool that allows user to implement the typical extension in SAP S/4HANA mostly without a single line of code. It uses the Custom Fields and Custom Logic Fiori apps to implement a BAdI; use restricted ABAP (Custom fields, custom logic, custom business objects). Procedure: Review the requirements collected in Fit-to-Standard related to Key-User Extensibility. Create design documents about how to implement using Key-User Extensibility features. Add item for tracking into the backlog for Realize. Procedure Note(s): See Forum - Cross Topic Areas accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas. As a default, Key user extensibility is deactivated. Read the SAP Note 3061520 - Key User Extensibility - Configure Setting accelerator to see how to activate the extensibility for Key user.

Task.Name: Detail Design for Developer Extensibility
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define the detailed design of developer extensibility (Embedded Steampunk). The planned developer (on-stack) extensibility option will empower ABAP developers to extend standard SAP processes with custom extensions that require tighter integration with the SAP S/4HANA back-end while keeping the digital core isolated from the custom code. This will help minimize regression testing efforts during SAP S/4HANA upgrades. Procedure: Use the Requirements in SAP Cloud ALM to design extensibility of a business process extension via Developer Extensibility features. Capture the related business process area (i.e. Finance, MFG, etc) and the related scope items in Requirement app. Add all the extension items into the backlog for Realize Phase. Procedure Note(s): Refer the following topic pages for additional details on Developer Extensibility SAP Community - ABAP Development SAP Community - ABAP Extensibility SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment

Task.Name: Detail Design of Side-by Side Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is the detailed design of a side-by-side Extension. A side-by-side extension typically involves: Applications for external users without an SAP S/4HANA account or direct system access. Independent infrastructure with scalable operations, frequent updates, and flexibility. Standalone applications or business processes that can be decoupled from SAP systems. No need for transaction consistency between custom and standard SAP data. Development using a wide range of languages and skill sets. You can use the Extension Architecture Guide linked within SAP BTP Guidance Framework to figure out extensibility patterns that are a good fit for Side-by-Side Extensions. Procedure: Use the information collected to design in detail the realization of a business process extension using the SAP Business Technology Platform. Review Learning Journey : Building side-by-side extensions on SAP BTP for details on using SAP BTP to build Side-by-Side Extensions. Add a backlog item for all identified requirements to be implemented in the Realize Phase.

Task.Name: Review and Sign off Design of Extension
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to review the details on extensions and sign off for realization. Procedure: Collect all technical information on the business extension. Review feasibility. Collect estimate for workload, needed skills, and needed resources. Sign off with customer.

Task.Name: Analytics Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable to ensure detailed planning of analytics is conducted, including technical feasibility, and sign off by the customer.

Task.Name: Handover of Requirements to Analytics Expert
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to handover all analytics requirements to the Analytics Expert. Procedure: Hand over all requirements on analytics to the Analytics Expert. Consolidate all requirements in the Accel ID = S4H_025. Procedure Note(s): When using SAP Cloud ALM, a complete list of all requirements can be found in the Requirements and Notes section.

Task.Name: Review My Fiori Apps Reference Library and Process Scenario
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the applications in the My Fiori Apps Reference Library for all applicable SAP Embedded Analytics app offerings for your project deployment with SAP S/4HANA Cloud and review the process scenario in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator. The apps in the My Fiori Apps Reference Library include all predefined analytical applications where you can review the content, product features, and implementation information. The SAP Signavio Process Navigator contains the process scenario for embedded analytics to support the project implementation with content including test scripts, configuration guides, descriptions, process flows, and additional details. Prerequisite: Notes on analytics have been documented Analytics requirements have been captured in the Analytics List Template accelerator Procedure: Learn and understand the latest content and documentation on SAP Fiori via the Help - SAP Fiori Overview accelerator. Refer to the SAP Community - SAP Fiori Embedded Analytics accelerator for information, content, and forums regarding the Fiori Embedded Analytics topic. Review the SAP Fiori App Reference Library for all available app options. Follow the path: SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator > Select “SAP S/4HANA Cloud” in the search bar and filter on the analytical apps using the filter option to narrow down on analytics components per UI Technology offerings. Review all predefined analytical application content in coordination with the UX team involved in the project available with SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Check that all requirements on analytics can be fulfilled with the pre-delivered content from SAP Signavio Process Navigator for embedded analytics. The scope item information can be found in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator accelerator or in the Process section of SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Note(s): All new app offerings will be available to view in the SAP Fiori Apps Reference Library accelerator when they become available. Any standard scope which SAP offers can be found in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator. For any custom requirements, the project team manages the gaps and documentation where they can refer back to them in the future.

Task.Name: Initial Analytics Settings
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the initial settings for analytics and is performed during the design phase for any SAP standard analytics (reference Discovering SAP S/4HANA embedded analytics accelerator) to be evaluated in the task Fit-to-standard workshops. This task includes: Setting the default currency for any Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to be evaluated Set the target thresholds for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to be evaluated Identify date functions for fiscal periods for reporting Optionally import SAP Analytics Cloud stories to the Fiori launchpad Prerequisites: Assign the business role Analytics Specialist The business role Analytics Specialist and its apps must have been activated in task Activate SAP Fiori in the Initial System and/or Activate SAP Fiori in the Starter System Procedure: Launch the SAP Fiori app F2814 Manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Select each Key Performance Indicator (KPI) or Report you need to change, e.g. based on the analytics identified in task Create Initial Analytics List Edit Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports to adjust the default currency and thresholds for semantic information Optionally, on the Stories tab, you can import your SAP Analytics Cloud Stories Launch the SAP Fiori app F2595 Manage Date Functions Identify the date functions that matches the most relevant reporting periods for your fit-to-standard workshops, e.g. fiscal periods for your country Procedure Note(s): The SAP delivered content is adjusted as a starting point. During the Realize phase in task Configure Analytics, the following can be performed: Further adjust the settings for Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Create new Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports, e.g. using SAP Fiori app F2814 Manage Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Reports Create custom analytics using SAP Fiori app F1572 Custom Analytical Queries Add SAP Analytics Cloud Stories which you want to include in your launchpad.

Task.Name: Determine Details for Customer-Driven Analytics and Extension of Reports
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine all details on the customer-driven analytics and any extensions to the report(s). Prerequisite: Customer-driven analytics and any extension to the existing report(s) are identified and documented as requirements or in the Accel ID = S4H_025. Procedure: Check with the respective expert to determine if the required extension of the business process is feasible. Use the setup guide from the accelerator section as input to determine all needed details to decide if they are doable. Document your findings as a requirement or in the Accel ID = S4H_025. Document and validate in detail any custom requirements beyond the standard embedded analytics which need to be configured in the system. Procedure Note(s): See Forum - Cross Area Topics accelerator for more information and discussions on topics that cross various areas. Custom requirements are configured and executed according to the business processes in the Realize phase.

Task.Name: Review and Customer Sign off for Analytics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the details on analytics and sign off for realization. Procedure: Collect all technical information on evaluated reports. Review feasibility. Collect estimate for workload and needed skills and resources. Sign off with customer.

Task.Name: SAP Build Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to start planning for SAP Build and Machine Learning implementation. This includes completion of questionnaire and installation of various applications before running SAP Build Process Automation Bots.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Review Processes for SAP Build Process Automation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the business processes which can be automated. Prerequisites: SAP Build Process related scope items are identified. All application mandatory and optional requirements (Desktop agent, SAP Task Center etc.) for running the Bots are installed and tested. Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - Process Automation accelerator. Review Help - SAP Build Process Automation for additional guidance implementing automation scenarios using SAP Build Process Automation. All available Business Content can be identified using the accelerator SAP Business Accelerator Hub Demonstrate functionality by running an SAP Standard Process Automation content and incorporate end user feedback.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Plan for Machine Learning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to collect and identify the business processes using Machine Learning. Prerequisites: Machine Learning related scope items are identified using the accelerator SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - Process Automation accelerator. Download the SAP Best Practices Test scripts from each Scope Item(s) mentioned within the configuration guide attached to SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Embedded Machine Learning in S/4HANA Cloud Procedure Note(s): Download the guide from accelerator Deploying Machine Learning Scenario

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: Identify Business Processes for Situation Handling
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the business processes using Situation Handling. Prerequisites: Situation Handling related scope items are identified from the Use Cases for Situation Handling’ section of Help - Use Cases for Situation Handling Procedure: Verify that all questions are answered in the Business Driven Configuration Questionnaire - Process Automation accelerator. Download the Test scripts from each Scope Item(s) identified in Prepare Phase by each Line Of Business (LOB). Procedure Note(s): See the Help - Situation Handling accelerator for more information on situation handling scenarios available in the solution.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build

Task.Name: SAP Build Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure that all the necessary applications are installed to facilitate the smooth execution of Business Process Automation using capabilities like SAP Build Process Automation, Machine Learning, Situational Handling etc.

Task.Name: Setup SAP Build Process Automation Components
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to install all the necessary applications to facilitate the execution of Bots – both delivered by SAP Best Practices as well as custom made Bots. Procedure: Subscribe to SAP Build Process Automation within your SAP Business Technology Platform Subaccount. A booster is available for a guided setup process if required. Check all System and Technical prerequisites and install the Desktop Agent Procedure Note(s): Refer to Help - SAP Build Process Automation for additional information on the setup procedure.

Task.Name: Identity and Access Management Planning and Design
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure the detailed planning and design of the Identity and Access Management, including definition of customer Business Roles and the creation of an authorization concept document. The authorization concept should ensure: Correctness Completeness Confirmability Verifiability Availability Protection from misusage and manipulation It is recommended that all the requirements and outcomes for Identity and Access Management are documented in one consolidated Authorization Concept.

Task.Name: Plan and Design Identity and Access Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to plan and design the Identity and Access Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Follow the procedure below to ensure an effective and efficient plan and design of the Identity and Access Management. Prerequisites: The applications for the project scope have been captured in the Application - Workplace List during the fit-to-standard workshops. The Backlog (tool or template) has been prefilled and updated with values from the fit-to-standard workshops. Procedure: Hand over all of the business requirements captured during and after the fit-to-standard. Consolidate all requirements in one Application-Workplace List (optional). Create a document to describe the scope and framework of the authorization concept. Establish a definition for the naming convention that can be used to realize the customer-specific authorization concept. Refer to the PDF accelerator Accel ID = S4H_1665, for a detailed how-to guide. Define the workplaces that the respective Business areas must specify. Map the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Apps and the corresponding Business Catalogs to the defined workplaces in the Application-Workplace List. Collect all technical information on the identity and Access Management and sign off with customers. Procedure Note(s): An Authorization Concept should ensure the correctness, completeness, confirmability, verifiability, and availability of the data and protect it from misusage and manipulation. The Authorization concept document must be written clearly so that a third party can quickly see how business data is protected against misusage. Use the IAM Information System app to determine the existing Business Catalogs that allow access to specific apps. To find the Business Catalogs, set the Main Entity = Application > enter the app name in the Search field > select 'Go.' SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA Cloud new Launchpad functionality maps preassigned Fiori spaces and pages to your business roles. It enhances the user experience of the business roles as they perform their daily business functions. For more information, review Accel ID = S4H_749. To enable the spaces for your users, use Accel ID = S4H_748. For additional information on Identity and Access Management, see Accel ID = S4H_445. The information from the Application-Workplace list can be used to support the testing activities (e.g. definition of testcases).

Task.Name: Learning Needs Analysis for Users
Task.Notes: Learning Needs Analysis identifies the skills and knowledge gaps within an organization, ensuring that learning resources are available when needed. It evaluates both formal and informal learning methods using a combination of "push" (structured, mandatory training) and "pull" (self-directed, on-demand learning) strategies. The focus is on delivering intuitive, user-centric content and activities that are directly relevant to the learner's daily tasks.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Identify Learning Needs Identification Process
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to begin the learning needs analysis process by conducting workshops per line-of-business and workstream, together with the implementation project team, to identify the processes in scope and analyze the required end-user skills needed to achieve solution adoption. Procedure: Align with the key project stakeholders on the learning needs and digital learning opportunities. Review the fit-to-standard workshops to determine the scope of the project. Conduct learning needs analysis workshops per workstream with the subject matter experts to identify target user groups and learning requirements for each business process. Review both Planning a Learning Needs Analysis and Learning Needs Analysis Users Overview to understand the methods for effectively analyzing and identifying learning requirements for project teams and business users. Inform the business area manager about any and all skill gaps within their respective line-of-business area so that they can address these gaps pre-deployment. Analyze different learning methods and content types used in a learning enablement rollout plan. Review the learning journey section on Researching the User Learning Needs Analysis to gain an understanding of the focus areas for conducting user learning needs analysis. It includes examples and templates for conducting a learning needs analysis for users.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Create Learning Curriculum
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a list of content types and learning methods that will be used in the learning enablement strategy. Procedure: Provide a fully scoped analysis of learning requirements per end-user group or line-of-business area. Develop the baseline curriculum, based on solutions and business processes in scope for the project. The course catalog will be categorized into functional process and sub-process areas including the key tasks and process overviews, the audience (business role), learning duration, method of delivery, and any pre-requisites required. Estimate resources needed for material creation and delivery.
