Document a high level content development plan, including which content types are to be developed such as videos, concept slides, e-learning, work instructions and simulations, learning exercises, role support, and knowledge assessments. Map the end-user roles to each learning intervention. Align the learning needs analysis to the change impact analysis (if available). Calculate how much time content development will take and how many resources are needed to develop and deliver enablement content. Enable the trainers to schedule the appropriate formal end-user training and deploy the online or digital learning platform as well.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Review Enablement Business Review
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task to present the learning needs analysis findings to the key business subject matter experts (SME) and key stakeholders. Procedure: Create the learning needs analysis report. Present the learning needs analysis findings to the project and SME's and key stakeholders for review and final sign-off.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Data Load Preparation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to begin data migration. Data migration is the process of taking existing data from a legacy system and preparing it for use in new SAP system. This process is executed iteratively based on the in-scope objects and begins as soon as objects are identified avoiding future delays to the project. The overall process involves the following: Determining the required objects and data sources. Creating plans to extract data, create data, and transform data. Extracting and transforming data. Cleansing unnecessary or incorrect data.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Determine the Required Data for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to determine the master and transactional data objects, data sources, migration methods and extraction/load plan required for the scope of your implementation as determined in the fit-to-standard workshops. This information is crucial for the manual creation of test data and the initial steps of the data migration process. In the SAP S/4HANA migration cockpit, a migration object represents a predefined data structure and mapping logic used to load specific types of data into the system. Historical transaction objects (i.e. completed sales orders, completed purchase order, etc.) are not migrated to the new system. They are typically available via reporting or other archival retrieval tools. Procedure: Determine all master data objects needed to support the business processes documented in the fit-to-standard workshops. See accelerators Master Data Overview.xlsx and Create Your Own Master Data for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference information related to the delivered content. Determine the data source for each object. See Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for a list of objects. Note that the column selection can be expanded to include object details like “Predecessor Objects,” “Sample Data,” and “Scope Item”. Determine the migration method for objects: migrate data using staging tables, migrate data directly from SAP system or manual entry. Read the migration object documentation available in the Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud for additional information on the fields that are supported. The list can be downloaded into spreadsheet and extended to be used as a tracking tool. Based on the object, source and approach, develop an extraction and data load plan. The dependencies information for every object are available in Help - Migration Objects for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. For the staging tables approach, the predecessor information is available in the column “Predecessor Object”. For the direct transfer approach, choose the needed migration object and check the section ‘Prerequisites’. Procedure Note(s): In the migration project of the migration cockpit, your migration objects will be shown in the correct sequence which considers the object dependencies. The information about predecessors (dependent) migration objects are available in the Migrate your Data app during the project creation. See SAP S/4HANA - New Implementation: Consideration for Historical Data.pptx for additional information on historical data.

Task.Name: Determine Migration Cockpit Field Structures for S/4HANA Cloud (Staging Tables)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for migration using staging tables. The purpose of this task is to view the SAP S/4HANA Cloud data structures by downloading the template files and associating the structures with the data from the legacy system(s). After creating the migration project, you can select the migration objects that are relevant to your migration scenario. By using “Migrate Data using Staging Tables” approach, you can download the migration objects templates to view the data structure. Moreover, by filling the staging tables with the files, you need to download templates to specify data and upload it back to your project. If filling staging tables using 3rd party tools, the template files can be used as a guide to the table structures and required fields. Apps Used: Migrate Your Data Procedure: Follow the instructions in the Test Scripts document available via Data Migration to SAP S/4HANA from Staging (‏2Q2‏) to download the Migration Object Templates. Template samples are available in Accel ID = S4H_628. Review the Introduction, Field List and Structure tabs to familiarize yourself with the structures and mandatory fields. This information is relevant to the creation of specifications for data extraction from a legacy system. Note that additional fields may be available via the Object Modeler app. See SAP Note - 2999428 - Migration Object Modeler App in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition(Staging Table) for more information. Understand the dependencies between the objects for prioritization purposes. Procedure Note(s): The templates generated are reflecting available fields as per current release. Always update or check your templates after each release upgrade to avoid errors. Loading the staging tables via file has a limitation for each XML file of 100 MB and it is recommended to use less than 50,000 records in one file. See Notes - Migration Cockpit Search in SAP for Me for Knowledge Bases Articles related to data migration. See Posts - Migration Cockpit Search in the SAP Community with SAP S/4HANA Cloud tag for related blogs. To determine if objects related to the custom fields created through the Fiori app are extendable, see column “Custom Field Support” in Accel ID = S4H_831.

Task.Name: Extract and Transform Legacy Data
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to extract data from legacy systems and transform it into a format suitable for loading into the SAP cloud system. Successful execution requires a strong understanding of the source system data, extraction and transformation tools, and the required data structure for the target system. Since multiple data objects may be involved, this task is performed iteratively and in accordance with the data extraction and load plan. If the Migrate Data Directly from SAP System approach is being used, then this task is not relevant. Procedure: Extract the necessary data from the legacy systems using a tool that allows for data manipulation. This tool can be a spreadsheet, a database, or other data transformation software. Harmonize data from different sources. Transform the data to conform to the target field attributes by considering the following points: Adding missing values Remove duplicates or unnecessary data Structure the data so that it can be easily transferred to the load templates Create load files based on the extracted data and load templates. Procedure Note(s): See the section ‘Knowledge Platform Help’ in Help - SAP Advanced Data Migration and Management by Syniti for more information on how Syniti can help.

Task.Name: Data Migration Preparation (ByDesign to S/4HANA Cloud)
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers transitioning from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The purpose of this task is to provide guidelines on initializing the data extraction from SAP Business ByDesign system and preparing it for use in SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. This process is executed iteratively based on the in-scope objects and begins as soon as objects are identified avoiding future delays to the project. Procedure: The overall process involves the following steps: Extract the data from SAP Business ByDesign in the form of XML file Upload the iflows provided along with the Data Migration Accelerator to an SAP Business Technology Platform Integration Suite Package Deploy & Execute the Iflow Procedure Note(s): Complete the SAP Discovery Center - Missions: Migrate data from SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public to understand the Data Migration process during SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Migrations. Review the accelerator Blog : Guide for Proposed Migration - SAP Business ByDesign to S/4HANA Public Cloud for detailed instructions on the migration procedure. Only steps 1-3 in the migration guide are to be executed in this task. Review the accelerator Blog - Data Migration Accelerator: SAP Business ByDesign to SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud to get access to the Data Migration Accelerator

Task.Name: Perform Data Cleansing Activities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to cleanse the legacy data before loading into the SAP target system. Inaccurate data or inconsistent formatting should be corrected. Unnecessary data should be removed from the legacy data to reduce the volume of data to load and keep the new system free from extraneous data. Data cleansing should occur on the legacy data as soon as the data migration objects are identified, otherwise this process may become a bottleneck for data migration. Data that populated via integration, such as two-tier systems, should be included in the data assessment and cleansing activities. Procedure: Review data from the legacy systems that will be migrated during the implementation project for relevancy, quality and completeness. Users of the different data can typically provide the best insight into the data quality. Delete or identify rules for omitting legacy objects that should not be included in the migration. Identify data inaccuracies, duplication and obsolesces. Develop plans to correct data issues in legacy system. Develop plans to correct data after extraction. Procedure Note(s): In addition, some SAP tools/products such as SAP Data Services can be used to populate the staging tables, provide data transformation and cleansing capabilities. See SAP Data Services for additional information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Test Planning
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan, design, and prepare for testing the configured or built system. Key deliverables during this phase include an agreed test strategy and test plan/test schedule. It is important to note the relevant prerequisites that should be in place before end to end takes places. It is necessary to consider and plan for the testing cycles required during testing activities and understand what needs to be completed for testing. During this deliverable, existing tests, quality management processes, and procedures which may occur can be leveraged to support the project. It is recommended that customers appoint a Test Manager to the project at the earliest opportunity. The Test Manager is then able to work with the module process leads as well as technical leads to build up knowledge of business processes before executing the User Acceptance Testing.

Task.Name: Create Test Strategy for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to agree on the key elements of the test strategy and document them in the test strategy document. Typically, one signed and approved test strategy covers the entire project duration and is often owned jointly by the customer and the implementation partner. This step is crucial as it defines how testing will be performed and completed in the project. Before testing starts, all project members and stakeholders must agree to the coordinated approach. The test strategy contains the following: Project Testing Objectives and Assumptions: A statement of the objectives and the assumptions around the objectives High-level Test Plan(s): High-level schedule of testing activities Test Scope: Testing activities that are relevant to the project High-Level Processes: List of high-level processes that need to be tested Test Cycle: The commonly used phases of testing within the test execution are listed below: Unit Testing (if applicable) Business Process (String) Testing Integration Testing Data Conversion Testing User Acceptance Testing Testing Approach: A detailed description of how different test types relate to each other (i.e., a successful unit test is a prerequisite for doing a string test, or migration test results may lead to a prerequisite for user acceptance testing) An understanding of how the test phases will be planned and executed What is the content of the test type? Entry and exit into the test phases Who will be involved Testing Deliverables: Test processes per phase, test environment, and test tools Test Automation (Recommended): How will the scope be determined? When will the test automation work start? How and when will the automation test scripts be used? Testing Tools: The following tools are used to perform different tests (i.e., manual test management tool, test automation tool, defect tracking tool) If you use SAP Cloud ALM for Test Management, please check the capabilities. If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, then different test automation tools are available; please check which ones and how to set them up. If you are implementing Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios, check the SAP Cloud ALM Test Management capabilities for tracking the test results. Defect Management: Description of how defects will be documented (i.e., what information must be documented, any standards that need to be followed) Details of the defect lifecycle and various statuses Details of priority and severity of defects Roles and Responsibilities: Description of required test roles and responsibilities (i.e., Test Lead and responsibilities of individual project team members related to testing) Procedure: Review the Test Strategy Template S4HANA Cloud.pptx and Test Strategy Recommendations for 3SL Customers in the accelerators section. Additionally, review the Test Management Guide.pptx accelerator. Define and create the project-specific test strategy document. Obtain sign-off on the agreed test strategy from all project members and stakeholders. Procedure Note(s): The test strategy document is a collaborative effort between the customer and the implementation partner. Ensure all stakeholders are aligned with the test strategy before testing begins. Utilize SAP Cloud ALM for enhanced test management capabilities. Consider the use of test automation tools to streamline testing processes. Defect management should adhere to established documentation standards and lifecycle protocols. Clearly define roles and responsibilities to ensure effective test execution.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Create and Schedule Test Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create test plan for test types and test cycles selected during Create Test Strategy . A test plan is a group of test cases and processes that reflects the business process sequence and dependences. It should include the timing of execution from project timeline stand point and specify the type of testers should be made available. For example, Business process test at end of each Sprint by business process experts including custom developments. User adoption test as form of end user training before deployment. Procedure: Define the test scope, containing: Test cases Dependencies Prerequisites Test scope agreement by the project team (customer and implementer), involved business process experts, and stakeholders. If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, this is managed by creating your project scope and adding the relevant business processes to it. Optional: Plan resources and timelines. Please refer to the Accel ID = S4H_438. It can be used for tracking and monitoring purposes during the testing phase. A detailed schedule can either be created for the entire project, or for each individual test phase. It contains: Key prerequisite testing activities Scope items (test cases) and unique test case IDs Dependencies and milestones Test execution start dates and duration Resource allocation Timeline showing the testing tasks and when they will occur Test status tracking (if required) Optional: If you are using SAP Cloud ALM, you can prepare your test plans in the tool to visualize the exact timeline of testing. The test cases might not be ready at this time. The test planning can already occur though.

Task.Name: Determine Test Scope for SAP S/4Hana Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish the testing scope for a project, whether it is conducted independently or as part of a release. This determination is crucial to ensure the availability of testing environments and artifacts for execution. Given the diverse range of testing cycles, such as Integration, Regression, Business Process, PUT, and User Acceptance Testing, it is essential to identify the necessary cycles. Defining the testing scope involves considering various elements, including the planned conversion event, security roles, and profile testing. Additionally, it encompasses testing Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios, Extensibility objects related to business processes, and interface objects that are not associated with business processes. Procedure: Evaluate the existing processes and procedures to identify the testing cycles required to support the project. Consider the scope of applications that will be used during implementation and for executing business processes. Utilize existing processes and procedures to guide the selection of test cases and scripts. Reference the SAP Signavio Process Navigator for an example of a test script and process flow in the SAP Best Practices - Process Flow and Test Script (Example) accelerator. Prioritize critical business applications and reports, assess frequently used applications and reports, and analyze past production support issues to compile test cases and scripts effectively. Consider Hybrid two-tier Deployment Scenarios within the implementation project scope when identifying Integration testing test cases and scripts. Align the overall test data approach with the data migration strategy and document it as part of the testing strategy. Document the scope in the test strategy document and execute the test scope in SAP Cloud ALM or other selected test management tools. Alternatively, you can generate the scope using the Intelligent Test Scoper application under Test Automation Tools. Please see the Accelerator Intelligent Test Scoper for more details. Create Test Cases based on the test strategy document. This should include, such as: Test Case ID, title, Preconditions, Steps, Test Data, Acceptance Criteria. Set the required filters to view the optimized scope based on SAP’s standard code changes. Push the generated optimized scope to Manage Upgrade Tests (MUT) by creating a new execution variant. Include all ABAP objects created in the execution scope by adding them to the relevant execution variant for execution. This step is optional. Procedure Note(s): You can push the optimized scope to MUT only when the Application Area filter is applied or when no filters are applied. The button remains disabled in other cases. For more details, see the Help – Accel ID = S4H_2641. Assign a suitable name and description to the execution variant each time you push the optimized scope to MUT. For more details, see the Help – Accel ID = S4H_2642. To execute the ABAP unit tests scoped in Manage Upgrade Tests, ensure the catalog SAP_A4C_BC_DEV_UT_RUN_PC is added to the business role assigned to the logged-in user.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Explore Phase Closure and Sign-Off
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure that all required deliverables for the current phase and the overall project are complete, accurate, and that any outstanding issues have been resolved. It also serves to identify and document lessons learned during the phase to support a smooth and informed formal phase closure. Additionally, this deliverable captures customer feedback and explores opportunities for potential customer references.

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate for Explore Phase
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase. Prior to moving into the next phase, each project manager must demonstrate compliance with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality. Procedure: Review the SAP Activate Quality Gate Concept accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Use the designated Quality Gate template in the accelerator section to conduct the Quality Gate. Share the Quality Gate results with relevant stakeholders. Identify and implement any necessary follow-up actions based on the Quality Gate results. Procedure Note(s): New additional key deliverables need to be added in the quality gate checklist by the Project Manager to the different project types.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Name: Assess Project Performance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Project Performance survey to the appropriate stakeholder groups throughout the remainder of the implementation. This includes the core project management team and each team working to transform a ‘Line of Business’ (LoB) business process (supply chain, finance, etc). Each team will provide project team-related feedback in terms of governance, processes and empowerment during the Explore, Realize and Deploy phases. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Project Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Project Performance survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Project Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Determine the appropriate frequency of survey (at least quarterly or at end of a phase), noting where other surveys (i.e. Solution Validation) incorporate the same questions, so that they do not coincide with what is already distributed to these same user. Distribute the Project Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from: your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance. For LoB teams only, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey takes over from the Project Performance survey, at that phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues. Once sign-off is obtained, the project can move forward to the next phase. Procedure: Identify and list all key deliverables from phase delivery. Confirm the status of completion and any outstanding actions. Utilize the designated Phase Sign Off template in the accelerator section to obtain approval by presenting the sign-off document to the nominated signatory. Obtain phase signoff and agreement for any possible outstanding actions.

Task.Name: Realize
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to incrementally build and test an integrated business and system environment that is based on the process requirements identified in the previous phase and captured in the backlog. During the Realize phase, the project team loads customer data into the system, plans adoption activities, and prepares cutover plans and plans for operationally running the solution. Realize Phase Activities: Monitor project activities. Configure the solution in the Development system using incremental build in time-boxed iterations. Replicate the solution in the Test environment. Migrate for data in preparation for testing. Conduct overall end-to-end testing of the business processes the Test environment. Conduct project team and key user training. Set up the production environment. Finalize end user training materials and documentation. Plan cutover activities. Track and report on value delivery. During the Realize phase, the project team uses a series of iterations to incrementally configure, test, confirm, and document the entire end-to-end solution and to load data. The project team actively works with business representatives to ensure good fit of the built solution. The project team releases results of multiple iterations to the business users to accelerate time to value and provide early access to finalized functionalities.

Task.Name: Execution and Monitoring of Project
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to execute the approved project work and assess performances to identify deviations from the plan. The objective is to manage the project scope while monitoring the execution, identifying variances, tracking quality outcomes, managing progress, controlling changes, assessing risks, and communicating project status. The Project Management Plan, created during the Prepare phase, outlines the approach for managing, executing, monitoring, and controlling of project activities across the relevant knowledge areas. This methodology provides guidance for each activity, supported by monitoring and controlling strategies. The project manager is responsible for ensuring that the monitoring and control measures established during planning are applied with the appropriate level of oversight. In case the project is covered by the SAP Premium Engagement agreement, such as Active Embedded or MaxAttention, the SAP Technical Quality Manager (TQM) oversees specific activities. The roles of the SAP TQM and the Project Manager are separate and distinct throughout the project delivery process.

Task.Name: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide users with the essential knowledge and resources required to successfully navigate and contribute to projects and implementations involving SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with measuring project progress & milestones, cutover concept and identification of SAP offerings and services to support the implementation using the 4th Onboarding session - Project Progress one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome and introduction phase to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the Accel ID = S4H_1703.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to guide the project manager and team in executing the project management plan and completing the work outlined in the project scope statement. The team will carry out key activities to achieve project objectives, manage resources efficiently, and maintain effective communication. Procedure: Execute project work: Perform tasks to achieve objectives, allocating effort and funds as needed. Staff, train, and manage the project team. Acquire and utilize necessary resources. Apply planned methods and standards. Develop, control, verify and validate deliverables. Oversee and manage the approved project scope. Identify, assess, and address project risks. Resolve issues and drive them to closure. Integrate approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment. Establish and maintain effective internal and external communication. Collect project data and report on progress and performance. Monitor and guide work results: Evaluate project performance against the project management plan to identify deviations. Implement corrective and preventive actions based on performance assessments. Track and manage risks proactively. Provide metrics to support progress tracking, performance reporting, and forecasting. Oversee the implementation of approved changes and take action when needed. Refer to the ‘Analytics’ topic in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Manage scope and requirements: Define what is and isn’t included based on the agreed scope and Project Charter. Manage scope and requirement changes per the Change Management Plan. Manage roles and team resources: Ensure effective staffing and team motivation. Plan and implement skill development activities to enhance performance. Adjust team composition as needed and manage roles for optimal resource utilization. Manage schedule: Maintain control over the project schedule to ensure timely delivery. Adjust timelines and budgets when scope or deliverables change. Establish and track new baseline estimates for cost, effort, and duration. Manage budget: Monitor the budget to ensure the project remains within approved limits. Track all project-related costs and take corrective action on variances. Control quality: Proactively manage quality to prevent issues in deliverables. Apply quality control and assurance practices. Ensure that all deliverables meet customer expectations and defined requirements. Procedure Note(s): Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities.

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project manager maintains up-to-date key project management documents. The project management plan serves as a comprehensive collection of project documents, including the project schedule, budget and cost information, monitoring and controlling plans, and other relevant information. It provides the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices throughout the project lifecycle. Procedure: Update the project schedule, project budget, management plans, scope document, and business case to reflect the detailed scope information defined during the project. For additional guidance on document management, refer to the solution specific accelerators in the accelerator section. Provide updates to the following documents: Project management plan. Project work breakdown structure (WBS). Project schedule. Project budget. Business case. Scope document. Backlog document (created during the Explore phase).

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage, quantify, and prioritize project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. This ensures that all issues are tracked and managed efficiently, providing visibility and transparency for the project management team. Procedure: Identify the internal and external risks most likely to impact the project. Document and monitor these risks using the Open Issues List Template.xls. Manage the issues documented in the Open Issues List Template.xls by following these steps: Raise and categorize an issue based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology. Log the issue in the Open Issues List Template.xls, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. Assign a priority, develop a mitigation plan, and identify the responsible person when creating the issue. Conduct regular follow-ups on issues in accordance with the standard issue management process defined in the project management plans. Escalate unresolved issues to the next level of governance, if applicable, to maintain project cadence and prevent delays to the go-live timeline. Review critical issues as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Procedure Note(s): Record and monitor all changes, referencing the available accelerators in the accelerator section – including solution-specific tools, if applicable.

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and communicate project status and progress reports. This includes producing various performance reports tailored to specific audiences and objectives, as defined in the project communication plan. The goal is to ensure clear communication of key activities, deliverable progress, and the project's status in relation to the schedule and budget. Procedure: Provide brief weekly status updates to the team lead through email or during team meetings. Team leads should also submit weekly team status reports to the project manager using the designated Team Status Report template in the accelerator section, which may be reviewed in meetings or submitted in a standard format. Create the weekly project status report based on input from teams and additional data like issue and risk lists. Prepare a monthly or quarterly executive status report for the steering group, reusing key insights from the weekly reports, but adding program value, benefits, and decisions needed from leadership. Regularly review and update the Communication Plan Overview Template as new information becomes available to guide the team's communication approach throughout the project.

Task.Name: Request Deployment Readiness Check for Upcoming Go-Live
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform an SAP best practice review of critical system settings by requesting the continuous quality check (CQC) deployment readiness check service. This pre-go-live offers an SAP best practice review to ensure key settings are configured optimally. The goal of the service is to identify potential risks, issues, or areas of concern before the transition to the Run phase, providing confidence that SAP best practices are being followed. Upon completion, you will receive a customized report containing an executive summary of key findings, an action plan, and detailed recommendations. The insights and recommendations in this report will support overall system readiness ahead of go-live. The CQC deployment readiness check typically covers topics such as identity and access management, data migration, transport management, and test management. Procedure: Review the applicable Information Sheet in the accelerator section to become familiar with the service offering. Request the service through the new Get Support application in SAP for Me (refer to Accel ID = S4H_2368). It is recommended to book this service at least six weeks before your planned go-live date. When submitting your request, select: Product: “Continuous Quality Check & Improvement Services.” Product Function: “Service request for a Cloud Solution.” If you need help in submitting your request, please contact your local Accel ID = S4H_2367. Procedure Note(s): The CQC deployment readiness check is included in your SAP Cloud subscription. There are no extra fees required for this service.

Task.Name: Manage Transports
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to provide an overview on managing transports in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 3-system landscape. The process involves saving changes first in the Development System, then transporting them to the Test System, and finally to the Production System. For a comprehensive landscape overview with a diagram, refer to Accel ID = S4H_1028. Initially, the Development System is activated starting from SAP Central Business Configuration. It comprises two tenants, Customizing Tenant and Development Tenant, each requiring independent setup. Transports created in the Development Tenant are “local” and cannot be subsequently transported. To activate the Test System and the Production System, it is crucial to use the first activation transport from SAP Central Business Configuration, saved in the Customizing Tenant. Different type of changes (i.e. initial activation, org structure from SAP Central Business Configuration, subsequent configuration activities, roles, output objects, other key user extension and developer extension) use different apps when moving the changes across the landscape. For a detail analysis and comparison of different types, refer to the Transport Management Summary section table in Accel ID = S4H_1028. When planning project activities during Realize phase, consider the following regarding transports: There are system checks (ie. foreign key, dependency, sequence, etc) upon deployment of setting from SAP Central Business Configuration, and release of transports in Development System. It is a best practice to manage transports: By sequence - especially for transports originated from SAP Central Business Configuration before subsequent configuration activity transports. By group - when rolling out a country or a specific business process area as described in activating new scope or country/region. By feature – where related customization and extension changes are required to go together as identified during sprint planning. Trigger import within timelines that is compatible to the downward compatibility rule. Transport released in Development System with version N, should be imported, at the latest, before Test/Production System is upgraded to version N+2. For example, All transports released from Development System in 2202 version, can be imported into to Test/Production system that are on the 2202 version. Most transports released from Development System in 2202 version can still be imported to Test/Production system that is upgraded to the 2208 version (N+1). Some restriction applies to key user extension objects. All transports released from Development System in 2202 version can NOT be imported to Test/Production system that is upgraded to the 2302 version (N+2). Most transports will need to be recreated in the new version to be imported, with the exception of transports deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration, which includes scope, country/region activation and delta transports from updates and upgrades. Become familiar with the process to import collection versions and thus make extension items available for productive usage. Details can be found in the Accel ID = S4H_1814. Select Simple or Flexible transport mode, which has an impact on the business process configuration transports, to suite your project needs. For example, project doesn't have multiple country rollout in scope, have limited business process activations, or with little extension considerations can simplify its overall transport process with Simple Transport Mode. Reference Help - Transport Modes for more details. Both partners and customers need to discuss and evaluate the feasibility of Git-Enabled Change and Transport Management (gCTS App) within the context of Multi-Off Delivery. If gCTS App is used, then partners should refer to task Develop and Transport Developer Extensions for additional information. Procedure: Use Tag ‘Transport Management’ to access the list of tasks related to Transports. Review all tasks' description, steps, and notes including accelerators. Adjust project activities accordingly. Procedure Note(s): Review the enablement session 3-System Landscape - Transport Management Fundamentals on SAP Learning Hub. Before you can access the link, a one-time registration in the SAP Learning Hub, edition for SAP Enterprise Support, is required. Follow the step-by-step guide to complete your registration here. Reference blog post Blog - Transport Management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 3-System Landscape... for more details about the transport management system capabilities.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Project Management, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Detailed Change Impact Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to gain insights into how the implementation of the SAP system will affect specific groups of stakeholders. The implementation of a new SAP system goes beyond being solely an IT project and has wide-ranging impacts on the entire organization. Evaluating these impacts requires a good understanding of both the current situation and the envisioned future state. A change impact analysis is best conducted in a workshop setting, where experts from various organizational units and diverse backgrounds can engage in discussions that often uncover valuable insights to facilitate the organizational transition. This collaborative approach promotes a shared understanding of upcoming challenges among project stakeholders. Following the assessment, it is essential to address the identified areas for action with appropriate activities.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Prepare Change Impact Workshops
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to bring the right people together for the assessment and ensure a smooth execution of the workshop. A crucial step in this process is to reach a consensus regarding the appropriate level of detail for discussing the impacts on the new SAP business processes. Breaking down the business process into excessively granular components can result in unnecessary effort, while keeping the discussion too abstract may risk overlooking essential information. Typically, workshop participants consist of managers of the affected business units, alongside selected process owners, subject matter experts, or key users who possess in-depth knowledge of the processes involved. It is recommended to divide the overall implementation scope, possibly by process scope areas, and plan for several short sessions to ensure focused discussions. Additionally, it is essential to prepare the necessary templates in advance. Procedure: Compile a list of relevant SAP business processes and create assessment templates using the Detailed Change Impact Analysis accelerator. Identify and assign workshop participants. Schedule change impact workshops.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Conduct Change Impact Assessment
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify the implications of the new SAP business processes for various groups of stakeholders. It is beneficial to have the workshops led by an impartial facilitator. This fosters a comprehensive examination of the change impacts, encompassing not only process and technological changes, but also considerations related to organization and people. The facilitator can also support the group in reaching a consensus on quantifying the change impacts, using categories like high, medium, low, or no impact. These ratings aid in identifying the extent of impact for each business process and stakeholder group, enabling the prioritization of mitigation activities. It is imperative to document both pertinent insights into change impacts and suggestions for specific actions during the workshop. Procedure: Introduce the workshop approach, using the Guiding Questions accelerator. Discuss and and assign ratings to change impacts for all relevant SAP business processes, involving all stakeholder groups responsible for executing these processes using the Detailed Change Impact Analysis accelerator. Document relevant insights and proposals for concrete activities.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Manage Change Impacts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to facilitate a seamless transition for all affected stakeholder groups to the new SAP solution and the adoption of best practice processes. Representing the workshop outcomes, especially the quantitative ratings visually (e.g., in the form of a heat map), enables the swift identification of areas requiring attention. The initial ideas already collected during the workshops should then be further developed and refined. Typically, some of these activities fall within the scope of organizational change management. Others may concern training, cut-over procedures, or measures to be implemented within the individual business units. Therefore, it is the responsibility of the change manager to ensure that all activities are consolidated into an action plan with clearly defined roles and responsibilities for execution. Procedure: Consolidate and visually represent the outcomes of the workshops, utilizing the Result Visualization accelerator. Collect additional suggestions for addressing identified areas requiring action. Define an action plan and assign distinct responsibilities for each activity using the Accel ID = S4H_1841.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Organizational Change Management

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System / Initial Setup
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request the Development system and set up the related implementation projects in Central Business Configuration.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. The 'IT Contact' makes the requests in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the URL and Login instructions. Prerequisite: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System (Starter Customizing and Starter Development tenants) Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development Systems in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Customizing tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The Development tenant will be triggered automatically after Customizing tenant is provisioned successfully. The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available. Procedure Note(s): SAP recommends not to request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System during the upgrade window; the System can be requested before the start of the upgrade or after it is completed. Refer to the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape accelerator for a complete overview of the upgrade schedule of SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Task.Name: Set Up Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform the initial configuration of the Customizing tenant, and trigger the system activation. After these tasks are complete, the system will be ready for project team access. The activities are guided and executed via SAP Central Business Configuration. Prerequisites: Starter System must be available, and Development System has been requested Completed task Conduct Project Quality Gate for Explore, including the following: Fit-to-standard Analysis completed Configuration definition completed Organizational Structure defined Chart of Accounts defined Fiscal Year Variant defined Group Currency defined Procedure: Log on to the Project Experience in the SAP Central Business Configuration and create a workspace for the Customizing tenant. See section 'Selecting Your Workspace (Initial Logon)' in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for the detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities for setting up the Development System. See the " Implementation Workspace" section in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for additional information on completing the activities. While defining configuration values, please ensure that Organizational Structure, Fiscal Year Variant, Group Currency and Group Ledger are correct before triggering the activation. These values cannot be changed after activation. Below is a summary of the activities: Define Scope Specify the Deployment Target Define Primary Finance Settings Set Up Organizational Structure Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure Procedure Note(s): When defining the initial scope or adding a new scope or country/region, it is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Content from this scope must be processed and transported to Production before adding the next set of countries/regions. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. A Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Cloud Development System upon completion of this set up. Task in the Transport Request is automatically released upon a successful consistency check performed in the background. In case of any error, support ticket will be automatically created for SAP Cloud Operations team to address with customer. The Transport Task will remain in status "Modifiable" and workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration will remain locked until issue is resolved. The Transport Task status will be set to "Released“ upon issue resolution and customer can then proceed with moving the transport request across systems. To avoid transport dependency issues, it is recommended that customer to release this initial transport request before carrying out further configuration activities. JSON file of your scope selection from Digital Discovery Assessment can be uploaded in Define Scope app. Reference the Importing Scope section under Scoping in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator. Review the ledger selection documentation in SAP Help - Ledger Scenarios: Choosing the Right Combination for Your Business Needs and assignment in Accel ID = S4H_2446. Additionally, refer to SAP Note - Assigning Accounting Principles to Ledgers and Company Codes in SAP S/4HANA Cloud for reference.

Task.Name: Set Up Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to perform the initial configuration of the Development tenant, and trigger the system activation. After these tasks are complete, the system will be ready for project team access. The activities are guided and executed via SAP Central Business Configuration. Prerequisites: A starter System must be available, and Development System has been requested Completed task Conduct Project Quality Gate for Explore, including the following: Fit-to-standard Analysis completed Configuration definition completed Organizational Structure defined Chart of Accounts defined Fiscal Year Variant defined Group Currency defined Procedure: Logon to the SAP Central Business Configuration and create a workspace for the Development tenant. See section 'Selecting Your Workspace (Initial Logon)' in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for the detailed steps to complete the activity. Complete the SAP Central Business Configuration activities for setting up the Development System. See the "Implementation Workspace" section in Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for additional information on completing the activities. While defining configuration values, please ensure that Organizational Structure, Fiscal Year Variant, Group Currency and Group Ledger are correct before triggering the activation. These values cannot be changed after activation. Below is a summary of the activities: Define Scope Specify the Deployment Target Define Primary Finance Settings Set Up Organizational Structure Deploy Scope and Organizational Structure Procedure Note(s): We recommend the customer to at least setup Org structure for the business process area(s) and add the scope items captured from task Detail Design for Developer Extensibility

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development system, prepare key user access, and adapt the Chart of Accounts prior to requesting the Test System. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. This deliverable supports the SAP S/4HANA Cloud without Employee Central (S4-EC). Please note: G/L account renumbering is only possible in the Development System before the first posting has been made in the production system. See Request Production System deliverable for more information.

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Development System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to receive the e-mails with the activation links for the Development System, access it, and create users. This process is followed twice: once for the Customizing tenant and once for the Development tenant. The Identity Authentication service is shared with the Starter System, and a new provisioning email will not be sent. The exception is if the 'Initial Admin User' has been changed after the Starter System activation, then the new Initial Amin User will be given administrative privileges, and a new email will be sent. Prerequisite: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System Set Up Customizing Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration Set Up Development Tenant in SAP Central Business Configuration Procedure: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User.’ Click on the access link (URL) provided (it is single sign-on enabled, and there is no password). Create users in the development system by following the instructions provided in the Accel ID = S4H_2209. If integration with a corporate IdP is required for the Development System, configure the Identity Authentication Service to act as a proxy for your corporate IdP. Configure password policies and multi-factor authentication (MFA) in your IdP (Identity Authentication service or corporate IdP) as defined in Accel ID = S4H_500. Refer the following accelerators for further information Help - Corporate Identity Providers Help - Multi-Factor Authentication Help - Configuring Password Policies Help - Secure Authentication Implement the user lifecycle strategy as defined in the Task Develop the Security Plan: Depending on the leading system for user provisioning, set up provisioning jobs in the Identity Provisioning Service for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition development system. Implement automatic locking for business users who are inactive using the Schedule Lock for Unused Business Users app. Refer Help - How to Lock Unused Business Users for details on this configuration. This feature aligns with the guidelines outlined in your user lifecycle strategy document. Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (IT Contact) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications . For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions . The SAP S/4HANA User Name in the Development System must match the User Name in the Starter System (if existing) for access to both. These should match the Login Name in the Identity Authentication service. The user name can be changed manually after the upload in any of the systems if required. The Person ID and User ID are internal numbers and do not need to match the User Name. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press 'Go.'

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Test System. The 'IT Contact' makes the requests in SAP for Me and will then receive an email with the URL and Login instructions.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Test System via Accel ID = S4H_888. It is recommended to request the Test System only when transports are ready to be released from the Development System and Imported to the Test System for testing. The Test System will be provisioned without the initial configuration. Before performing other manual rework in the Test System, the initial configuration must be released from the Development System to the Test System. Prerequisite: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System(Customizing and Development tenants) Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System' n the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to receive the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test system, prepare key user access and trigger the transport of configuration from the Development System to the Test System. This deliverable supports the SAP S/4HANA Cloud without Employee Central (S4-EC).

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to receive the Test System provisioning e-mail with the details to access it, perform the initial configuration transport to the Test System, and create users. The Identity Authentication service is shared with the Development System, and a new provisioning email will not be sent. The exception is if the Initial Admin User has been changed after the Starter System activation, then the new Initial Admin User will be given administrative privileges and a new email will be sent. Prerequisite: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System Review task Manage Transports Procedure: Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’ and access the System with the information provided in the email. If integration with a corporate IdP is required for the Development System, configure the Identity Authentication Service to act as a proxy for your corporate IdP. Configure password policies and multi-factor authentication (MFA) in your IdP (Identity Authentication service or corporate IdP) as defined in Accel ID = S4H_500. Refer the following accelerators for further information Help - Corporate Identity Providers Help - Multi-Factor Authentication Help - Configuring Password Policies Help - Secure Authentication Perform the initial configuration transport from the Customizing Tenant of the Development System to the Test System. The procedure is required for customers who just received their initial Test System. The transport request must be released from the Customizing Tenant of the Development System and imported to the Test System before the Test System can be used. Follow the instructions in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System in a 3-System Landscape for step-by-step instructions on the initial transport to Test System. Create users in the Test System. Refer to the instructions in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System in a 3-System Landscape for user creation in the Test System. Additional videos and templates are in the accelerator section. If the user lifecycle strategy defined in Task Develop the Security Plan includes user creation through replication, implement the user lifecycle accordingly. Depending on the leading system for user provisioning, set up provisioning jobs in the Identity Provisioning Service for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition test system. Implement automatic locking of business users in case of inactivity ("Schedule Lock for Unused Business Users" app) as defined in your user lifecycle strategy document. Refer Help - How to Lock Unused Business Users for details on this configuration Procedure Note(s): For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. SAP recommends triggering the initial import as soon as possible within the timelines compatible with the downward compatibility rule. Transport released in the Development System in version N should be imported, at the latest, before the Test System is upgraded to version N+2. Please refer to the task Manage Transports in the Realize phase under the deliverable Execution Monitoring of the Project. There are two tenants in the Development System: Customizing and Development. From the Development tenant in the Development system, no transport of customizing and key user extensibility objects is possible. A default customizing transport request is technically required but not used to transport content to any other system. The initial transport from SAP Central Business Configuration can’t be recreated in another release version. SAP strongly advises customers to import this initial transport, at the latest, after one release upgrade. In case of any errors during the initial configuration deployment or the transport request release, a support ticket will be automatically created for the SAP Cloud Operations team. If that is the case, the transport tasks will remain in status ‘Modifiable,’ and the SAP Central Business Configuration workspace will remain locked until the issue is resolved. The transport task status will be set to ‘Released’ upon issue resolution, and the release and import of the transport request can proceed. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, the Feature app serves as a tool to consolidate all related configuration and extension transports that can be transported together. The Feature Traceability functionality within Analytics offers an overview of the deployment progress. If the person receiving the cloud system emails (Initial Admin User) is incorrect, enter an incident under the component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV and Title 'Request update to the Contact Person IT.' In the text, please request an update to the IT Contact and Communication User. Only one person is assigned as an IT Contact. This person receives the system provisioning notifications and is the primary contact for the systems. Multiple people can be assigned as Communication Contacts. These people receive general communications related to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system. These assignments can be requested via the SAP for Me - Manage Cloud Service Availability Notifications . For additional information on the cloud product availability and maintenance, refer to the Cloud Availability Center & Cloud System Notification Subscriptions . The SAP S/4HANA User Name in the Test System must match the User Name in the Starter System (if existing) for access to both. These should match the Login Name in the Identity Authentication service. The user name can be changed manually after the upload in any of the systems if required. The Person ID and User ID are internal numbers and do not need to match the User Name. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ Business Roles can be downloaded and uploaded to different systems eliminating redundant maintenance.

Task.Name: Create and Setup the Parallel Line
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create and set up a Parallel Line for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition landscape. This involves adding an additional SAP Central Business Configuration workspace, a parallel customizing tenant in the development system, and a parallel test tenant in the test system. The Parallel Line complements the customizing, test, and production tenants of the main line, as well as the development tenant of the development line. Prerequisites: Access to am SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition development and test system. Procedure: Run prerequisite checks to verify that the creation of the parallel project can be executed. Follow the step-by-step instructions via Help - Parallel Line in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition > Manage a Parallel Line > Run Prerequisite Checks. Request a Parallel Line in SAP For Me by following the steps in Help - Parallel Line in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition > Manage a Parallel Line > Create a Parallel Line. Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘Initial Admin User’ and follow the instructions provided to access the provisioned tenant. Set up a Parallel Customizing Tenant by following the steps in the Set Up a Parallel Customizing tenant of Accel ID = S4H_2538. Set up a Parallel Test Tenant by following the steps in the Set Up a Parallel Customizing tenant of Accel ID = S4H_2538. Start using the Parallel Line by referring to the Use a Parallel Line and Best Practices for Working with a Parallel Line sections in Help - Parallel Line in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Procedure Note(s): Ensure all prerequisite checks are thoroughly completed to avoid issues during the setup of the Parallel Line. Follow the detailed guidance provided in the accelerators to ensure correct setup of the parallel tenants. Regularly check for updates and best practices in managing Parallel Lines to optimize the performance and functionality of your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition landscape.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to request the Production System. This should occur only after the initial configuration is made available in the Test System. After the Production System is delivered, the configuration between both the Test System and the Production System are kept synchronized using the transport process.

Task.Name: Evaluate the Need for a Sandbox Tenant
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review and determine if there is a need for an SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant. The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant, is a standard, non-productive, and stand-alone tenant provisioned with SAP sample data by choice. This single-system environment is isolated from the customer's Development, Test, and Productive systems making it ideal for evaluating and testing application configurations and add-ons. In addition, new scope items can be activated and explored. The sandbox tenant provides an alternative environment for fit-to-standard workshops after the Starter system has been decommissioned and is highly recommended to support expansion of countries, functionality or scope items after the initial go live. The sandbox tenant requires an additional subscription. Procedure: Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant Factsheet (3-system landscape) accelerator to become enabled on the tenant and determine if it meets the customer's needs. Determine if the use case, the system specifications, and the add-ons are enabled to meet the customer’s needs. Become enabled on the conditions, operations procedures, and considerations to understand the system and process behavior. Order the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant through an SAP representative or partner as required. Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant via SAP for Me once the subscription has been signed and processed. Access the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems and Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, sandbox tenant' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on ‘Start Provisioning.’ The request will trigger the tenant provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact/initial admin user' when the tenant is available. Locate the provisioning email sent to the ‘IT Contact’ and click on the access link (URL) provided (it is a single sign-on enabled, and there is no password needed). Procedure Note(s): This note applies only to customers converting their 2-system landscape to a 3-system landscape: SAP recommends that customers who utilize a 2-system landscape sandbox to subscribe to the new 3-system landscape Sandbox Tenant. SAP does not plan to offer technical conversion of existing 2-system based Sandbox Tenants. The customer will need to start with a fresh use of the Sandbox Tenant. If customer needs to keep their 2-system landscape sandbox for additional time, they need to keep their subscription during that time period.

Task.Name: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Production System via Accel ID = S4H_888. Once the system is requested, the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be automatically decommissioned by SAP 30 calendar days after the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System provisioning email is sent. SAP for Me will prompt you to acknowledge the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter System will be decommissioned once the Production System is triggered. It is important to understand that this action cannot be undone, so ensure that all project activities requiring the Starter System can be completed by the planned decommission date. The Production System should be requested before the Development System is on two releases prior, especially when transports are released in the buffer waiting for import. There are restrictions on how long a transport can remain in the buffer before it is imported into the Test or Production systems. Transports created in Development System two releases prior can’t be imported into the Production System. The Production System will be provisioned without the initial configuration. Before performing other manual rework in the Production System, the initial configuration must be released from the Development System to the Test System and successfully forwarded into the Production System. More details are available in the Initial Access to the Production System task. Prerequisites: Receive SAP S/4HANA Cloud Test System Configuration transported from Development System to Test System Procedure: Request the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System in SAP for Me via the SAP for Me - Dashboards > Systems & Provisioning > Provisioning accelerator. Locate the 'SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System' in the ‘Provisioning’ section under ’Product Available for Provisioning' and click on 'Start Provisioning.' The request will trigger the system provisioning, and an email will be sent to the 'IT contact' when the system is available.

Task.Name: Initial System Access for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to access the Production System, set up the initial user access and transport configuration into the Production System.

Task.Name: Initial Access to the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the 'Initial Admin User' to access the Production System, forward initial configuration from Test System to the Production System before using the system, and create users. For the initial transport to the Production System, his initial transport into the Customizing Tenant of Development System from SAP Central Business Configuration can’t be recreated in another release version. SAP strongly advises customers to import this initial transport, at the latest, after one release upgrade. Prerequisite: Request and receive Production System Procedure: Locate the provisioning emails sent to the ‘Initial Admin User' and access the Production System via the link (URL) provided (it is single sign-on enabled, and there is no password). Locate the single activation email for the Identity Authentication service and reset the Identity Authentication Service Administration Console password. If integration with a corporate IdP is required for the Development System, configure the Identity Authentication Service to act as a proxy for your corporate IdP. Configure password policies and multi-factor authentication (MFA) in your IdP (Identity Authentication service or corporate IdP) as defined in Accel ID = S4H_500. Refer the following accelerators for further information Help - Corporate Identity Providers Help - Multi-Factor Authentication Help - Configuring Password Policies Help - Secure Authentication Forward the initial configuration from the Test System to the Production System. This transport must be done before the Production System can be used. The procedure is required for customers who just received their initial Production System and need to adapt the original configurations made in the Test System. Follow the step-by-step guide in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System in a 3-System Landscape . Create users in the Production system by following the instructions in the Help - Set Up SAP S/4HANA Cloud Production System in a 3-System Landscape. If the user lifecycle strategy outlined in the "Prepare" phase includes user creation through replication, implement the user lifecycle accordingly. Depending on the leading system for user provisioning, set up provisioning jobs in the Identity Provisioning Service for your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition production system. Implement automatic locking for business users who are inactive using the "Schedule Lock for Unused Business Users" app. Refer Help - How to Lock Unused Business Users for details on this configuration. This feature aligns with the user lifecycle strategy document. Procedure Note(s): For login issues, please create an incident using the component XX-S4C-OPR-INC. For the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system, the initial user has administration rights. It can be used to create additional users with the same administration responsibilities. If the Production System is integrated with SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central, users are created in SAP SuccessFactors Employee Central and transferred to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. However, the business roles must still be assigned in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The app IAM Information System can be used to determine the existing roles that allow access to specific apps. To find the roles, set the Main Entity = Application, enter the app name in the Search field, and press ‘Go.’ Business Roles can be downloaded and uploaded to different systems eliminating redundant maintenance. Additional help can be found in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Help Portal accelerator. The changes to the standard chart of accounts and organizational structure will be transported into the Production System. For customers using SAP Cloud ALM, the Feature app serves as a tool to consolidate all related configuration and extension transports that can be transported together. The Feature Traceability functionality within Analytics offers an overview of the deployment progress and can be used to track if the transport is already assigned to a feature.

Task.Name: Enablement Content Development
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is the development of readily-accessible, easily digestible and end-user specific enablement content. This helps to facilitate and ensure an easy and effective adoption of solution knowledge and skills needed by the organizations end-users for higher system adoption and productivity.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Create a Content Development Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create a content development plan with defined roles and responsibilities for the developers creating the content. Content development should be monitored against the project deadlines. Procedure: Structure and divide the learning topics identified in the learning needs analysis report into the different learning modules. Analyze the suitability of different learning content types in terms of end-user needs, learning complexity, and quantity. Content should reflect the business criticality of the role carrying out the work, process are,a and subjects covered, while focusing on the end-user experience. Define the review process and workflows for each piece of content. Review both Managing Content Development and Enablement Content Development Overview accelerators to comprehend how to recognize the crucial elements and prerequisites for creating enablement content. Develop a content development plan that defines roles and responsibilities for the developers creating the training materials, and use both the Enablement Strategy Template and Enablement Plan Template, when available, to document and organize the overall training approach. Monitor development progress against project timelines: formally track review and sign-off for each piece of enablement content that is developed. Procedure Note(s): If WalkMe is in scope, build the agreed-upon solution based on the requirements defined during the Fit-to-Standard workshops and the provided handover materials. During the build phase, create your WalkMe solution using the WalkMe Editor. Refer to the ‘Build section’ of WalkMe Solution Planning: Getting Started Guide for guidance. Confirm license entitlement with your SAP Account Executive.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Manage Content Design and Content Development
