Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to undertake the learning enablement content design and development work with the clearly defined content development plan, a clear quality assurance process and to monitor against project timelines. Procedure: Review the Managing Content Development accelerator and any available in-product learning tutorials to identify those most relevant to the project. Identify which of these standard in-product learning tutorials should be customized to fit the project requirements. List the additional learning topics that will need to be created in addition to the standard tutorials. Identify and engage subject matter experts for business process knowledge transfer to the content developers. Deliver a workshop to the content designers and developers to introduce each deliverable template, branding and communications standards, the content review and final sign-off process and content publishing channel(s). Introduce the content development tracker to the team and explain how content development is tracked on a regular basis (to be determined by the Training Manager). Provide authoring tools, templates, and/or style guides to support the coherent look and feel of the learning enablement content. Adhere to branding standards and the organizational tone of voice. Adhere to the learning content review and sign-off process. Publish content to the agreed channels. Procedure Note(s): In-Product Tutorials are not available for all products. Additional product tutorials may have to be created based on the customer scope. If WalkMe is in scope, build the agreed-upon solution based on the requirements defined during the Fit-to-Standard workshops and the provided handover materials. During the build phase, create your WalkMe solution using the WalkMe Editor. Refer to the ‘Build section’ of WalkMe Solution Planning: Getting Started Guide for guidance. Confirm license entitlement with your SAP Account Executive.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Learning and Enablement

Task.Name: Sprint Planning and Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to plan iteratively plan sprints and finalize them upon the successful delivery of the solution.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), SAP Build, Transport Management

Task.Name: Plan the Sprint
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to iteratively plan and execute sprints to deliver solution capabilities. Each sprint should identify a clear set of features from the central backlog of requirements, gathered during fit-to-standard workshops, to enable the defined target business processes. Sprint planning meetings help define the sprint scope, highlight workstream dependencies, and ensure collaboration across the project team. The objective of the sprints is to incrementally build, test, and review solution capabilities with customer process owners (product owners in agile terminology) to confirm completion. At the start of each sprint, the project team conducts a sprint planning meeting to select backlog items based on priority and resource availability. Customers using SAP Cloud ALM should use the Feature app to document requirements and user stories to be realized during the sprint. Procedure: Review the Agile Release Planning accelerator and Sprint Plan Template to support the execution of the sprint planning meeting to: Break down each backlog item into smaller, manageable tasks to be completed during the sprint, such as configuration, coding, unit testing, data preparation, documentation, and more. Maintain these in the designated Adoption Backlog template found in the accelerators section. Validate the original estimates for each backlog item. Ensure each backlog item contains sufficient details for efficient execution and that the team has necessary skills to complete the tasks on time. Align the sprint schedule with the overall backlog timeline, including integrated applications. Clarify roles and responsibilities of project team members during the sprint. Business Process Experts: Understand the business processes being enabled during the sprint and prepare for testing. Configuration Experts: Plan to use one default transport request per sprint to capture business process setting changes. Prepare any necessary data and settings to align transportable and non-transportable configurations. Extension Experts: Plan to create one transport request per feature and coordinate with other experts (e.g., Configuration Experts, Analytics Experts) to synchronize solution developments across the system landscape. System Administrators: Ensure consistent movement of configurations and developments across the system landscape. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, leverage the Feature app to track related configurations, extensions, and transport requests within the sprint scope. Procedure Note(s): It is recommended to allocate a dedicated sprint specifically for system upgrades. As a best practice, transport requests should be moved across the entire system landscape upon the completion of each sprint.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps, Parallel Line, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM, Transport Management

Task.Name: Execute the Sprint
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to carry out the execution of tasks planned for the sprint. Procedure: Track progress using the team board, which displays swim lanes showing the status of each backlog item and associated tasks. For reference, consult the designated Sprint Burndown and Task Board accelerator. Utilize visual boards with post-it notes to provide a clear, visual representations of task progress. Regularly update the burn-down chart to monitor the progress and completion of individual tasks and backlog items. For reference, consult the designated Sprint Burndown and Task Board accelerator. Conduct regular stand-up meetings to review progress, align on activities, and address any blockers. Review the progress daily in the daily stand-up meeting. Refer to the following deliverables for detailed sprint execution activities in respective areas: Solution Configuration and New Scope Activation Integration Setup New Scope Activation Artificial Intelligent Analytics Identify and Access Extension Testing Procedure Note(s): Data migration, enablement content development and delivery, and cutover preparation are typically executed independently from sprints, following their own respective timelines during the Realize phase. For reference or examples, refer to the Agile Release Planning accelerator.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM, Transport Management

Task.Name: Close the Sprint
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to formally close the sprint by conducting a solution demo or walkthrough, holding a retrospective meeting, and obtaining formal acceptance and signoff of the sprint, if applicable. Procedure: Prepare and conduct the sprint demo where the project team presents the completed functionality to business owners and stakeholders. For reference, refer to the Accel ID = AG.05. Seek acceptance of the completed features. If additional requirements arise during the meeting, they should be added to the project backlog for future consideration. Any unaccepted features should be returned to the project backlog as requirement, properly prioritized and included in planning for next sprint. SCRUM Master organizes and facilitates the retrospective meeting for the team. Schedule the meeting shortly after the sprint demo meeting. Continuously improve the Scrum process using lessons learned from the sprint execution. Ask meeting participants to answer the following questions: What went well during the sprint? What do we want to preserve? What can be improved for the next sprint and how? Selects one or two improvement opportunities and put it into the backlog for the next sprint. This way the agile process gets improved in an incremental way and remains responsive to the changing environment of the project. Procedure Note(s): Solution walkthrough with business users, decisions makers prior to the close of the sprint is highly recommended. It ensures understanding of how solution will be used to run the business.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Analytics, Application Design and Configuration, Extensibility, Integration, Project Management, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Parallel Line, SAP BTP Apps, SAP Build, Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Required Configuration Before System Use - SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to complete the initial required configuration in SAP S/4HANA system based on the decisions made during the fit-to-standard analysis workshops. This configuration is required before transactions are executed in system.

Task.Name: Configure Tax Solution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the tax solution in SAP S/4HANA Cloud if one of the following scenarios is relevant: Setting up US Jurisdictions Code Integration to an External Tax Package Adding Tax Code Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) Pro Rata VAT Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) Procedure: Setup Jurisdictions Code (For US Only) - The tax jurisdiction codes and related tax rates must be created in the system and assigned to location specific objects. See SAP note 2440096 for internal tax calculation restrictions. Follow the instructions in the Setup of Internal Tax Jurisdictions accelerator. Note that the Tax Jurisdictions setup must be performed prior to any other configuration or organizational structure extensions. Transport the change project to the P-System. Activate the Tax Jurisdiction in the P-System via the Import Tax Codes after Transport app. Integration to External Tax Partner SAP S/4HANA Cloud delivers internal tax calculation by default. For certain countries, you can switch to the external tax solution to work with an external tax partner. Please note that your tax solution is set up at the country level. It is not possible to run both the internal and external tax solutions for the same country. Tax calculation must be configured before extending any organizational structures. For the US, review the following: It is imperative that the information listed in SAP Notes and guides are understood prior to implementing the external solution. SAP note 2598888 for integration information for the external US tax calculation including the configuration guide for integration SAP_COM_0177. SAP note 2528016 with the current restrictions regarding external US tax calculation. The external US tax calculation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and any reporting based on this calculation may not meet all the reporting requirements of US tax laws. All available tax APIs can be found in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. Select the SAP S/4HANA Cloud tile and search for “External Tax”. The tiles for the six APIs are displayed. Please note that "External Tax - Mass Redefine Tax Jurisdiction Code" and "External Tax - Get Changed Jurisdiction Code List" are optional services that are used for the mass update feature. You need to integrate these two services if you wish to use the mass update feature. The mass update consists of two service calls that run in sequence. The first, the “Get Changed Jurisdiction Code List” service, communicates with your tax partner to retrieve a table of tax jurisdiction codes that have changed within a specified period. The second, the “Mass Redefine Tax Jurisdiction Code” service, sends your tax partner a list of address information for those items where there were changes and your partner’s system returns a list of updated jurisdiction codes. This feature can be used for periodic maintenance. The certified tax partners are listed in the SAP Certified Solutions Directory accelerator and tax applications available can be found in the SAP App Center accelerator. See the Setup Guide for External Sales and Use Tax Calc (0177) accelerator for additional setup procedures. Prerequisites are an activated SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and SAP Business Technology Platform, corresponding certificates have been uploaded, and administrator access to SAP S/4HANA Cloud and CPI. For Brazil, review the following: External tax calculation for Brazil is supported by SAP S/4HANA Integration with External Tax Calculation Engine. A subscription to your preferred tax partner engine is also required. All available tax APIs can be found in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub. From the SAP Business Accelerator Hub, select product “SAP S/4HANA Cloud” tile. Go to “API” tab and select “SAP S/4HANA Integration with External Tax Calculation Engine” tile below “Packages” on the page. For Brazil, select “Tax Determination and Calculation via Integration Flow (Brazil)“. The certified tax partners are listed in the SAP App Center accelerator. For Adding Tax Codes Verify that additional tax codes are supported for your country/region by reviewing the list in the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes Common template (if applicable). If your country/region is not supported, please see the SAP Customer Influence Council task. In countries where time-dependent tax calculation (TDT) is active, certain tax rates are effective within user-specified timeframes to allow you to adapt the current or planned changes to tax rates (see topic Time-Dependent Taxes in Help - Tax Processing). Review the standard SAP S/4HANA Cloud delivered tax codes using the Display Tax Information per Country app (no tax rates are displayed for Canada and US) and determine the additional tax codes needed. Fill out the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes template with the additional tax codes. Use the Expert Configuration for Tax Codes Common template. Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘Request expert configuration for new tax code’, Description ‘Please perform expert configuration per the attached document’ and component XX-S4C-SRV-CON. Once expert configuration is complete, DO NOT CLOSE SERVICE REQUEST. The incident will be needed to activate the change in Production. Review the new tax codes using the Display Tax Information per Country app (no tax rates are displayed for Canada and US) and check, that the codes are created as requested. Perform the required tax determination in Sales and Purchasing business areas. Test all your business processes which are tax relevant with new tax codes. Some master data and configuration may be required to execute a test. Using the previous Service Request, request that the service center transports and activates the new Tax Codes in the P-System. If the request was closed, create a new request. For Countries Where Time-Dependent Tax Calculation (TDT) is in Scope If you have not previously activated the target country in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, time-dependent taxes are active as soon as you activate that target country. If you have previously activated the target country in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, then you need to migrate your existing custom-created and transactional data. Follow the steps described in the topic Activating Time-Dependent Taxes under the Help - Tax Processing accelerator. For Countries Where Pro Rata VAT is in Scope Create pro rata tax codes that can trigger the automatic splitting of deductible and non-deductible portion (Configuration Step 101016 - Define Tax Codes for Sales and Purchases) Define pro rata coefficients (Configuration Step 103619 - Define Pro Rata Coefficients) Based on this configuration, the system can then automatically split the input VAT into deductible and non-deductible portions when an incoming invoice is posted, using the valid coefficient for the company code and the tax code on the relevant date. The coefficient represents the portion of the input tax that can be deducted. For example, if the pro rata coefficient is 90% and the standard VAT rate is 21%, then 18.9% (21% × 90%) is deductible and 2.1% (21% × 10%) is non-deductible. Registration for Indirect Taxation Abroad (RITA) enables indirect tax calculation and reporting for multiple countries/regions within a single legal entity. To activate: Consider to the Prerequisites Prepare and schedule RITA migration, following the steps as described in help. Migration uses configuration item(s) with guided statuses to reduce complexity. You can run tests in your Q system for migration in status 4. Refer to Verify and Complete the Migration to RITA. When you decide to use the solution productively, open a ticket so that SAP services can complete the migration. Once completed, configuration can be initiated as instructed here.

Task.Name: Adapt Chart of Accounts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to adapt and confirm your Chart of Accounts that was defined in the Explore phase. The Chart of Accounts (CoA), a list of all G/L Account master records, is part of the pre-delivered SAP Best Practices reference content. YCOA is the global standard operating CoA in SAP S/4HANA Cloud and it is assigned to all company codes pre-delivered by SAP. Chart of Account renumbering is only needed when there are changes needed for standard pre-delivered Chart of Accounts (YCOA, YGR1, pre-delivered Local CoAs). If no changes are required, and you want to keep the SAP Best Practices account IDs and descriptions, the only requirement is to confirm the CoA settings provided. Please note: G/L Account renumbering is only possible for the G/L Accounts where postings do not exist in Production System, G/L account renumbering can only be executed in a Devlopment System. Prerequisites: Development System is provisioned. SAP Central Business Configuration, set to the ‘Product-Specific Configuration’ phase. During the execution of the renumbering via Convert Renumbered G/L Accounts app only the configuration expert is logged on to the Development System. Procedure: Access configuration activities from SAP Central business Configuration to adjust settings of G/L Accounts that require renumbering. Use the Convert Renumbered G/L Accounts app to convert the values for G/L accounts based on the mappings defined. Note that the conversion will take between 2 - 4 hours. Procedure Note(s): The G/L Account renumbering can be repeated multiple times as long as no postings are entered in the Production System. To access the Chart of Accounts Determination templates (Global and Local), use the SAP Signavio Process Navigator accelerator and follow the path provided: SAP Best Practices for SAP S/4HANA Cloud > select Country localization in ‘Version’ > navigate to the ‘Accelerators’ section> select ‘Account determination (local)’ or ‘Account determination (global)’ under the ‘Implementation’ grouping. See Chart of Accounts Configuration – Overview accelerator for more information on the overall process for configuring Chart of Accounts. See the Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance: Overview accelerator and navigate to the 'Adapting the Standard Chart of Accounts to Your Needs' section for more information on renumbering G/L Accounts or defining an Account Group. For more information on the special procedure for Chart of Accounts maintenance during upgrade, new scope item activation, or country extension see Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance - Special Cases accelerator.

Task.Name: Maintain Profit Center Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to maintain the profit center configuration. This is required to execute finance related transactions. The creation of the profit center master data must be executed in the Development, Test and Production System. This setup must be completed before posting transactions to the system. If choose not to use the value in pre-delivered customizing, make sure to update and transport the new setting in addition to maintaining the master data in respective systems. Apps Used: Manage Profit Center Groups Manage Profit Centers SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_DIVISION_ACCOUNTANT SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Use the Manage Profit Center Group app to: Create a Profit Center Group 'YBPH' as profit center Standard Hierarchy. Maintain the standard hierarchy group by creating additional group if needed. Use the Manage Profit Centers app to create all profit centers For automatic document splitting, the default profit center is defined as YB900 in S/4HANA Cloud. Additionally, assign Default Profit Center to each company code and G/L account or G/L account interval. Make sure all profit centers used in configuration are created. See the Create Profit Center (BNH) accelerator for details. Procedure Notes: Standard Hierarchy ‘YBPH’ is assigned to pre-configured controlling area ‘A000’. If you do not want to use the SAP’s default value, make sure to maintain assignment of the new value by adjusting configuration settings from SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference task Transport Configuration to move the setting to Test and Production System. If you do not want to use the SAP's default value YB900 for automatic document splitting, make sure to maintain the new value via configuration settings from ‘SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference task Transport Configuration to move the setting to Test and Production System.

Task.Name: Maintain Cost Center Master Data
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to provide guidance for cloud cost center groups in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. The creation of cost center group master data must be executed in the Development, Test and Production System. Procedure: Create cost center master data and assignment to the standard hierarchy using the Manage Cost Center app. Cloud default content is always shipped with Standard Hierarchy 0001. Standard Hierarchy 0001 is the default structure and during cost center master data creation all cost centers get assigned to 0001 or any other group from this hierarchy. The Standard Hierarchy top node 0001 is always fixed, but lower level cost center groups can be added using the Manage Cost Center Groups app. Reference the Create Cost Center and Cost Center Group (BNM) accelerator for additional information. Create Alternative Cost Center Hierarchy using the Manage Cost Center Group app. Customers can create an alternative cost center hierarchy as this is freely defined/maintained by customers and any lower level groups can be assigned. Each cost center must be specifically added to your defined alternative cost center hierarchy via the Manage Cost Center Group app. The recommended example structure is shown below but others are possible: Top Level: A000 (controlling area) Second Level: company code Third level: further grouping by functions/location (ex. Finance/ Admin etc.) Fourth level: individual cost centers Repeat the process in the Production System. The setup is master data and thus cannot be transported.

Task.Name: Maintain Takeover Date Information for Asset Accounting
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm values for the data takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets into Asset Accounting in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This confirmation is a mandatory step after initial activation and must be completed before posting transactions, in Asset Accounting, to the system. The takeover date defines the current fiscal year and the last closed fiscal year in Asset Accounting. It is critical for system processing, as it identifies the point in time that asset values are loaded and is usually the prior year end day (assuming you only want to mention the Transfer at End of Fiscal year). For example, if the system is in FY-2019 and the company is on a standard calendar Fiscal Year, the TAKEOVER DATE is 12/31/2018. Caution - This implies the loading of legacy assets is as of the Year End 2018. These settings must be executed in the Development, Test and Production Systems. Apps Used: Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_AA_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Use the Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) app to set values for the data takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets. Open the Make Company Code Settings (Asset Accounting-Specific) app. The Display Settings for Company Code in Asset Accounting screen is displayed. To switch between change and display mode, choose Change/Display. Select your company code on the left side of the screen and choose Select Company Code. Choose the General Settings tab. Check the status for your Company. The General Information tab shows your Company Code settings. The Company Code Status should be “For Testing.” In the Legacy Data Transfer section, check or change the following entries (if required, create a new legacy transfer segment first by choosing Create Legacy Transfer Segment): Transfer Date: set this date to the last day of the Prior Fiscal Year End (for the Transfer Date value, this is usually a year end date for a prior year). If you are instructed to use a mid-year date, this would be a month-end date. The date should always move forward (do not change it backward). Legacy Data Transfer Status: set this status to Ongoing or Ongoing (Other Postings Allowed). Document Type: set this to UE – Data Transfer. For the Legacy Data Transfer Status value, you have four options: In Preparation: The system allows incomplete customizing settings for the legacy data transfer (for example, the document type for posting of the legacy data transfer can be missing). Ongoing: Only legacy data transfer postings are permitted (for example, other types of postings, acquisition, retirements are not permitted). Ongoing (Other Postings Allowed): Both legacy data transfer postings and other postings are permitted. This status makes sense when you perform further legacy data transfers in a company code that is already productive. Completed: The legacy data transfer is completed. Legacy Data Transfer postings are not allowed and you are not allowed to create legacy assets. After the legacy data transfer is completed set the Legacy Data Transfer Status to Completed. Before making any postings in Asset Accounting in your Production System, repeat the above steps to confirm values for data the takeover date, the status, and the document type for entering legacy assets already done in the Development System.

Task.Name: Maintain Data and Setting for Treasury Management (Optional)
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to maintain settings and data required before start testing and using applications of Treasury Management in respective systems. This includes Development Customizing Tenant for initial unit tests, Test System for integrated business process tests, and Production System upon completion of a sprint for productive use. It is very common that transportable customization settings have dependency to these setting and data maintained directly in respective systems, and vice versa. Pre-requisite: Optional scope items are requested and activated. See task Activate New Scope or Country/Region for details. Procedure: Create/Import Banks and Bank Accounts for Cash Management processes. Before using cash management, set up the bank and bank account master data using Manage Banks and Manage Bank Account app. The set up must be done either manually or via Excel import (bank accounts). Once house banks and house bank accounts are maintained, the respective standing instructions can be assigned via the business partners. Maintain setting for front office/back office related processes: Assign role counterparty (TR0151 – Counterparty) using Maintain Business Partner app. Within this role the company-code dependent settings must be maintained and the authorizations for the relevant product and transactions type must be allowed. Otherwise, it is not possible to enter a transaction with a business partner. Following Business Roles are required to use the app: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE, SAP_BR_BUPA_MASTER_SPECIALIST. Securities Master Data like Class Master Data (Manage Security Classes - FWZZ) must be created in respective system before entering security transactions. The same approach is necessary for the Securities Account (Maintain Securities Account – TRS_SEC_ACC) to manage and value your positions in the securities area. You can only create a securities account once you have defined the depository bank (TR0152 – Depository Bank) as a business partner. Prerequisite: the relevant business partners must be created and additionally the respective role (TR0150 – Issuer) must be assigned. Apps used: Manage Securities Classes, Manage Securities Accounts Business Roles Required: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE Correspondence Master Data: If the Correspondence Framework is being used, master data is required. Therefore, the following settings must be maintained in respective systems: Definition of Fixing References for the confirmation of NDFs using SWIFT MT300 (FTR_FIX_DEF) Definition of Values for Expiry Time for FX options (FTR_EXPIRY_TIME_DEF) Assign BIC (Bank Identifier Code) and External Securities Acc. ID to Business Partner (FTR_BP_BIC) Assign Business Partner Group and Profiles (FTR_INT_ASSIGN & FTR_EXT_ASSIGN) Traders and Trader Authorizations: After you have defined traders in your system directly you can use Define User Data app to assign the traders to users, such as users in role Treasury Specialist - Front Office. Using the Manage Trader Authorizations app, you can restrict the transactions a trader may conclude to the individual values. Additionally, the maintenance of the transaction authorization needs to be done on every system individually via Fiori App Manage Trader Authorizations or TBT1. Maintain following data and setting for Risk Management related functionalities. Definition of Time Pattern for Hedging Areas: The time patterns that you define are relevant for the target quota table of the hedging area. These settings are necessary for the Hedge Management Reporting via the Hedge Management Cockpit. This information is required to be maintained on each system directly (TOE_TIME_PATTERN). Definition of Hedging Areas: The hedging area is an entity that represents a section of your hedging policy. In the hedging area, you define the level of granularity with which you want to monitor your foreign exchange risk. You also specify in the hedging area which exposures and hedging instruments are relevant for the hedging area (TOE_HEDGING_AREA). The hedging area is the basic master data of Hedge Management reporting and needs to be maintained directly in each system. It controls the execution of the Hedge Management Cockpit. Market Data: Market data can be transferred to the system from a file interface or via real-time data feed. You can use the function for market data transfer from spreadsheets. In addition to the backend functions, you can also use the SAP Fiori Launchpad to access the Import Market Data app for the data transfer, and other apps for the manual entry. Dependent on your decision to import the respective market data, the import needs to be done before entering a transaction to have the relevant market data available. Apps used: Import Market Data, Import Foreign Exchange Rates, Request Current Market Data – Data feed Business Roles Required: SAP_BR_TREASURY_SPECIALIST_BOE Perform initial activation steps: Initializing Cash Management: This activity is to set up transactional data that will be used by Cash Management applications. SAP S/4HANA Finance for cash management consumes data from the One Exposure from Operations table (database table FQM_FLOW). It contains cash management data such as memo records, and data from other components like accounting, end-of-day bank statements, TRM, CML, FI-CA, and integrated data from remote systems. To use SAP S/4HANA Finance for cash management, perform the following data setup activities: Build key information in accounting documents (database table BSEG) Load data into One Exposure from Operation Load data from Treasury and Risk Management (TRM), Loans Management (FS-CML), Contract Accounts Receivable and Payable (FI-CA), and integrated remote systems, into the One Exposure from Operations hub. Initializing Parallel Valuation Areas: The initialization process to generate new valuation areas in the Treasury subledger (Treasury Ledger) must be done in all system directly, otherwise it is not possible to enter new transactions (TPM_INITIALIZE).

Task.Name: Perform other Configurations and Checks
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to address the following configuration activities Implementations where the SAP S/4HANA Cloud customer has chosen to configure their own specific Fiscal Year variant and not adopt the standard K4 or one of the pre-delivered Fiscal Year Variants. This task is to configure the customer specific Fiscal Year Variant (FYV), that has the ID SZ, according to the business requirements. The Fiscal Year Variant definition is required to define the relationship between the calendar year and your fiscal year. Fiscal Year Variants specify the number of periods and the start and end date of the fiscal year. This setup must be completed before posting transactions to the Test System and the Production System. Verification of the agreed material number output format: Once a material exists in the system, changing of the material number output format is not possible. Prerequisites: SZ (configurable template) has been chosen as the corporate FYV using the Fiscal Year Variant configuration in the Test System during the pre-activation setup. No journal entries have been posted in the Test System and the Production System. Procedure: Execute the desired Fiscal Year Variant configuration, see the Fiscal Year Variant Implementation - Overview accelerator for additional procedure steps. Verify the agreed material number output format. Refer SAP Note - 2853413 - FAQ on Product Master Capabilities for restrictions on changes to lexicographical setting in the material number format.

Task.Name: Setup SAP BTP Apps
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is for the customer to setup the SAP BTP Apps that are a part of the implementation scope. The setup typically consists of initial setup on the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP) environment followed by integration setup with solutions like SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Please review the setup guides for the availability of boosters and Cloud Integration Automation Service workflows that can automate some of the steps.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Setup and Configure SAP BTP Apps
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to setup the SAP BTP Apps that have been identified as being part of the implementation scope Prerequisite: A finalized list of SAP BTP Apps to be setup based on the scope items that were selected in Task Determine Process Scope. Procedure: Go to the Products with Integration Capabilities section within the accelerator Help - S/4HANA Cloud Integration and review the setup instructions listed under the column Integration information for the corresponding SAP BTP App. Use the guidance provided in Recommendations for the SAP Business Suite Customer Tenant Landscape to determine the SAP BTP sub-account structure and the mapping to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition tenants. Perform the setup activities on the SAP BTP Environment followed by the integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Use Boosters and SAP Cloud Integration Service procedures when available. The following documentation shows how some SAP BTP Apps support the automation of the initial setup process through Boosters. Help - Onboarding SAP Integrated Product Development - Design to Manufacturing Scenario Help - Automatic Initial Setup of SAP Document and Reporting Compliance, Cloud Edition using Booster The SAP BTP Apps listed below are examples of how the SAP BTP Apps can be implemented and integrated with S/4HANA Cloud using Cloud Integration Automation Service workflows. Please refer task Cloud Integration Automation Service User Guide for additional details. Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Cloud for Real Estate Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Market Rates Management, Bring Your Own Rates data option Cloud Integration Automation Service - Project Mgmt in SAP Project and Resource Mgmt Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Subscription Billing Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Ariba Central Invoice Management Cloud Integration Automation Service - SAP Ariba Buying Cloud Integration Automation Service - Resource Mgmt capability SAP Project and Resource Mgmt For partner delivered integrated applications, reach out to the corresponding partner for Help and User documentation. Procedure Note(s): For SAP BTP Apps, where no Boosters or SAP Cloud Integration Service procedures are available, refer the Administration Guides linked to the Help Documentation listed in Task Self-Enable on SAP BTP Apps for the manual steps to setup and integrate the application.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Industry Cloud Apps, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Integration Setup in the Test System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to setup the integration in the Test system. Some integrations have prerequisites that need to be completed before the integration is setup. In case you chose to use the Cloud Integration Automation Service follow the instruction of the Service.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: Set Up Integrations in the Test Tenant
Task.Notes: .The purpose of the task is to set up standard and customer driven integrations in the Test Tenant. Prerequisites: The integration scenarios has been identified using SAP Signavio Process Navigator and documented in the accelerator Integration and API List in the task ‘Determine Scenario Options for Integrations’ The Setup Instructions for standard integrations have been downloaded from the accelerator section of the corresponding Solution Process within SAP Signavio Process Navigator. Detailed scenario options and Business Technology Platform Integration Suite iFlow design for Customer Driven Integrations has been documented in the Explore phase Initial Setup for Joule has been completed. Procedure: Standard Integration Setup Set up integrations to the different tenants of the SAP Business Suite Landscape as outlined in Accel ID = S4H_1765. Set up the integration according to the developed or downloaded setup guide. Set up the monitoring using Application Interface Framework (AIF) by assigning recipients to users in the tile "Assign Recipients" in “Message Monitoring.” Standard Integration Setup using Cloud Integration Automation Service Review the setup instructions in the Cloud Integration Automation Service User Guide accelerator. Open the link in accelerator Cloud Integration Automation Service - Integration Solution and Scenarios and select the solution and it's scenario(s) as per your project scope. If the Integration scope item has been included within the scope of your project defined in SAP Cloud ALM, you can access the Cloud Integration Automation procedure directly as follows. If the scope item containing the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure has been set as being in scope, a task for the integration setup is automatically generated and assigned. Open the corresponding Task within the Task app and navigate directly to the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure within your Cloud Integration Automation Service tenant using the ‘Open Application’ option under the ‘More’ section. Execute the Cloud Integration Automation Service procedure to configure the integration. Ensure that the SAP BTP Apps setup during Task Setup and Configure SAP BTP Apps have been integrated with the test tenant. Customer Driven Integration Setup Set up Customer-Driven Integrations based on iFlow design documented in task Design SAP Business Technology Platform Integration iFlows for Customer-Driven Integrations Set up integrations for integrated applications as documented in the task 'Determine Scenario Options for Integrations' Joule Integration Setup To Integrate Joule centrally within the landscape, customers need to plan and map their SAP BTP subaccounts carefully considering the supported Joule data centers Ensure that the prerequisites mentioned in SAP Help - Joule Onboarding Guide are met. Perform the Joule Integration specific steps mentioned in SAP Help - Joule Integration with SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Review and evaluate the Joule Integration specific constraints mentioned in SAP Help - Constraints for Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Procedure Note(s): Details regarding the Integration scenarios and setup have already been captured in tasks ‘Determine Details for Customer-Driven Integrations’ and ‘Determine Scenario Options for Integrations’ of the Explore phase. This task needs to be performed for each signed off integration. A fiori app 'Message monitoring for Integration Experts' can be alternatively used for monitoring integrations. The Subscribe to Cloud Integration Automation Services in BTP is referred in Prepare Phase in SAP Supporting Implementation Tool Access deliverable.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Industry Cloud Apps, Joule, SAP BTP Apps

Task.Name: Solution Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to configure the mandatory settings, according to the delta design defined and agreed upon during the Explore phase in the fit-to-standard process activities. Configuration is done in a series of sprints, typically 2-week cycles, to incrementally build and test the integrated business environment. The first sprint typically involves finalizing core configuration, activating legal entities, setting up organizational structures, and configuring master data settings. Subsequent sprints address gaps and requirements identified in the project backlog. Configuration data is taken from our SAP Best Practices (also known as standard business process or leading practices or standard configuration) repository, for cases where they are available and appropriate for new business processes. The process follows an agile model, with sprints covering system configuration, documentation, and unit testing based on the project backlog. An incremental approach should be followed, starting with general settings per Line of Business and progressing to detailed configuration for each area.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Configure Additional Organizational Entities
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to extend the organization structure in SAP Central Business Configuration in addition to those defined during initial Development System activation. Procedure: Extend organization structure defined in preceding phases. Create additional organizational structure entities when needed. Procedure Notes: New company codes must be transported prior to adding banks and lockbox definitions in Development System or Production System for the new company codes to avoid activation errors in the Production System. If using the internal tax calculation, it must be configured before extending the organizational structure. Selecting additional country/region will result in new mandatory org structure maintenance for selected scenarios that are in scope. Organization structure can't be deleted once setup. Reference Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for details of using features in SAP Central Business Configuration to maintain organizational structure.

Task.Name: Maintain Additional G/L Accounts
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to create the additional G/L Accounts for the Chart of Accounts based on the definition developed in the Explore Phase. Apps Used: Manage G/L Account Master Data SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Update the descriptions of standard delivered accounts using the Manage G/L Account Master Data app. Create new accounts using the Manage G/L Account Master Data app. The accounts are created from reference accounts and using the Copy button. Transport to Production System. Procedure Notes: See Chart of Account Configuration - Overview.pptx accelerator and solution help for more information on the overall process for configuring Chart of Accounts. For more information on the special procedure for Chart of Accounts maintenance during upgrade, new scope item activation, or country extension see Help - Chart of Accounts Maintenance - Special Cases accelerator.

Task.Name: Configure SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure the solution based on the fit-to-standard analysis and the customer specific configuration definition. This involves adjusting pre-delivered settings to meet specific customer needs as identified during Fit-to-Standard workshops. The configuration changes are then saved and tested to ensure they meet the business requirements. Procedure: Review the configuration requirements captured during Fit-to-Standard workshops. Access configuration activities from SAP Central Business Configuration to adjust pre-delivered setting per customer specific need based on decision made in Fit-to-Standard workshops. Save setting changes in one or more modifiable transports. Reference Help - Transport Modes to understand the selected transport mode for your project and save changes accordingly. Unit test to confirm the configured business process meets business requirement. Reference Transport Configuration task to move transports cross the system landscape. Document the changes accordingly. Procedure Note(s): The list of available configuration activities is dependent on the activated scope and is organized hierarchically according to their business areas. Reference Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for how to search and execute the configuration activities. Configuration changes are recorded in a transport request in the Customizing Tenant of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Development System. The change log of configuration activities can be accessed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Reference Help - SAP Central Business Configuration for more details. It is a best practice to use sprints of 1 to 2 weeks to fulfill requirements and enable business processes. Have one default transport for each sprint for all configuration settings. Create a manual type for corrections. Reference industry-specific or non-standard scope item-related accelerators for setup instructions when applicable.

Task.Name: Request Expert Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to request the Service Center to complete the pre-approved expert configuration identified and documented during the fit-to-standard in the Explore phase. The expert configuration should not be requested all at one time. It should be part of a sprint where one or more processes are configured; transported and tested in the Test System; and then moved to the Production system. Procedure: Fill out the template for the respective pre-approved expert configurations. Create an Incident/Service Request with the following: Subject: ‘Request Expert Configuration for <<topic>>’ Description: ‘Please maintain the expert configuration as defined on the attached expert configuration worksheet.’ Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Attach the file to the Incident/Service Request. Include transport request number. Procedure Notes: Expert Configuration - Depreciation Key Template DPK.xlsm is only performed on the Development System. It is transported to the Test System and the Production System via the transport process. The list of pre-approved expert configuration request can be found in Configuration Activity.xlsm . Template can be found in tabs labeled with solution process ID in the accelerator or in separate template file for the respective solution process.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Line

Task.Name: Request the IFRS 15 “Bundling Functionality” (Optional)
Task.Notes: This task is only relevant for implementations that have International Financial Reporting Standards and that need to support multi-element arrangements in contracts with customers (IFRS 15). The purpose of this task is to notify development that the “bundling functionality” is required for the implementation. Development will assist in verifying consistency of the customer requirements with the solution and guide the customer through the configuration process in the Development System. If the IFRS 15 requirements are not known prior to conducting the fit-to-standard workshop, the notification should be entered once the requirement is identified. Procedure: Create an Incident/Service Request with the Subject ‘IFRS 15 bundling’, Description ‘Our project requires the use of IFRS 15 functionality. Please provide instructions on how we should proceed.’ using the component CO-PC-OBJ_EBR. Follow the instructions that will be provided in the request. Procedure Note(s): See SAP note 2524569 for additional information

Task.Name: Enable Data Protection and Privacy Features
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure data protection solutions per design documented during the Fit-to-Standard workshop. Procedures: Configure the following according to the guidelines from the data protection workshop: Define data controller. Define retention policies for transactional data. Define residence policies for transactional data. Define retention policies for master data objects. Retention policies for security audit logs. Define residence policies for master data objects. Define and maintain Purposes for information retrieval. Configure read access logging (if it is in scope) Configure consent administration (if it is in scope) Reference Transport Configuration task to move transports cross the system landscape. Procedure Note(s): Unit test in Development System is not relevant for Data Protection and Privacy configuration settings due to data requirements. Testing of functionality should be planned in Test System sequenced at the end of testing cycles where process related documents at various status are available.

Task.Name: Implement Frontend Security Settings
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure web client protection measures, such as CORS and CSP, in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition as identified in previous steps. These values may vary for development, testing, and production landscapes. Procedure: Make sure to set the content-security-policy switch to "ON" in the Manage Content Security Policy app for all environments. This helps maintain robust security across development, testing, and production landscapes. Review section Frontend Communication Security from SAP Help - Protect Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for additional details on the topic.

Task.Name: Setup Output Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to set up the output management, including the connection of devices, customization of forms, and the determination logic. Procedure: Setup printer. Define the technical set up for printing business documents. This is executed by defining print queues in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and installing the SAP Cloud Print Manager for Pull Integration on the local network Setup email. Define the technical setup for sending emails in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. This includes defining the sender domains, sender email addresses and email addresses for testing. Customize form template. Create customer specific form based on the SAP provided templates using Adobe LiveCycle Designer. Activities include downloading the form templates, modifying and testing them locally, and uploading them back to the system for further testing. SAP delivers standard form templates for many business applications as well as for different layout definitions. If a new form has been assigned within the corresponding configuration step, import all changes together to respective systems before testing. Customize email template. Create customer specific email templates based on the SAP S/4HANA Cloud provided templates. Activities include copying an SAP email template, modifying its content, and defining business rules for its usage. SAP delivers standard email templates for many business applications. Procedure Note(s): Use accelerator Output Management Set-up Instructions (1LQ) and Adobe LiveCycle Learn & Support accelerators for more details in procedure steps. Reference Blog - Installation and Configuration accelerators or search in the community with keyword ‘Output Management’ or tag ‘Cloud Print Manager’ for tips & tricks, lessons learned. Forms must be cleared from the Production System import queue prior to the Production System upgrade.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Verify Configuration with Business Process Requirements
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to verify that the configured solution meets the expectation of the Business Process Expert. After the solution is configured and unit tested, the Business Process Expert along with the Configuration Expert execute the business processes and verify the process meets the business needs. Multiple iterations may be necessary until the business process is complete. Once satisfied, the Business Process Expert approves the process as complete. Procedure: Review process configured against the corresponding business process flow with the Configuration Expert. If any additional changes are required: Update Design and Configuration documentation accordingly. Reference Document Business Process Target State and Document Configuration Values for tasks for template used and document created in Fit-to-Standard workshop. Reflect additional work required in backlog. Plan activities towards a specific sprint. Carry out the additional configuration steps. Confirm business requirements are met. Procedure Note(s): For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, update information captured in Requirement and Notes app accordingly.

Task.Name: Transport Configuration
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to release transports in Customizing Tenant of Development System, import to Test System and forward to Production System upon successful testing. Using sprints of 1 to 2 weeks, business processes are configured in Customizing Tenant of Development System, moved to the Test System and tested. At completion of the sprint, transport requests are forwarded and imported into Production System. Apps Used: Export Customizing Transports (Customizing Tenant of Development System) Import Collection (Test System and Production System) SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT Procedure: Plan the functionality that will be configured in the sprint. This includes configuration, expert configuration, and master data. Configure in Customizing Tenant of Development System and perform unit and string testing. All configuration is automatically recorded for transport. Any dependent master data must be manually recreated in the Test and Production System before the changes are transported. The transports should be named according to a predefined convention. Release all configuration changes using the Export Customizing Transports application in the Customizing Tenant of Development System. Import the configuration transport with the Import Collection application in the Test System. Forward all the changes to the Production System after E2E, SIT and UAT testing in the Test System, by clicking the ‘Forward’ button in the Import Collection application in Test System. Import the above transport in the Production System by using the Import Collection application. Repeat the process for each configuration sprint. Each sprint should be 1-2 weeks in duration to limit the size of the new content. Procedure Note(s): Configuration dependent master data must be manually recreated in the Test and Production Systems before releasing the transport (i.e. forms, bank definitions, tax jurisdiction codes, calendars, etc.). For an overview of Transport Management, access the SAP Help - 3-System Landscape and Transport Management accelerator. To understand dependencies in transports, reference the Transport Dependencies section of the accelerator. It is recommended, when possible, to release customizing transports in sequence by their creation date. A sequencing check is performed in the background upon release of Transport Request in Development, import to Test and Production. This check applies to transports deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Use Default transport request for changes planed during the sprint. Create Manual transport request when needed for corrections during the sprint. Transports created and released in Customizing Tenant of Development System two releases prior need to be recreated in the current release before it can be imported into Test and Production System For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, Feature app can be used to group all related configuration and extension transports that should be moved together. Feature Traceability in Analytics provides a quick overview of the deployment status. Reference Transport Automation section of Help - Importing a Software Collection to turn on automation settings for Import and Forward. To compare configuration setting between Development, Test and Production systems and tenants using Implementation Activities app, reference Help - Implementation Activities accelerator for more details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Manage Settings in Test / Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manually maintain settings in the Test and Production System that cannot be transported from the Development system or are changeable directly in Test or Production System. This process can be required anytime changes are transported to the Test and Production System for the following: Initial provisioning and activation of the Test or Production System New country/countries New scope activations Procedures: Access the Implementation Activity app in Test or Production system, filter for settings which are “Editable in all systems” and apply changes for those settings should not be transported. Review Help - Implementation Activities on applying filter parameters when working in the app. Review Help - Manual Rework Activities in the Production System and perform manual rework activities in Test or Production system when applicable. Procedure Note(s): Availability of implementation activities that are available after launching the Implementation Activities app is based on the authorization of the user. Document intervals are typically not included in the recording of customizing changes. It is recommended to maintain these intervals for each business process area in target system directly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Line

Task.Name: Configure and Transport Changes in the Parallel Line
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to configure and transport your changes using the parallel line. A parallel line can be used to make scope extensions, extensions to the organizational structure and configuration changes Prerequisites: Parallel line has been set up. Your parallel line has been initialized and branched successfully, triggered by your service request in SAP for Me. Reference content has been activated. Business users in the project tenants are created. Procedure: Add additional scope, org structure and custom configurations using the parallel line. See details in the Changes in Your Parallel Line section of Help - Parallel Line in SAP Central Business Configuration . Transport your configurations changes to the Project Test Tenant using the Export Customizing Transports and Import Collections apps. For details, see Transport Management Section in the Accel ID = S4H_2537. Procedure Note(s): Refer to Parallel Line Overview.pdf for an overview of the Parallel Line process. Merging is a manual process, but you can automate some of the tasks when specific conditions are met. For more information, refer to SAP Note 3584765 - Merge as a Manual or Semiautomated Process for the Parallel Line After completion of the project requiring the parallel line, the parallel line should be deleted.

Task.Name: New Scope or Country/Region Activation
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to review, evaluate and activate the SAP S/4HANA Cloud new solution scope or new country/region in the Starter or, Development System using SAP Central Business Configuration. It is possible that new features will be delivered during the duration of the project. The project team must decide if they would like to take advantage of the new scope and if it is acceptable within the project schedule, or if they should delay the decision until after Go-Live. The release can occur during any phase of the project. Additional planning and configuration may be required.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Verify Requirements for New Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is for the project team to verify that the new country requirements are consistent with the existing cross-country configuration. A new country activation should be treated as a new project. Already existing countries are not impacted by new country activation, however, once a new country is activated it cannot be removed. Please note when using the Development System, some configurations cannot be changed and changes to global configurations may have a direct impact on existing countries. Procedure: Use SAP S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer accelerator to review the product roadmap to determine if the country is available for activation. Validate all necessary scope items are available for the planned country using the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items.xlsx accelerator. Validate that the planned country to be added complies with the existing global settings and with your planned countries’ legal regulations. Global settings to consider are: Scope bundle Leading group fiscal year variant Leading ledger Chart of Accounts Group currency Currency type (additional consideration) Determine if any of the existing roles and authorizations will be impacted. Determine if any of the existing integrations will be impacted.

Task.Name: Set Up Exchange Rates for New Country/Region
Task.Notes: This task is only necessary if new countries are being added to the configuration scope. The purpose of this task is to configure the translation ratios for currencies and enter the exchange rates related to new countries/regions. The configuration and exchange rate data are necessary prior to requesting a new country/region to be added. Apps/Configuration Steps Used: Maintain Exchange Rates Configuration Used (SAP Central Business Configuration): Define Translation Ratios for Currency Translation SAP Business Roles Template Required: SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT Procedure: Create entries for Exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ for the currency of the new country/region being requested using the configuration step Define Translation Ratios for Currency Translation. Four entries are required per currency requiring exchange rates. See the system help for additional information. Note that some pairs are delivered with the solution and therefore do not require new entries. (SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT) Enter the exchange rates for the local and global currencies for exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ using the Maintain Exchange Rates app. Four entries are required per currency. See the system help for additional information. (SAP_BR_GL_ACCOUNTANT) Transport the change project to Production System. See task Execute Configuration Transport Sprints for more details on how to transport configuration. In the Production System, enter the exchange rates for the local and global currencies for exchange Rate Type ‘M’ and ‘P’ using the Maintain Exchange Rates app. Four entries are required per configured country currency. See the system help for additional information.

Task.Name: Activate New Scope
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review, evaluate, and activate additional new solution process using SAP Central Business Configuration, and then move business configuration settings across the landscape upon successful testing. Procedure: Review the new solution scope related to the latest SAP S/4HANA Cloud release in the Accel ID = S4H_385. Evaluate the SAP Best Practices Process Model and Test Script document related to the new/inactive scenario to determine if the functionality is needed. The scenario details are provided in the SAP Signavio Process Navigator - Solution Scenario Selection . Select new process scenario in SAP Central Business Configuration. The request activation of Non-Standard and License Scenarios is done by the Service Center via an Incident/Service Request, with the following information: Subject: ‘Activation of New Licensed Scenarios’ Description: ‘Please activate the scenarios listed below in the Development System.’ List the scenario title(s) as they appear in the Define Scope app of the SAP Central Business Configuration. Component: XX-S4C-OPR-SRV. Some Non-Standard process scenarios are now available for activation from SAP Central Business Configuration. Please refer to the Availability and Dependencies of Scope Items.xlsx to see what can be activated from SAP Central Business Configuration. Review sample organizational structure setup and add additional organization structure element when needed. Deploy scope activation. Upon deployment, a Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Cloud Development System. The Transport Request Task is automatically released upon a successful consistency check performed in the background. To avoid transport dependency issues, it is recommended that customer to release this Transport Request before carrying out further configuration activities. Use Export Customizing Transports app to locate the transport using Type ‘Central Business Configuration’ and Change On date in order to Release the Transport Request. Adjust system settings for selected scope. Follow the transport steps to move the settings across the system landscape. See task Transport Configuration for more information. Test and verify to make sure the new scenario works as expected and does not impact existing functionalities. Execute manual rework activities in the target system. See task Manage Settings in Test / Production System for more information. Procedure Notes: Multiple scenarios can be selected in the same change project. Scenarios that require an additional subscription cannot be activated without a subscription contract. Organizational structure enhancements, adding new scope and access to configuration activities from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible during upgrade period with some exceptions. Check SAP Note 3139304 - Automatic Activation of Advanced Valuations for SAP Central Business Configuration behavior during the software upgrade of SAP S/4HANA systems for exceptional cases. In case of error during consistency check during deployment from SAP Central Business Configuration, a support ticket will be automatically created for SAP Cloud Operations team to address with customer. The Transport Task in Customizing Tenant of S/4HANA Development System will remain in status "Modifiable" and workspace in SAP Central Business Configuration will remain locked until issue is resolved. The Transport Task status will be set to "Released“ upon issue resolution and customer can then proceed with moving the transport request across systems. The new G/L accounts entries may not have direct relevance to the requested scenario(s). The renumbering of new G/L accounts is only possible in the Test System if no entries have been posted in the account in the Production System. See task Adapt Chart of Accounts for more information. If you require further assistance for the newly added G/L accounts after the scenario(s) activation, please create an incident with component FI-CNT-GL. For customer using Cloud ALM, reflect additional scope in Process app. Reference Process Scoping in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal .

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Parallel Line

Task.Name: Set Up New Country/Region
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to set up selected country in project scope, starting from SAP Central Business Configuration, and then move changes across the landscape upon successful testing. Procedure: Review documented localization requirements from fit-to-standard workshop. For SAP delivered country/Region versions, select scenarios for the country/region in SAP Central Business Configuration. For customer under Early Adoption Program and need to create its own local version, use SAP Central Business Configuration's Configuration Localization Tool to create the new country by copying the source country as a template. Refer Task Set Up New Country with Configuration Localization Tool for more information. Adjust system settings for the activated or copied country/region. Use localization extensibility capabilities available with Localization as Self-Service tool to further extend and adapt. Reference details in Extension Development deliverable for details on realization of these respective requirements. Follow the transport steps to move the settings across the system landscape. See task Transport Configuration for more information. Test and verify to make sure the new country/region work as expected and does not impact existing functionalities. Execute manual rework activities in the target system when needed. See task Manage Settings in Test / Production System for more information. Procedure Note(s): Reference Help - SAP Central Business Configuration accelerator on scoping, organization structure management and making configuration setting adjustment. Scope finalization for SAP delivered country/region versions may take some time. Wait for its completion before starting the next activity. A country cannot be deactivated or removed once completed. It is recommended to limit the number of countries/regions to no more than five. Check SAP Note 3151804 - Country Activation Guidance in Central Business Configuration for best practices. When activating SAP delivered country/region, be aware that there will be new mandatory organizational structure requirements that need to be maintained for selected scenarios. For legal entity operating in multiple countries/regions, consider activating Registration for Indirect Taxation Aboard (RITA) function for the plant aboard scenario instead of activating a new country/region when applicable. Reference task Configure Tax Solution for more details on activation. Activating new country/region and access to configuration activities from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible during upgrade period with some exceptions. Check SAP Note 3215993 - Software Update & Upgrade for SAP Central Business Configuration behavior during the software upgrade of SAP S/4HANA systems for exceptional cases. Adjustment of source template country configuration activities takes time. For customer under Early Adoption Program and need to create its own local version using Configuration Localization Tool, it is common that there will be more requirements need to leverage extensibility capabilities. This requires additional development work in extension, reports, integration. It is recommended that customer requests a separate Sandbox environment to fully set up the country and perform the initial testing before moving configuration and development into the project landscape.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Localization, Parallel Line

Task.Name: Set Up New Country with Configuration Localization Tool
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to set up country using Configuration Localization Tool for those countries that don’t have pre-configured best practice processes. Adjustment of source country configuration activities takes time. It is also common that there will be more requirements requires the usage of localization extensibility tools, requiring additional development work in extension, reports, integration. Procedure: Perform initial setup for the country in SAP Central Business Configuration tool. Follow the process flow and instructions listed in Accel ID = S4H_2816. After the initial deployment in the mainline, the Configuration Localization Tool(CLT) will only be available in a parallel line. To use the Configuration Localization Tool in Main line after the initial deployment, use the instructions mentioned in the Procedure Note section. Review and adjust organization structure setups. Reference task Document Localization Requirement for a list of backlog items. Execute configuration activities and unit test. Develop extension and unit test. Setup integration and unit test. Replicate all changes in Development System of Main Line. Transport and conduct test in Test System of Main Line and sign off for production usage. Procedure Note(s): SAP does not provide legal changes for customer implemented localizations. Customers must maintain legal changes using configuration activities or extension development. Note that you cannot delete customer local versions after their activation in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud tenant. There are no specific features delivered for the countries/regions created using the Configuration Localization Tool. The scope/features are inherent from the source countries that are released for Configuration Localization Tool. To use the Configuration Localization Tool in a Main line after the initial deployment, raise a service request under component CBC-CFG-CAML using the following message template. "We acknowledge SAP’s recommendation to use a Parallel Line as a risk mitigation approach to safeguard the production environment and project timeline during the development of a customer local version. However, we have decided to proceed without implementing this risk mitigation measure. We fully understand that, once a country is activated in the production environment, SAP will not be able to purge, delete, or conceal the respective country. We accept full responsibility for any consequences that may result from not utilizing the Parallel Line risk mitigation option. Please enable the Configuration Localization Tool (CLT) in the mainline without the Parallel Line (PL) risk mitigation option for the <configuration tenant ID> and <Workspace Details>."

Task.Name: Revise Business Roles and Business Catalogs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to adapt existing Business Catalogs and Business Roles resulting from the addition of new scope items or an upgrade. In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Business Catalogs are periodically revised. Some Business Catalogs will be deprecated and replaced by new ones. The deprecated Business Catalogs in the customer system will be removed two releases later. Hence, it is essential to review the retired Business Catalogs after each release and addition of new scope items and make the necessary changes as soon as possible. You can find more information in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) Release Activities - Action Required accelerator. The SAP Business Role Template Configuration Expert - Business Process Configuration (SAP_BR_BPC_EXPERT) should be checked and adjusted periodically. This role performs business process configuration and other tasks required for implementing SAP solutions. Apps: Business Catalogs Maintain Business Roles Business Role Templates Procedure: Trigger the automatic replacement of deprecated Business Catalog Roles with the new catalog roles from the Business Catalogs app. See the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Identity and Access Management (IAM) Release Activities - Action Required accelerator for step-by-step procedures. Add the new catalogs to existing Business Roles. From the Business Role Templates app, review and apply all missing business catalogs to the Configuration Expert – Business Process Configuration business role. Procedure Notes: It is recommended to use the SAP Business Role Templates only in the Starter System and Development System (e.g., for the fit-to-standard workshop and testing in general). For the Business Roles in the Production System, it is strongly recommended to create your custom business roles based on the identified workplaces. As part of compliance, these custom business roles should then be created and maintained only in the Development System, transported into the Test System, and then forwarded into the Production System via Software Collections. Changing business roles directly in the Production System could cause an error that would put the productive environment and the productive data at greater risk.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Security-Data Protection-IAM, Upgrade

Task.Name: Release and Update Cycles for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to manage updates and upgrades of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With 3-system landscape architecture, software and business configuration or content lifecycles are decoupled. Software updates of S/4HANA systems and reference content upgrades in SAP Central Business Configuration are governed by SAP with predefined schedule. Active business content updates and upgrades are deployed by SAP and scheduled for imports that can be revised by customer. The Release Navigator consolidates essential release content from SAP Product Engineering, SAP User Assistance, SAP Learning, SAP Enterprise Support and other areas of the SAP ecosystem organized by Lines of Business (LoB’s), Industries, and Cross-Topics. Built-in guided tours, created with native SAP Enable Now software, will teach you how to use various SAP tools and websites to locate content when a release comes. The following Release Navigators are available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP Business Technology Platform Release Navigator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Release Navigator for SAP Business Technology Platform Use the accelerator Help - How to get the most of the Release Navigator for SAP BTP for useful information on the usage of Release Navigator. SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap highlights steps before, after during an upgrade. Also reference the Automation Settings and Planned System Behavior for Lifecycle Events accelerator for transport management related details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Evaluate New Functionality
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate new features and functions that are released. These new features and functions are deployed during upgrades and periodic updates.
