Procedure: Explore the SAP methodology and gain familiarity with assessing final activities for solution go live, identification of SAP offerings & services to support go live, and post go live resources using the 5th Onboarding session - Go-Live Preparation one pager accelerator. Review the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Onboarding Journey one pager accelerator to get familiar with the onboarding journey from the welcome and introduction phase to go-live preparation. Tune into both live and recorded onboarding webinars using the Accel ID = S4H_1703.

Task.Name: Direct and Manage Project Execution
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to guide the project manager and team in executing the project management plan and completing the work outlined in the project scope statement. The team will carry out key activities to achieve project objectives, manage resources efficiently, and maintain effective communication. Procedure: Execute project work by performing the following activities: Perform project tasks to achieve objectives. Allocate effort and funds to accomplish project objectives. Staff, train, and manage the assigned project team members. Acquire, manage, and utilize necessary resources. Implement and adhere to the planned methods and standards. Develop, control, verify, and validate project deliverables. Oversee and manage the approved project scope. Identify, assess, and address project risks with the appropriate response actions. Resolve issues and drive them to closure. Integrate approved changes into the scope, plans, and project environment. Establish and maintain effective internal and external communication. Collect project data and report on progress and performance. Monitor and guide work results by performing the following activities: Evaluate actual project performance against the project management plan to identify deviations and implement corrective actions. Assess performance to determine the need for corrective or preventive measures and ensure appropriate follow-up. Track and manage project risks proactively. Provide relevant metrics to support progress tracking, performance reporting, and forecasting. Oversee the implementation of approved changes and take corrective action when necessary. See topic ‘Analytics’ in the SAP Cloud ALM for Implementation - Expert Portal for more information on project monitoring in SAP Cloud ALM. Procedure Note(s): Management plans developed during the Prepare phase guide the team's approach to management, execution, and control of project activities.

Task.Name: Manage Project Issues, Risks, and Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to manage, quantify, and prioritize project issues, risks, and changes. A consistent and thorough approach to managing project issues is essential for an effective project management system. Efficient issue management entails appropriate managerial decision-making and progress tracking in line with the project's issue management procedure. Identified issues are centralized and maintained within a single environment. This ensures that all issues are tracked and managed efficiently, providing visibility and transparency for the project management team. Procedure: Identify the internal and external risks most likely to impact the project. Document and monitor these risks using the Open Issues List Template.xls. Manage the issues documented in the Open Issues List Template.xls by following these steps: Raise and categorize an issue based on its relevance to system conversion, solution implementation, or solution operations within SAP technology. Log the issue in the Open Issues List Template.xls, either by SAP, a customer, or an implementation partner. Assign a priority, develop a mitigation plan, and identify the responsible person when creating the issue. Conduct regular follow-ups on issues in accordance with the standard issue management process defined in the project management plans. Escalate unresolved issues to the next level of governance, if applicable, to maintain project cadence and prevent delays to the go-live timeline. Review critical issues as part of the input for each Quality Gate review meeting. Review and update open issues regularly and communicate these updates to the relevant stakeholder groups as part of the routine project reporting and communication process. Procedure Note(s): Record and monitor all changes, referencing the available accelerators in the accelerator section – including solution-specific tools, if applicable.

Task.Name: Update Project Management Documents
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that the project manager maintains up-to-date key project management documents. The project management plan serves as a comprehensive collection of project documents, including the project schedule, budget and cost information, monitoring and controlling plans, and other relevant information. It provides the foundation for the consistent application of project management practices throughout the project lifecycle. Procedure: Update the project schedule, project budget, management plans, scope document, and business case to reflect the detailed scope information defined during the project. For additional guidance on document management, refer to the solution specific accelerators in the accelerator section. Provide updates to the following documents: Project management plan. Project work breakdown structure (WBS). Project schedule. Project budget. Business case. Scope document. Backlog document (created during the Explore phase).

Task.Name: Communicate Project Status and Progress
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to prepare and communicate project status and progress reports. This includes producing various performance reports tailored to specific audiences and objectives, as defined in the project communication plan. The goal is to ensure clear communication of key activities, deliverable progress, and the project's status in relation to the schedule and budget. Procedure: Provide brief weekly status updates to the team lead via email or during team meetings. Team leads should also submit weekly team status reports to the project manager using the Accel ID = PM.40, which may be reviewed in meetings or submitted in a standard format. Create the weekly project status report based on input from teams and additional data like issue and risk lists. Prepare a monthly or quarterly executive status report for the steering group, reusing key insights from the weekly reports, but adding program value, benefits, and decisions needed from leadership. Regularly review and update the Communication Plan Overview Template as new information becomes available to guide the team's communication approach throughout the project.

Task.Name: Operations Readiness
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to help check the customer’s ability to operate the new SAP solution as of Go-Live.

Task.Name: Tracking Goals
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to track whether the team is operationally ready for the cutover and go-live tasks. Conducted at the beginning and again at the end of the Deploy phase, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey also supports Organizational Change Management activities and invites participants to give recommendations for improvement. Prerequisites: The Readiness for UAT survey results from the Realize phase have been gathered and communicated The recommendations and findings from the Readiness for UAT feedback are understood and, where applicable, corrective actions have been taken. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Tracking Goals’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Readiness for UAT survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Tracking Goals’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Tracking Goals survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Production Cutover
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to execute the cutover plan and prepare the business and system for productive use. The cutover plan contains both business process tasks as well as system tasks. It is executed in the days prior to the go-live date. Examples of potential tasks in the cutover list are as follows. Based on the solution, not all may be applicable. Setting up and initializing the production system Setting up and verifying interface connections Migration or creation of master data Migration of order objects (i.e. purchase orders, sales orders, etc) User creation/access Go/no go decision points Closing the legacy systems Notification of impacted 3rd parties Completing all required documentation for regulatory purposes

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Data Management, Extensibility, Integration, Operations and Support
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Security-Data Protection-IAM

Task.Name: Setup Data Migration in the Production System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to establish and validate the required setup in the production environment to enable the execution of the cutover plan, including all associated data migration activities. Procedure for using Staging Tables: Manually recreate the project and assign the relevant objects in the target tenant. Procedure for Migrating Data Directly from SAP System: Follow the procedure in Help - Transporting Projects to Test and Production to move the migration project to another system.

Task.Name: Execute Cutover Tasks per the Cutover Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to cutover to the productive system, obtain the customer approval (sign-off), validate that the go-live acceptance criteria have been met, and confirm the successful go-live. Procedure: Execute the cutover to Production following the task defined in the cutover plan. Document the actual duration of each step to support future projects. Capture any variances to the plan along with the decision maker who approved the change. The cutover manager(s) should proactively notify task owners of upcoming tasks, to ensure their availability. Regularly communicate status to stakeholders. Test and validate the systems after the cutover has finished. Obtain the production approval sign-off, which documents the agreement with the stakeholders that cutover tasks have been successfully executed. Procedure Note(s): See the accelerator section for related documentation.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP)

Task.Name: System Go-Live
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to confirm the Productive system is live and send the communication to the respective stakeholders.

Task.Name: Set Production System to Live
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to confirm the Productive system is Live and in Run mode. Procedure: Ensure all project activities of the implementation project are set to ‘Completed.’ Execute Go-Live communications. Procedure Note(s): Change projects can still be created in the Development System and transported to the Test System, and forwarded to the Production System. However, additional diligence is necessary when configuring and testing new processes not to impact the current operations. Short transport sprints (1 to 2 weeks) are still recommended when configuring new functionality.

Task.Name: Deploy Phase Closure and Sign-Off
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to ensure that all required deliverables for the current phase and the overall project are complete, accurate, and that any outstanding issues have been resolved. It also serves to identify and document lessons learned during the phase to support a smooth and informed formal phase closure. Additionally, this deliverable captures customer feedback and explores opportunities for potential customer references.

Task.Name: Conduct Project Quality Gate for Deploy Phase
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that both compliance and project management standards are upheld within projects. A Quality Gate is a checklist milestone at the end of a project phase. Prior to moving into the next phase, each project manager must demonstrate compliance with the mandatory deliverables associated with a methodology while ensuring best practice standards have been applied to ensure quality. Procedure: Review the SAP Activate Quality Gate Concept accelerator to ensure an understanding on what should be covered during the Quality Gate. Use the designated Quality Gate Checklist template in the accelerator section to conduct the Quality Gate. Share the Quality Gate results with relevant stakeholders. Identify and implement any necessary follow-up actions based on the Quality Gate results. Procedure Note(s): New additional key deliverables need to be added in the quality gate checklist by the Project Manager to the different project types.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Industry Cloud Apps

Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to deliver the Project Performance survey to the appropriate stakeholder groups throughout the remainder of the implementation. This includes the core project management team and each team working to transform a ‘Line of Business’ (LoB) business process (supply chain, finance, etc). Each team will provide project team-related feedback in terms of governance, processes and empowerment during the Explore, Realize and Deploy phases. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Project Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Project Performance survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Project Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Determine the appropriate frequency of survey (at least quarterly or at end of a phase), noting where other surveys (i.e. Solution Validation) incorporate the same questions, so that they do not coincide with what is already distributed to these same user. Distribute the Project Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommend corrective measures accordingly. Document the outcomes in an executive summary for Sponsor and Steering Committee quarterly business review activities. For LoB teams only, the ‘Tracking Goals’ survey takes over from the Project Performance survey, at that phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Obtain Customer Sign-Off for Phase/Project Completion
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to ensure that all required deliverables from this phase and the project are complete and accurate, and close any outstanding issues. Once sign-off is obtained, the project can move forward to the next phase. Procedure: Identify and list all key deliverables from phase delivery. Confirm the status of completion and any outstanding actions. Utilize the designated Phase Sign-Off Template in the accelerator section to obtain approval by presenting the sign-off document to the nominated signatory. Obtain phase signoff and agreement for any possible outstanding actions.

Task.Name: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Published November 17, 2025
Task.Notes: SAP Activate Content for SAP S/4HANA Cloud. Many thanks to all of the people that contribute and provide feedback!!

Task.Name: Run
Task.Notes: The purpose of this phase is to further optimize and automate the operability of the solution. Operability is the ability to maintain IT systems in a functioning and operating condition, guaranteeing system availability and required performance levels to support the execution of the enterprise’s business operations. Run Phase Activities: Ongoing system operations Continuous change management Continuous learning Continuous improvement Release cycles

Task.Name: Cloud Operation Framework
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to establish operation framework or center to manage and operate the Cloud solution(s) to sustain business operations, continue solution adoption, and make incremental value realization. It includes all activities involved in supporting and managing the lifecycle of providing service by SAP, customers' IT support organization and/or Partner to end users. After the business completes the initial implementation, the focus transitions to ongoing solution adoption.

Task.Name: Establish Operation Center
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to understand the different roles, tasks and tools needed to establish an operation center. Procedure: Review Accel ID = S4H_1977. Form your operation team with recommended personas and RACI matrix in the following operational areas: Monitoring - Monitor systems and processes and observe to detect changes over time. Reference tasks in Operate and Monitor deliverable for examples of ongoing system operation details. Incident management - Manage unplanned event or service interruption by restoring the service to its operational state and minimizing effects on end users. Change management - Seek to minimize the risk associated with changes, including changes to the IT infrastructure, processes, documents, supplier interfaces, etc. Service requests - Managing service requests and support an agreed quality of services, by way of handling user-initiated requests in an efficient and user-friendly manner. Reference task Access SAP Support Service task when creating request to SAP. Test management - Reference test preparation and test execution tasks in SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) on regression test during upgrade. Software lifecycle event management - Reference task Review and Process Hotfix Collection, Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery, and Prepare and Process Upgrade for details of managing release upgrade and updates.

Task.Name: Access SAP Support Service
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to locate and utilize support and services provided by SAP as needed. The primary resource for this is Accel ID = S4H_888, which serves as a gateway to various support and service options available to customers. This includes accessing the Services and Support Dashboard, where customers can search for Knowledge Based Articles and Notes before initiating contact with SAP through methods such as Expert Chat or creating a service request. In the More Resources tab there is My Trust Center that consolidates a customer's view of security and privacy measure, and compliance checks from Accel ID = S4H_2589. Additionally, the Systems and Provisioning Dashboard allows customers to monitor their system(s) status and availability, and subscribe to notifications for timely updates. The Finance and Legal dashboard provides access to important agreement documents, such as Service Level Agreements (SLAs). For more specialized support, customers can refer to SAP Support Offerings and Programs to engage SAP experts who can assist in running solutions and supporting end users. Procedure: Access Accel ID = S4H_888. Search for Support Knowledge. Navigate to various dashboards for legal, service, support, and systems-related customer-specific information. Log a case using the Get Support app. Procedure Note(s): Check product specific accelerators when applicable. Review the SAP Note 3080379 - Customer Penetration Testing Request Process when there is a need to perform an annual penetration test (subject to approval from SAP).

Task.Name: Ongoing System Operations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to perform routine actions to ensure that the system is running as expected by leveraging the established support and operation processes.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Data Management, Integration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure, Testing
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build, Upgrade

Task.Name: Check External Tax Partner Interface
Task.Notes: This task is relevant for customers working with an external tax partner. The purpose of this task is to check for data inconsistencies between the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and the external tax partner interface being used. The 'Manage External Tax Postings' app provides customer with a simple way to check for data inconsistencies between their SAP S/4HANA Cloud system and their tax calculation engine. This should occur weekly and before the month end as errors can impact tax reporting in the external tax partner solution. Apps Used: Manage External Tax Postings Schedule Tax Jobs Procedure: Open the Manage External Tax Postings app. Press "Go" to generate the report and review the 'Reason for Hold" column. If there is one posting with status "Failed with Error", it will keep the other posting pending. Failed updates need to be recognized soon.From the 'Failed with Error' link, customers will be able to determine if the error is an internal error or an external error from the tax partner side. This report can be scheduled to be run in the background via the Schedule Tax Jobs app to display a List of Documents for the External Tax System." Review the Help - Manage External Tax Postings accelerator for more information on how to use the app. Procedure Note(s): The 'Manage External Tax Postings' app doesn't appear the SAP Fiori launchpad by default. It has to first be assigned to the S/4HANA Cloud Home Page.

Task.Name: Manage Posting Periods
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to open and close posting periods at the beginning of each period to ensure that journal entries are posted to proper posting periods. This is necessary periodically (for example, monthly) to continue posting transactions to the ledger. See the Help – Manage Posting Periods and Period-End Closing - Plant (BEI) accelerators for additional information. Procedure: In the Manage Posting Periods app, do a search to display posting period variants. Select a posting period variant you want to change, and choose Set Posting Periods > Open Periods. Change the fiscal year period to open a posting period. Save your changes. Procedure Note(s): The process can be scheduled to avoid manual periodic intervention. To schedule background jobs, choose Set Posting Periods > Schedule Recurrence. Opening a posting period will automatically close the previous period. In addition to normal periods, you can change adjustment periods and CO periods to meet your needs. To see the detailed change log for T001B- Manage Posting Period, create an Service Request with the Subject ‘Providing change Log for T001B: Manage Posting Period’, Description 'Dear Cloud operations team, please provide table logs in S/4HANA Cloud system – special case T001B Manage Posting Periods between period <y> and <x>. Please use internal KBA - 2844952 as a reference' on component XX-S4C-OPR-SRV.

Task.Name: Setup Routines and Adapt Changes for Data Protection
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to define routines for data protection activities, monitor the results, and continuously review the internal data protection requirements as well as the external regulations to adjust data protection configurations. Procedure: Define data archiving routines. This step defines how often and when data archiving should be executed using “Manage Archiving Variant” app. Define data destruction routines. This step defines how often and when data destruction should be executed using APP “Manage Archiving Variant” and “ILM Destruction”. Define master data blocking routines. This step defines routine for executing APP “Block Master Data: Business Partner” and APP “Block master Data: Customer / Supplier”. Monitor data access to sensitive personal information via APP “Read Access Logging Monitor”. Review business processes and include new ILM objects and EoP applications in the configuration scope. Review internal and external data protection requirements to update residence policies and retention policies. Procedure Note(s): Data protection activities are not one-time. Update Design and Configuration Documentation for Data Protection to reflect adjustments in configuration settings for the latest policy changes.

Task.Name: Review Upcoming Regulatory Changes
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to enable users to monitor, assess the business impact, and plan the next steps to ensure compliance. The changes are available in the regulatory change manager tool, which provides contextualized regulatory changes across the globe to help customers to rapidly adapt to new and evolving regulations that. This tool should be checked periodically based on the change frequency of the required countries. Automated email notifications can be enabled in the tool to keep track of relevant regulatory changes. Prerequisite: Have an S-User or P-User ID. Procedure: Watch the “Overview Video” and read about “What is Regulatory Change Manager” in Accel ID = S4H_461. Access the Regulatory Change Manager tool and personalize your view and notifications. Monitor the regulatory changes related to your countries and determine action plans. Implement action plans where necessary.

Task.Name: Monitor SAP Build Process Automation Jobs
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to monitor the SAP Build Process Automation Jobs A job is scheduled to execute SAP Build Process Automation Bots at a specified day and time in Set up Artificial Intelligence in Production System deliverable of the Realize phase. Procedure: Login to SAP Build Process Automation Tenant and monitor the job in 'Monitor' Tab. SAP Build offers several interlinked views for Process and Workflow Instances, Automation Jobs, Automation Overview, Visibility Scenarios, Business Rules, Triggers, and Acquired Events. All can be accessed using dedicated tiles in the SAP Build Work Zone. Procedure Note(s): See the 'Monitoring Processes' section within the accelerator Help - SAP Build Process Automation for additional information.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, SAP Build, Upgrade

Task.Name: Security Operations
Task.Notes: The purpose of this Task is to keep the system secure, maintain compliance, and fulfil audit requirements. Procedure: Following the plans from the "Prepare" phase, log monitoring, access reviews, configuration monitoring, and certificate management are ongoing activities. These activities ensure systems stay secure. Regular monitoring of logs for: Business data change documents Business user change log Business role change log Security audit logs Regular Identity and Access Management (IAM) reviews for: Business Users Business Roles Communication Users For certificate management, the following tasks are essential for outbound connections: To prevent certificates used in integrations from expiring, update certificate trust lists regularly. For auto-updates, review the certificates that SAP marks as untrusted. Evaluate the potential impact on outbound API communications. Delete certificates as needed. Additionally, configuration monitoring should be performed as defined in the 'Prepare' phase. These steps are essential to ensure the ongoing security and operational integrity of the systems

Task.Name: Release and Update Cycles for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to manage updates and upgrades of SAP S/4HANA Cloud. With 3-system landscape architecture, software and business configuration or content lifecycles are decoupled. Software updates of S/4HANA systems and reference content upgrades in SAP Central Business Configuration are governed by SAP with predefined schedule. Active business content updates and upgrades are deployed by SAP and scheduled for imports that can be revised by customer. The Release Navigator consolidates essential release content from SAP Product Engineering, SAP User Assistance, SAP Learning, SAP Enterprise Support and other areas of the SAP ecosystem organized by Lines of Business (LoB’s), Industries, and Cross-Topics. Built-in guided tours, created with native SAP Enable Now software, will teach you how to use various SAP tools and websites to locate content when a release comes. The following Release Navigators are available for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and SAP Business Technology Platform Release Navigator for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Release Navigator for SAP Business Technology Platform Use the accelerator Help - How to get the most of the Release Navigator for SAP BTP for useful information on the usage of Release Navigator. SAP Activate for Upgrade of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (3-system landscape) roadmap highlights steps before, after during an upgrade. Also reference the Automation Settings and Planned System Behavior for Lifecycle Events accelerator for transport management related details.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure

Task.Name: Evaluate New Functionality
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate new features and functions that are released. These new features and functions are deployed during upgrades and periodic updates. It is important to evaluate new features and functions for the following purposes: Determine new functions and features for implementation to meet continuously changing business needs. Fulfill delta requirements that require custom development efforts and didn't make to the project backlog. Replace custom developments with SAP standard functions to reduce implementation and maintenance efforts. Procedure: Review product road map for features and functions planned for upcoming release using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Road Map Explorer. Use What's New Viewer accelerator to review the latest features and functions that are released with updates and upgrades. Some features require activation. Refer to the Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery task for additional details. Others need to be deployed from SAP Central Business Configuration. Refer to task Review and Process Hotfix Collection and Prepare and Process Upgrade for business content activation details. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by accessing the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Check SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Restriction accelerator to be aware of exception cases with current release. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new functionalities. Initiate planning of project to introduce new feature and function to users. Procedure Note(s): Use Valid as Of filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective release(s). Updates are indicated by a suffix like .1, .2, following major release number. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scope in Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. For customer using SAP Cloud ALM, access Upcoming Event card or tile in the Overview app to see upcoming upgrades and use the Impact Assessment link to access the RASD from SAP Cloud ALM. SAP aligns the dates on which new innovations, enhancements, and corrections of associated products are delivered so that they work as an integrated solution. Check SAP Note 2888562 - Harmonized release calendar for SAP Cloud products when applicable.

Task.Name: Review and Process Hotfix Collection
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to review information associated with the release of hotfix collection that is deployed to all systems on the same weekend every 2 weeks in the months where no upgrade is planned. Customer should use this information to: Inform the user about the timing of a fix to a previously reported issue Allow planning of business activities around downtime Plan ongoing project tasks around systems' lock phase period before downtime Complete changes in SAP Central Business Configuration and align configuration in all SAP S/4HANA Cloud systems Procedure: Follow the steps described in Knowledge-Based Articles for Known Regression Issues accelerator to understand possible workarounds and find out the Hotfix Collection delivery date when a fix to a previously reported issue will be delivered. Review information in Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule for the latest on: Starter, Development, Test and Production system downtimes. System locks for Import and Export of transports in Development, Test and Production System locks for Configuration and Extensibility Refrain from scheduling activities into development sprints and plan around the downtime and system lock phase period. Check limitation and recommendation details (i.e transports, scope activation, etc) before and during the SAP pre-processing window in the Software Lifecycle Management accelerator. If business content is included in the Hotfix Collection: Notification message of ongoing update will appear in SAP Central Business Configuration Workspace. These updates will be automatically deployed to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Starter system (if not retired) and Development system. A Transport Request is created in Customizing Tenant of the system during deployment. This Transport Request of updated content and associated Task are automatically released upon successful checks performed in the background. This Transport Request is scheduled (or automatically, if simple transport mode is enabled) to be imported to Test System, forwarded to Production System, and then imported to Production System. Customer can revise or suspend the default schedule for moving the transport across the landscape using Import Collection app. In case of error during deployment, SAP Cloud Operations team will be notified to address with customer. Task within the Transport Request can only be released by SAP. Additional Transport Request may be created by SAP to fix issue. Customer may need to release dependent transports and release transport request(s) related to the content updates manually. Procedure Note(s): When reference to Production system, activities are only applicable to live customer. It is recommended as a good practice to immediately deploy business content updates to all S/4HANA system each time when there is one. To view a list of corrections included in the Hotfix Collection, go to the Patch Collection Information note in the useful link section of the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator, and download the pdf document that contains a list of affected component ID and description of corrections. Access configuration activities from SAP Central Business Configuration is possible until SAP S/4HANA Cloud system enters down-time. Check Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator for exact timing. Organizational structure enhancements, adding new scope or country/region is possible until the content update is triggered and the project in SAP Central Business Configuration is locked. Check SAP Note - 3215993 - Software Update & Upgrade for actual project block timing. Reference Hotfix Collection Deployment Restrictions for a summary of limitations on project activities. Reference Help - Transport Mode for more information on selecting simple or flexible mode of transport management process.

Task.Name: Review Reports for Release Updates
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to review the reports for any product release enhancements and/or changes as it relates to standard and custom reports. As enhancements of the solution are released or retired, the project team should verify the reports are running as expected or if there are any areas of the reports which need to be updated or modified accordingly such as new reporting features, new filtering options, and new content which can be reported on within the solution. Procedure Step(s): Review the latest release notes for the solution to ensure there is no impact to the reports which are used in the project such as features, display, filtering, tables, and data. Review all custom reports to ensure the latest product features do not impact the reports in the solution and make any adjustments as necessary to run the reports successfully. Review any errors which occur when running the reports and correct them. Once errors are corrected, test and run the report to ensure errors have been resolved. Procedure Note(s): This task should be routinely reviewed with each solution release where updates are applicable. Any reports which are running slowly can be due to many reasons including: selection from large data set, reporting errors, and/or connection errors, etc. Note errors which reports may be generating to analyze and to avoid them in the future.

Task.Name: Evaluate and Activate Feature from Continuous Delivery
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate and activate, when needed, new functionalities provided in frequent updates from SAP between major upgrades. These updates will give customers access to new capabilities in a nondisruptive manner. Continuous Delivery for S/4HANA Cloud accelerator provides an overview of this service. Some features require customer activation when initially released. Functionality which can be activated has the following characteristics: It is by default not available in the customer system landscape until it is activated in Activate Features app. Activation needs to be performed in each system, Starter (if not retired yet), Development, Test and Production system, respectively. Activation of functionality via this app is NOT reversible. Proper testing should be executed before activation in Production system. A toggle introduced in an update has a limited lifetime. In the next release or the one following, the functionality will be released for all customers. Procedure: Use the What's New Viewer accelerator to get an overview of new and updated features and functions. Understand the impact of the changes to your current implementation scope by using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Release Assessment and Scope Dependency accelerator via S-user ID. Reference Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule accelerator to find out the release time of new features. Use "Preparation Required" filter in What's New Viewer accelerator to view feature requires preparation work from customer. Follow steps in the Help - Activate Features accelerator to switch on selected feature, when applicable. Perform activation and business configuration setting adjustments from SAP Central Business Configuration, when applicable. Test and release the new feature. Procedure Note(s): Use the "Valid as Of" filter in What's New Viewer to select the respective continuous delivery service(s). An update version is indicated by the release upgrade followed by a suffix such as .1, or .2. For example, SAP S/4HANA Cloud 2108.1 is the first update after major release 2108. Availability of feature updates can be found in the Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule with label YYMM.n, indicating continuous delivery service n for product version YYMM. Feature updates are executed the same way as Hotfix Collection technically. Reference task Review and Process Hotfix Collection for transport request behavior and process for content updates. Impact analysis is based on customer's used and activated scopes in the Test or Production System. Reference Blog - Release Assessment and Scope Dependency posts in SAP community to see updated information with regard to the tool. Customers have the option to perform regression test, if desired, by leveraging the Post Upgrade Tests from the Test Your Process app, under the Post Upgrade Test tab. To access Activate Features app, search it in tree view of Implementation Activities app in S/4HANA Cloud or Business Process Configuration app in SAP Central Business Configuration, Product-Specific Configuration phase.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support

Task.Name: Prepare and Process Upgrade
Task.Notes: The purpose of the task is to execute periodic upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud. Customer should use the specific Upgrade project in SAP Cloud ALM and tasks from SAP Activate S/4HANA Cloud Upgrade roadmap to prepare for the upgrade, complete regression testing, update business roles and business content when appropriate. It is recommended to start the preparation steps at least 2 weeks before the start of Test system upgrade. It is a best practice to have a dedicated sprint for upgrade related activities and focusing on regression testing. Procedure: Review Upgrade and Maintenance Schedule - 3 System Landscape accelerator for actual timing and Software Lifecycle Management accelerator for behind-the-scenes details. Launch and start upgrade project. Follow tasks in SAP Activate for Upgrade of S/4HANA Cloud roadmap to prepare and complete regression testing in Test System. Revise business roles immediately after the software upgrade in Production system. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. Plan and execute the business content upgrade with regression testing before the next major release. See task in upgrade roadmap for more details. For customers with a parallel line, consider that additional information and recommendations are required for your main and project line during your software and content upgrades. For details, see section Upgrades in a Parallel Line in Accel ID = S4H_2535. Procedure Note(s): To access the upgrade roadmap from SAP Activate Roadmap Viewer main page, go to Explore All Roadmaps and select the Upgrade Methodology tab. For customer who uses SAP Cloud ALM, select ‘SAP S/4HANA Cloud 3-system landscape - Upgrade task template' when setting up project in Projects and Setup app. For customer who has an existing ERP system and adopting a Two-Tier enterprise resource planning (ERP) strategy for the S/4HANA Cloud implementation, it is important to notify users running the existing ERP system with regard to the downtime and plan business and project activities accordingly.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Hybrid Deployment (Two-Tier ERP), Parallel Line, Upgrade

Task.Name: Continuous Improvement
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to continually improve the organizational efficiencies through expanded use of the system(s) functionality.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: Application Design and Configuration, Operations and Support, Technical Architecture & Infrastructure
2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, Transport Management

Task.Name: Participate in the SAP Customer Influence and Adoption Program
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to participate in the SAP Customer Influence and Adoption program. This program enables users to influence SAP product development, adopt new innovations early on, and request specific enhancements or requests. Procedure: Review the benefits and available services of the Customer Influence and Adoption program in the Accel ID = S4H_2892. Learn how to get started in the “Learn how to Join” section of the Accel ID = S4H_2892. Visit the Customer Influence and Adoption website to browse available opportunities. Procedure Note(s): To provide future guidance on SAP Activate, including the SAP Roadmap Viewer and Implementation Portal content, refer to the Customer Influence and Adoption page in the SAP Customer Influence for SAP Activate accelerator.

Task.Name: User Adoption Analysis
Task.Notes: The purpose of this deliverable is to promote widespread acceptance of the implemented SAP Cloud solution post go-live. Increased user adoption is crucial for users to navigate the new system effectively and operate it seamlessly. A systematic evaluation of users’ interactions with the new system and adherence to new processes helps pinpoint obstacles and issues hindering user acceptance. The analysis of user adoption is set up by the change manager in collaboration with project management and relevant business areas. Given the regular updates to SAP Cloud solutions, establishing ongoing monitoring processes for user adoption post-project completion is essential. Additionally, it is highly recommended to implement support structures and delegate responsibilities within the organization to drive and sustain user adoption.

Task.Name: Measure Objective User Adoption Metrics
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to measure user adoption post go-live. It is recommended that the users have been working with the new SAP solution for a period of eight to ten weeks before assessing the current level of user adoption. This timeframe allows for the collection of data related to pre-defined KPIs and ensures reliable information regarding the actual usage of the system. As the objective data concerning the system usage may be used to monitor individual employee performance, it is imperative to guarantee that this information is only analyzed at an aggregated level, adhering to all data privacy regulations. Additionally, compliance with regional laws necessitates the involvement of the works council. Therefore, the preparation for tracking this objective data should be done well in advance. Procedure: Agree on the KPIs and system usage data to be assessed using the List of User Adoption Metrics accelerator. Define the target audience, timing, and duration for conducting the user adoption analysis. Gather and analyze the data pertaining to user adoption. Procedure Note(s): WalkMe is a digital adoption platform that helps organizations enhance user onboarding and enablement throughout their transformation journey with SAP solutions. It offers interactive guides, walkthroughs, and valuable insights into user behavior with targeted applications. Explore how WalkMe works by joining the WalkMe Interactive Demo and experiencing its features in action. Consult with your SAP Account Executive to discuss trials, demos, and license entitlement for WalkMe.

Task.Name: Measure User Experience with Respect to the SAP System
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to evaluate the user’s perspective on the implemented SAP solution and the newly introduced business processes, typically through a survey-based approach. The questionnaire is designed to gauge the users’ acceptance and their willingness to work with the new system, serving as an indicator for user adoption. Additionally, various influencing factors are measured to identify strengths or obstacles for user adoption during the run phase. Prior to conducting the analysis, decisions need to be made regarding the target audience (e.g. specific user groups), timing, duration, survey platform, and key principles such as ensuring the confidentiality and anonymity of the collected data. The preparation also involves creating communication materials for users, including invitation and reminder emails for the survey. When planning the data collection, it is recommended to incorporate open-ended questions, as these facilitate the later data analysis. Furthermore, providing feedback on the survey results to participants is essential. Procedure: Define survey topics and create the questionnaire using the User Adoption Analysis Sample Questions accelerator. Establish the user adoptions survey using the preferred survey tool for data collection, such as Qualtrics, and prepare necessary communication materials. Conduct the user adoption survey, analyze and report the captured experience data.

Task.Name: Develop User Adoption Plan
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to identify key areas for improving the user adoption of the implemented SAP solution. By combining objective data on system usage with the users’ perceptions of working with the system, valuable insights are gained regarding levers for enhancing user adoption and monitoring the success of associated activities. The acquired information can be aggregated and visualized, such as by user group, business function, or location, to unveil areas with low user adoption rates. The analysis of results aids in interpreting the data and identifying strategic areas such as usability, and enablers for boosting user adoption, like training. Clear recommendations can be derived, and responsibilities can be assigned to experts. All activities should be thoroughly documented, and if necessary, change and communication plans should be adjusted based on the findings. Procedure: Combine and analyze objective user data and survey findings. Derive and document insights and recommendations using the User Adoption Plan accelerator. Communicate key results and activities to relevant stakeholders and users.

Task.Name: Value Management
Task.Notes: The purpose of the deliverable is to ensure the customer plans for long-term value management strategy. Review previous recommendations to determine if the benefits have been realized and what further opportunities should be fed back into the continuous learning phase. This would help in ensuring expected benefits are realized in the long term, and that any gaps which might develop are addressed.

Task.Name: Perform Benchmarking Assessment for Value Realization Comparison
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to re-evaluate the business process benchmarking collaboratively with Line of Business heads. This exercise helps to understand the benefits realized on the process maturity and the key performance indicators after the implementation of SAP S/4HANA Cloud by comparing the results taken during the Discover phase. The SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment includes key business performance metrics and best practices for all process areas covered by SAP S/4HANA, such as: Procurement, Sales, Service, R&D Engineering, Supply Chain, Manufacturing, Asset Management, Finance, Human Resources, and Information Technology. Upon participation, you will receive a personalized scorecard in real-time showcasing the Key Performance Indicator (KPI) analysis and process maturity gap on best practices in comparison to industry peers. Prerequisites: The SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment was performed during the Discover phase or before the go-live of the SAP S/4HANA Cloud solution to establish a baseline of the business processes. Procedure: Complete the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment. For detailed, step-by-step guidance, refer to the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Benchmarking Assessment - Overview.pdf accelerator. Download the results and compare the results from the baseline assessment to determine the value realized. Leverage continuous benchmarking tools and scorecards for on-going value realization efforts. Procedure Note(s): For additional support or examples, refer to the accelerators available in the accelerator sections. For any questions about the SAP S/4HANA Benchmarking Assessment or SAP’s Performance Benchmarking Program, please contact valuemanagement@sap.com.

Task.Name: Assess Solution Performance
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to periodically deliver a Solution Performance survey to the end users, so that their feedback can drive improvements in solution usability, stability, speed, support, compatibility etc. The results will offer important insight into how the solution can be improved, throughout the Run phase. Prerequisites: The solution is live for customer end-users. Procedure: Review the recommendations of the ‘Solution Performance’ section of the XM Transformation Procedures.pptx accelerator. Identify the survey and reporting recipient groups, listed in the above section of the accelerator, and inform them they are participating in the XM transformation program. Provide these groups (especially report recipients) with enablement on how to use the Readiness for UAT survey and/or interpret the reporting results. Go to the ‘Survey Q’ tab of the XM Transformation Survey Questions.xlsx accelerator and locate the survey questions, by filtering on the ‘Solution Performance’ column. Adapt the survey to the current transformation, finalize and publish. Distribute the Solution Performance survey. Once the survey response collection period is over, finalize the dashboard and use it to communicate the feedback to report recipients, with follow-up meetings to discuss the findings and recommending corrective measures accordingly. Procedure Note(s): If the process is unclear, engage with the XM Advisory experts from your XM vendor, SAP or implementation partner for assistance. If the customer prefers, and has the technology, they can set up the Solution Performance survey as a continuous feedback tab inside the solution, rather than ask end users to answer a periodic survey.

ExtendedAttribute.Value: 2nd Wave Project / Rollout Project, XM Transformation

Task.Name: Monitor Functional Usage Adoption & Consumption - SAP Cloud ERP
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to monitor the customer’s adoption and consumption based on functional usage data, enabling them to make informed decisions according to their own usage patterns. Procedure: Login in to SAP for Me using your S-user. Review license consumption across solution areas in Finance & Legal - Consumption. Access additional product usage details in Portfolio & Products - Product Usage Select the relevant solution to view detailed information on feature usage. Review the Blog - Customer Usage Dashboard 2nd Edition for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition for more information on features for the Customer Usage Dashboard.

Task.Name: Review Business Processes with the CQC for Process Adoption Service
Task.Notes: The purpose of this task is to leverage the continuous quality check (CQC) for process adoption service to help you enhance and adopt new business processes within SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Procedure: Review the CQC for Process Adoption Info Sheet to become familiar with the service offering. Request the service through one of the following options: Option 1: Use the Accel ID = S4H_2370. Option 2: Access the SAP Enterprise Support Value Maps (sign-up required - see the task Access the SAP Enterprise Support Cloud ERP (Public) Value Map for details). In the value map, go to the “Continuous Quality Check” tab and select “Request CQC for Process Adoption." If you have any questions about the service, post them on the value map platform. Procedure Note(s) The CQC for process adoption service is included in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition contract. There are no extra fees required for this service.
